Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Apoteket genomgår en spännande förändring mot en datadriven kultur i hela organisationen. Med modern teknik utvecklar vi vår förmåga att tillvarata värdet i vår data och vi letar nu efter en person som kommer ha en avgörande roll i denna förändringsresa. Som Data Engineer på Apoteket är du med och bidrar i vårt viktiga arbete för ett liv i hälsa – för varje individ och samhället i stort.




Som Data Enginner ingår du i team Data Analytics på Apoteket Tech, en funktion som spelar en avgörande roll i bolagets digitala transformation. Teamet består idag av sex medarbetare och fem konsulter och ansvarar för såväl BI, avancerad analys och data governance. Apotekets tekniska förmåga för analys pågår just nu en omfattande modernisering då Apoteket lämnar en dataplattform on-prem och utvecklar av en ny i Azure.




Data Engineer på Apoteket

I rollen som Data Engineer kommer du arbeta med att designa, utveckla och optimera vår dataplattform och datainfrastruktur. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i att möjliggöra datadrivna beslut och skapa insikter som stärker vårt erbjudande och vår service till våra kunder. Apoteket har idag en av Sveriges största kundklubbar med över 3,5 miljoner medlemmar och 2024 genomfördes över cirka 100 miljoner kundbesök vilket gör Apoteket till rätt arbetsplats för dig som gillar data.




Dina huvudsakliga arbetsområden

Utveckla och förvalta integrationer och dataflöden mellan den centrala dataplattformen och omkringliggande systemstöd
Implementera datakvalitetskontroller och säkerställa att data är korrekt, konsistent och aktuell.
Förbereda data för BI och avancerad analys, såsom AI /ML för prediktion eller segmentering.
Utveckla arkitekturen i såväl datalager som teknisk plattform för att möta verksamhetens behov i samråd med arkitekter.
Samarbeta med data scientists, data analysts och slutanvändare vid utveckling av analys och beslutsstöd.
Utforska och introducera nya teknologier, ramverk och verktyg för att förbättra datahanteringen.




Dina kompetenser

Du är trygg i din tekniska expertis och tar välgrundade beslut med ett tydligt fokus på målet. Du är resultatorienterad, tar ansvar för hela processen och ser till att lösningar genomförs effektivt.

Med nyfikenhet, en stark analytisk förmåga och affärsfokus letar du ständiga förbättringar för att säkerställa värde över tid.




Utöver detta vill vi att du har

Relevant utbildning inom system-, information- eller datavetenskap, matematik, statistik eller AI/ML
Minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete i en liknande roll som Data Engineer
Erfarenhet av integration, ETL/ELT-flöden och SQL
Erfarenhet av molnplattformar som GCP, Azure eller AWS
Goda kunskaper i programmering, exempelvis Python
Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift




Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att arbeta som Data Engineer inom retail eller reglerad verksamhet såsom försäkring, bank eller apoteksbranschen. Det är också en fördel om du har erfarenhet av att arbeta i en projektledande roll.







När det känns rätt

Fundera inte för länge. Låt oss i stället berätta om rollen och om verksamheten så kan du sen avgöra om det känns rätt för dig. Ansök nu!

Vi vill att din ansökan består av ditt CV samt svar på våra urvalsfrågor. Du behöver alltså inte skicka med ett personligt brev. Urvalsfrågorna hjälper oss att bättre förstå din erfarenhet och dina kvalifikationer för den aktuella rollen och öka vår träffsäkerhet.

Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.

Välkommen till Apoteket!

Show more
HTML:
Apoteket genomgår en spännande förändring mot en datadriven kultur i hela organisationen. Med modern teknik utvecklar vi vår förmåga att tillvarata värdet i vår data och vi letar nu efter en person som kommer ha en avgörande roll i denna förändringsresa. Som Data Engineer på Apoteket är du med och bidrar i vårt viktiga arbete för ett liv i hälsa – för varje individ och samhället i stort.


Som Data Enginner ingår du i team Data Analytics på Apoteket Tech, en funktion som spelar en avgörande roll i bolagets digitala transformation. Teamet består idag av sex medarbetare och fem konsulter och ansvarar för såväl BI, avancerad analys och data governance. Apotekets tekniska förmåga för analys pågår just nu en omfattande modernisering då Apoteket lämnar en dataplattform on-prem och utvecklar av en ny i Azure.


Data Engineer på Apoteket

I rollen som Data Engineer kommer du arbeta med att designa, utveckla och optimera vår dataplattform och datainfrastruktur. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i att möjliggöra datadrivna beslut och skapa insikter som stärker vårt erbjudande och vår service till våra kunder. Apoteket har idag en av Sveriges största kundklubbar med över 3,5 miljoner medlemmar och 2024 genomfördes över cirka 100 miljoner kundbesök vilket gör Apoteket till rätt arbetsplats för dig som gillar data.


Dina huvudsakliga arbetsområden

  • Utveckla och förvalta integrationer och dataflöden mellan den centrala dataplattformen och omkringliggande systemstöd
  • Implementera datakvalitetskontroller och säkerställa att data är korrekt, konsistent och aktuell.
  • Förbereda data för BI och avancerad analys, såsom AI /ML för prediktion eller segmentering.
  • Utveckla arkitekturen i såväl datalager som teknisk plattform för att möta verksamhetens behov i samråd med arkitekter.
  • Samarbeta med data scientists, data analysts och slutanvändare vid utveckling av analys och beslutsstöd.
  • Utforska och introducera nya teknologier, ramverk och verktyg för att förbättra datahanteringen.


Dina kompetenser

Du är trygg i din tekniska expertis och tar välgrundade beslut med ett tydligt fokus på målet. Du är resultatorienterad, tar ansvar för hela processen och ser till att lösningar genomförs effektivt.

Med nyfikenhet, en stark analytisk förmåga och affärsfokus letar du ständiga förbättringar för att säkerställa värde över tid.


Utöver detta vill vi att du har

  • Relevant utbildning inom system-, information- eller datavetenskap, matematik, statistik eller AI/ML
  • Minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete i en liknande roll som Data Engineer
  • Erfarenhet av integration, ETL/ELT-flöden och SQL
  • Erfarenhet av molnplattformar som GCP, Azure eller AWS
  • Goda kunskaper i programmering, exempelvis Python
  • Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att arbeta som Data Engineer inom retail eller reglerad verksamhet såsom försäkring, bank eller apoteksbranschen. Det är också en fördel om du har erfarenhet av att arbeta i en projektledande roll.



När det känns rätt

Fundera inte för länge. Låt oss i stället berätta om rollen och om verksamheten så kan du sen avgöra om det känns rätt för dig. Ansök nu!

Vi vill att din ansökan består av ditt CV samt svar på våra urvalsfrågor. Du behöver alltså inte skicka med ett personligt brev. Urvalsfrågorna hjälper oss att bättre förstå din erfarenhet och dina kvalifikationer för den aktuella rollen och öka vår träffsäkerhet.

Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.

Välkommen till Apoteket!

Title: Junior Analytics Engineer
Description:
Job Title:  Junior Analytics Engineer

Job Type: Starting with internship, with potential to turn into full-time employment

Location: Stockholm, Sweden 

Job Summary:

We are looking for a motivated Junior Analytics Engineer to join our team, starting as an intern with the opportunity to transition into a full-time role in the summer. This is a great opportunity for a recent graduate or final-year student with a strong technical background and a passion for analytics in mechanical and production systems.

We are looking for someone with a keen interest and knowledge in the following areas: 

What You’ll Do:


Work with mechanical systems and production machinery data
Develop analytics solutions using Python and signal processing techniques (FFT, filters, etc.)
Assist in extracting insights from machine data to improve efficiency and performance
Collaborate with engineers to enhance data-driven decision-making


Must-haves 


Knowledge of mechanical systems  
Understanding of production machinery
Python 
Signal Processing (FFT, Filters, etc.) 


Nice to have


Software Engineering Fundamentals
SQL


What’s in it for you?   


Being a young company it’s all about the people - we’re a bunch of passionate and driven people with whom you will have a great time.   
Psychological safety and internal trust - flexible working hours, high expectations combined with a humane approach to work/life balance.  
Flat organization - we hire you because we believe in you. So challenge what we take for granted, express yourself and wear what you always dreamed of wearing to work, have fun, participate and make this the company you always dreamed of working for. 


How To Apply   

To apply, please contact us at career@ipercept.io Submit a resume and cover letter outlining your interest and relevant experience

About IPercept

Imagine knowing the mechanical health of a machine without touching it, being alerted well in advance before something breaks, understanding how a machine is truly being used, and identifying what needs attention on a component level before visiting the machine.

At IPercept, we make this possible. Our insights help manufacturers understand their machines’ true state and usage throughout the machine life-cycle, achieving a 30% increase in efficiency. This quick ROI is realized by minimizing downtime, enhancing productivity, and reducing scrap rates, tooling costs, maintenance parts, and energy consumption.

In just two years, over 20 of Europe’s largest manufacturers have trusted us, and none have looked back.

We look forward to seeing your application!

/ IPercept Team

Title: Senior Risk Data Analyst to SEB Kort I Stockholm
Description:
Are you a strong team player who thrives in a data driven environment? We are looking for a Senior Risk Data Analyst to join our Risk & Capital Management team in SEB Kort.

SEB Kort Bank is a fully owned subsidiary of SEB, operating mainly in the Nordics, Central Europe and North America after recently acquiring AirPlus. SEB Kort’s business targets two strategic areas; corporates and consumers. In both areas, SEB Kort works from two different brand perspectives: our own brands, and several partner brands. Following the acquisition of AirPlus an integral part is to merge the businesses and become a leading provider of corporate payment solutions in Europe with a global reach.

About The Role

SEB Kort’s Risk & Capital management function is a team of eight people currently placed in Stockholm, however, the position is open for all our Nordic home markets. The main focus areas are credit risk optimization and governance, development of pricing models to increase profitability as well as regulatory adherence.

In the role as senior risk data analyst your main responsibilities will be in the areas of:


Developing the infrastructure and quality of data to comply with regulatory frameworks, such as the Basel frameworks and EBA guidelines
You will be responsible for the governance of our IRB models and ensuring data flows and quality controls
You will have a crucial role in the development of the risk management processes
You will be working closely with the business, IT and other stakeholders across SEB Kort, as well as in SEB Group


To thrive in this role, we believe you have

You can successfully co-operate with other stakeholders and take responsibility for ongoing projects. You need to be analytical and structured since you will work not only with large data sets but also complex processes. You have a drive to continuously develop.

Your preferred background:


5+ years of relevant experience from credit risk regulations and risk data infrastructure
Analytical skills and knowledge to handle complex information
Programming skills in SAS and SQL queries or equivalent
Relevant university degree
Good stakeholder management skills and the ability to collaborate cross-divisionally
Proficient in spoken and written English and a Scandinavian language


What we offer


An opportunity to develop risk management capabilities and be a close partner to the business.
Innovative working environment with highly motivated colleagues.
International environment with extensive learning opportunities.
Friendly and welcoming culture.


Ready to take the next step on your career journey?

Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 23th of March 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Louies Abrahamsson Kwetczer at louise.abrahamssonkwetczer@seb.se or Talent Acquisition Partner Sebastian Vesterlund at sebastian.vesterlund @seb.se

Learn more about working at SEB www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.

Job Description

Designing and implementing scalable data pipelines in an Azure cloud environment to ingest, process, and store large volumes of data, ensuring quality and integrity.

Enhancing and maintaining a Databricks-based data lakehouse, creating efficient data models tailored for AI and analytics.

Establishing monitoring systems and data governance practices to ensure performance and compliance.

Collaborating with software engineers to integrate automation data, determining the best approach between batch or streaming processing based on use case requirements.

Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)


5 years of experience in the data engineering field
Proficiency in SQL and Python
Cloud experience, preferably with Azure
Experience with orchestration tools such as Apache Airflow or Azure Data Factory
Experience with data warehousing solutions, preferably Databricks
Experience of event-driven architecture and role-based data access


Meritorious


Management/lead experience
Familiarity with BI tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform
Contributions to open-source projects


Application deadline: 18-03-2025

About Us

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!

🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.

🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.

🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.

💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.

🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?

🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.

📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.

🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Your Role as a Data Engineer

In this role, you will work with our customers on various data engineering projects. This role is perfect for those with a good foundation in data engineering, and a passion for operational excellence in data management and analytics. You will design, build, and maintain efficient, scalable data pipelines and work closely with data scientists, analysts, and stakeholders deliver customized data solutions that drive impactful business decisions.

In this role, you will


Develop and manage scalable data pipelines, ensuring efficient and reliable data flows.
Implement processes and solutions to improve data quality, accuracy, and consistency.
Create scripts and tools to automate repetitive tasks, improving efficiency and reducing manual work.
Build and maintain data integrations, including file, messaging, and API-based systems.
Develop data models tailored to meet business requirements.
Contribute to implementing infrastructure as code solutions.
Collaborate with data scientists, architects, and software developers to support the creation of data architecture and governance models.
Enhance the performance of existing data pipelines, optimizing queries and indexing for faster data retrieval.
Implement security measures to protect data from unauthorized access.
Ensure compliance with data governance policies and regulatory requirements, maintaining documentation and data lineage.
Monitor cost efficiency and identify areas for optimization.
Show more

Your Role as a Data Engineer

In this role, you will work with our customers on various data engineering projects. This role is perfect for those with a good foundation in data engineering, and a passion for operational excellence in data management and analytics. You will design, build, and maintain efficient, scalable data pipelines and work closely with data scientists, analysts, and stakeholders deliver customized data solutions that drive impactful business decisions.

In this role, you will

  • Develop and manage scalable data pipelines, ensuring efficient and reliable data flows.
  • Implement processes and solutions to improve data quality, accuracy, and consistency.
  • Create scripts and tools to automate repetitive tasks, improving efficiency and reducing manual work.
  • Build and maintain data integrations, including file, messaging, and API-based systems.
  • Develop data models tailored to meet business requirements.
  • Contribute to implementing infrastructure as code solutions.
  • Collaborate with data scientists, architects, and software developers to support the creation of data architecture and governance models.
  • Enhance the performance of existing data pipelines, optimizing queries and indexing for faster data retrieval.
  • Implement security measures to protect data from unauthorized access.
  • Ensure compliance with data governance policies and regulatory requirements, maintaining documentation and data lineage.
  • Monitor cost efficiency and identify areas for optimization.

Title: Analytics Lead, Merchant
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

We are looking for an Analytics Lead to join Wolt’s Merchant mission in Helsinki or Stockholm!

About The Role

As an Analytics Lead at Wolt, you’ll take charge of the Merchant Ops Team, balancing hands-on analytics work with people management responsibilities. Experience in Product and Operations would be a significant advantage. In Wolt’s fast-paced, three-sided marketplace, you’ll find a demanding yet rewarding environment to hone your modern analytics skills.

You will have the opportunity to…


Lead and grow a team of talented data scientists
Set the strategic direction for all analytical work within the Merchant domain
Establish a solid experimentation culture with your Product and operational stakeholders
Coach your team and participate hands-on in developing new metrics for the business
This role combines scientific expertise with stakeholder engagement, placing you at the forefront of driving business outcomes. You will collaborate closely with the Product, Engineering, Design, and Operations teams to guide measurement strategies and tactical decisions, helping to expand the Wolt platform globally.


If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos, are excited to build a team and solutions from the ground up, and have a proven track record in using data science to solve business problems, we want you on our team. Take ownership of business outcomes and proactively drive change with Wolt!

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind. Read more about how we work.
Uncover foundational causal relationships in our data that can help us understand our business.
Drive strategic decision-making within the whole Merchant Group.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Have 5+ years of experience in a data science or analytics position within an industry or research setting
Have 2+ years of experience in team leadership within an industry or research setting, with the ability to inspire, motivate, and influence cross-functional teams to achieve organizational goals and deliver exceptional results.
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation, and regression analysis using statistical software packages in Python, Matlab, R, or equivalent
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach
Be analytical, inquisitive, and a self-starter who is motivated to achieve results and collaborate with colleagues both inside and outside of the team


Next steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

Notice to Applicants for Jobs Located in NYC or Remote Jobs Associated With Office in NYC Only

We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional process for jobs in NYC and certain features may qualify it as an AEDT in NYC. As part of the hiring and/or promotion process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate submitted applications. We began using Covey Scout for Inbound from August 21, 2023, through December 21, 2023, and resumed using Covey Scout for Inbound again on June 29, 2024.

The Covey tool has been reviewed by an independent auditor. Results of the audit may be viewed here: Covey

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

  • This role combines scientific expertise with stakeholder engagement, placing you at the forefront of driving business outcomes. You will collaborate closely with the Product, Engineering, Design, and Operations teams to guide measurement strategies and tactical decisions, helping to expand the Wolt platform globally.

If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos, are excited to build a team and solutions from the ground up, and have a proven track record in using data science to solve business problems, we want you on our team. Take ownership of business outcomes and proactively drive change with Wolt!

Our offering to you

  • The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
  • You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind. Read more about how we work.
  • Uncover foundational causal relationships in our data that can help us understand our business.
  • Drive strategic decision-making within the whole Merchant Group.

Our humble expectations

  • Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
  • Have 5+ years of experience in a data science or analytics position within an industry or research setting
  • Have 2+ years of experience in team leadership within an industry or research setting, with the ability to inspire, motivate, and influence cross-functional teams to achieve organizational goals and deliver exceptional results.
  • Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation, and regression analysis using statistical software packages in Python, Matlab, R, or equivalent
  • Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
  • Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach
  • Be analytical, inquisitive, and a self-starter who is motivated to achieve results and collaborate with colleagues both inside and outside of the team

Next steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

Notice to Applicants for Jobs Located in NYC or Remote Jobs Associated With Office in NYC Only

We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional process for jobs in NYC and certain features may qualify it as an AEDT in NYC. As part of the hiring and/or promotion process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate submitted applications. We began using Covey Scout for Inbound from August 21, 2023, through December 21, 2023, and resumed using Covey Scout for Inbound again on June 29, 2024.

The Covey tool has been reviewed by an independent auditor. Results of the audit may be viewed here: Covey

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
⚡️ What We Do

Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden’s industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.

With industry-leading AI software at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.

🌟The Team

We're committed to shaping tomorrow's energy system with flexible power at its core. Our ambitious team shares a common goal, working together to create a sustainable future. We are now looking for a passionate and skilled Data Engineer based in Stockholm to fulfill that goal with us.

👩‍💻 About The Role

We are looking for a passionate, self-driven and dedicated Data Engineer to join our Implementation and Operations team. As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining our data pipelines and systems that power our data-driven solutions. You will also work closely with our Data Scientists from the Trading Strategy and Modeling team. Your work will contribute to the development and maintenance of an important stage in our solutions, by making sure that the data travels seamlessly from end to end in our pipelines.

What You’ll Do


Develop and maintain scalable, robust, and efficient data pipelines
Build and optimize data ingestion and processing systems for structured and unstructured data
Work with the data science team to maintain data models and build and maintain MLOps and ETL pipelines
Implement and maintain data quality checks, validation, and monitoring
Create and maintain CI/CD pipelines in GitHub and AWS
Build and maintain data lake and storage solutions
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data requirements and develop data-driven solutions
Design and implement data security and privacy controls
Create and maintain documentation of data pipelines, processes, and procedures


Who You Are


3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or similar role
Strong programming skills in Python and SQL
Familiarity with DevOps practices such as Docker, CI/CD, git, testing
Familiarity with cloud data services, preferably from AWS, such as Lambda
Understanding of data modeling, data storage, and database design
Knowledge of data security and privacy regulations and best practices
Experience working with Databricks is considered a merit.


📍 Location

Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from Slussen subway station. We encourage in-office collaboration but support a hybrid work model.

🛒 Apply

Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office. We therefore appreciate it if you could submit your CV in English.

Throughout the recruitment process you will meet with the People & Talent Partner, Head of Imp&Ops, Data Engineers, and our CEO John.

Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office, so we want you to submit your CV in English.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.

Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies.

In this role, you will be joining one of the teams working on our freight management platform for electric transport. The platform includes systems for handling vehicle telematics and backends, systems and interfaces for transport planning, and machine learning models for energy consumption. We are looking for an enthusiastic, humble and creative Data Engineer who is passionate about creating simple, beautiful and helpful solutions to empower the transport industry to go electric.

As a Data Engineer at Einride you will build data pipelines using real-time data from vehicles and logistics systems to enable actionable insights around sustainability and performance.

You will:


Build high quality data pipelines to power dashboards, business reports and machine learning models
Work with external and internal data consumers to understand and predict their needs in terms of datasets
Develop strategy and architecture for collecting, organizing and leveraging data
Foster data engineering craftsmanship and mentor junior data engineers



We expect that you:


Have extensive experience in working hands-on with real-world datasets
Are fluent in modern, cloud-native data engineering tools. We use SQL, BigQuery, dbt, Dagster and Google Pub/Sub among others
Have experience with some general-purpose programming language such as Python, Java or Go
Are eager to champion data engineering best practices and guide colleagues in their adoption



Ideally you also bring:


Experience with data engineering and data architecture in Google Cloud Platform
Experience from setting up data flows that provide automated verification and error handling



This position is full-time and based in Stockholm. We recommend you submit your application as soon as possible as selection and interviews are held continually.

Please note that as part of our standard recruitment process, we conduct a background control on the final candidate for this role. This may include verification of education, employment history, any relevant professional certifications or other information that may be of our interest.

At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Lendo is looking for a Data Engineer to join our Data & Machine Learning team and help us take our data infrastructure to the next level.

The role

Be part of a team where data transforms ideas into real impact. As a Data Engineer, you will help build scalable solutions that turn information into insights, enabling smarter decisions across the company. In a collaborative and growth-focused environment, you’ll work with experts in engineering, machine learning, and analytics to develop efficient, high-quality and reliable data infrastructure. If you enjoy solving challenges and creating meaningful solutions, this role may be a great fit for you.

Key Responsibilities


Design, build, and maintain scalable, robust, and reliable data pipelines and ETL processes to ingest, process, and transform datasets from various sources.
Optimize data storage, processing, and retrieval for analytics, marketing, and machine learning applications.
Ensure that business users (e.g., analysts, marketers, and finance teams) have reliable, well-structured, and timely access to data to support decision-making.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and governance across our data ecosystem.
Work closely with software engineers to build near-real-time data ingestion and feature store.
Implement monitoring and logging solutions to track and manage data pipeline health and performance.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other teams to enable analytics and model development.
Contribute to best practices in data engineering and data management.
Show more

  • Contribute to best practices in data engineering and data management.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst - Copenhagen:




Are you a data-driven problem solver with a passion for turning numbers into insights?

Do you thrive in a collaborative team and love working with stakeholders to drive real business impact?




I am looking for a data driven problem solver to join a dynamic workforce and help them on their digitalization journey.

Joining the business development team means you are a key point of contact for our internal stakeholders - helping to bring new business value through detailed reports.




Your goal? Bring data to the forefront of the business!




Role and Responsibilities:




Play a forward role within the business, helping to achieve strategic goals by leveraging data
Define, design and deliver advanced reporting through Power BI
Using your analytical mindset to find new value from the data
Collaborate with the Data & Analytics Manager to become the key point of contact for internal stakeholders




Key Skills Required:




Previous experience in an analytical or data focused environment
Hands on experience with Power BI and reporting
Strong work ethic as an individual or in a team
Self-starter mentality with confidence in their own ability to solve data focused problems
Fluency in Danish and English




Alongside your Danish counterparts, this business has a large collaboration with a larger team in Sweden.

Cross collaboration on projects is not only expected but promoted.




If you are looking to kick-start your career with a data driven position in a team that wants to see you thrive - then here it is!




d.nichol@tenthrevolution.com

Title: Mid-level Data Analyst (B2B Product)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way—but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

Become part of a team that's exploring data to enhance online trust. As a member of Trustpilot's B2B Product Analytics team, you'll be integrated into an engaging environment where your insights will directly contribute to product strategy and drive innovation. We work together to solve complex challenges and uncover opportunities that elevate the experiences of businesses and consumers globally.

At Trustpilot, data isn't just an asset, it's the lifeblood of our platform. We leverage tools and technologies like BigQuery, DBT, Looker, Amplitude, and advanced statistical modelling to understand user behaviour, optimise product performance, and drive data-informed decisions across the business. You'll be working alongside a team of analysts, data scientists, product managers, engineers, and designers, collaborating to build impactful solutions that enhance the value of Trustpilot for businesses worldwide. Our goal is to create an inclusive environment where diverse perspectives are appreciated and everyone’s contributions are valued.

What You’ll Be Doing


Drive product strategy with data: Conduct in-depth analyses to understand user behaviour, identify opportunities for product improvement and innovation, and measure the impact of product changes
Promote data-driven decision-making: Collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, and designers to translate data insights into actionable recommendations that influence product roadmap and development
Build and maintain data infrastructure: Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and other data visualizations in Looker and Amplitude to track key product metrics and provide ongoing visibility into product performance
Conduct in-depth experimentation: Design and analyse A/B tests to evaluate the effectiveness of new features and product enhancements, ensuring data-driven decisions are at the core of product development
Communicate effectively: Present your findings and recommendations to diverse audiences, clearly articulating the value and impact of your work to both technical and non-technical stakeholders up to C-suite level


Who You Are


You are an experienced mid-level Product Analyst
You leverage data to solve complex product challenges. You're curious and motivated to uncover the 'why' behind the data, constantly seeking new knowledge and exploring different perspectives.
Skilled in product analytics: You have prior experience working with key analytical and statistical methodologies, including cohort analysis, A/B testing, and model-based analyses (regression, clustering, etc.)
Experienced in data visualization and reporting: You have built insightful dashboards and reports using BI/product analytics tools such as Looker and Amplitude.
A skilled communicator: You can effectively communicate complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences, translating data into compelling narratives that drive action and business challenges into technical requirements
An effective team contributor: You thrive in a collaborative environment, working closely with cross-functional teams to reach shared goals
You possess proficient SQL skills and some experience in DBT. You’re comfortable working with scripting languages like Python or R for data analysis


What's in it for you?


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 320 million reviews and 70 million monthly active users across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.
Show more

Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

Title: Data Analyst (Marketing Insights)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 113 million registered users and 240,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 419+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.132.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are seeking a talented and driven Data Analyst to join us in shaping the future of our newly established Demand Analytics team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in enhancing our team's capabilities around Marketing analytics while benefiting from a robust support structure designed to foster growth and innovation. We are also ready to consider candidates with more work experience as Senior Data Analyst.

As a Marketplace, Marketing is one of Too Good To Go’s most powerful levers for driving demand. Consequently, a strong foundation in marketing metrics is essential for this role. The models and methodologies you will help develop are largely marketing-focused, emphasizing the importance of experience with causal impact modeling and econometric modeling.

That said, Demand Analytics at Too Good To Go extends beyond Marketing. We are looking for someone who can also contribute to broader analytical initiatives, such as demand forecasting and other data-driven projects.

If you’re passionate about leveraging analytics to make a real-world impact and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we’d love to hear from you.

Your role


Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Design and deliver self-service tools to various functional groups for operational excellence
Collaborate with marketing teams to optimize campaign strategies and resource allocation based on data-driven insights
Conduct in-depth analyses to identify the drivers of demand and measure marketing impact
Utilize marketing insights to inform and enhance demand forecasting models


Requirements


You have an understanding of Marketing Data and KPIs, or a strong appetite to learn this space.
Having experience in analyzing and interpreting marketing performance metrics would be a clear advantage.
You are a great communicator and storyteller - someone who enjoys helping non-technical audiences see what you see in the numbers!
You have hands-on experience working closely with senior stakeholders, ideally within Marketing, to deliver data-driven insights.
You are skilled in designing, executing, and interpreting A/B tests, as well as applying causal inference and impact modeling techniques.
You have econometric modeling experience; familiarity with marketing mix models (MMM) is a plus.
You are proficient in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and transformation
You have Python expertise for data pre-processing, or statistical analysis. R would also be considered.
You are passionate about data literacy, continuously striving to improve your own skills and those of your team.


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - Copenhagen:




A new role available with one of my most forward facing tech hubs. We are now looking to find a senior analyst to join an international workforce.




Helping to drive new innovation and striving to spearhead data-driven decision making with a tailored data solution built with snowflake, dbt and airflow. Reporting directly to Director of data platform you will adopt key responsibilities, guiding the team and stakeholders across multiple offices.




Being in a fast paced dynamic environment, we need you to be a strong team player as well as a confident individual. Bringing new ideas forward based of well structured research. You will be helping to manage a data set that can be 100TB daily so having that attention to detail is really valuable!




Key responsibilities:

Spearhead data-driven decision making, guiding and advising stakeholders through digital projects
Help to strengthen best practices for data management
Collaborate with an existing team of IT specialists
Take ownership of our data sets, discovering new opportunities and add greater value
Define, manage and maintain projects, helping to ensure delivery to a high quality




Skills needed to succeed:

Proven track record with SQL and data management
Previous experience in a fast paced data environment
Strong analytical and communication skills
Confidence in a team and as a solo team member
Previous experience driving digital projects is a plus
Fluency in English




You will be welcomed and supported by a team of like-minded specialists, 5 of which are also data analysts.




All team members help to drive the business forward through knowledge sharing and sparing - helping to adopt an innovative culture.




Working flexibility is heavily promoted but we do need someone who can be on site in the office which is located in central Copenhagen.




Salary will be measured based on experience and ambition, if you are a more junior profile who believes they have what it takes to succeed - please still apply!

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Company Description

Enversion is a health-tech company focused on improving well-being through intuitive solutions for patients and healthcare professionals worldwide.




Role Description

This is a full-time hybrid role for a Business Intelligence Specialist at Enversion A/S. The specialist will be responsible for tasks related to data analytics, data warehousing, ETL processes, data modeling, and analytical skills. The role is located in Copenhagen Metropolitan Area with the option for some remote work.




Qualifications

Consultancy experience, including documented external consultancy work, is a must.
Experience with BI tools such as MS Power BI, Tableau, or SAS is essential.
Data Analytics and Data Modeling skills
Experience with Extract Transform Load (ETL) processes
Strong Analytical Skills
Knowledge of Data Warehousing
Excellent problem-solving abilities
Experience in the health-tech or healthcare industry is a plus
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Economics, Business, or related field.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen, Denmark

About The Role

Would you like to play a key role in defining the future of our daily reporting in Saxo through Power BI – then we indeed have the right position for you!

We are currently looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst for our Commercial Finance department, where you will join our Analysis and BI team. You will work closely with internal stakeholders of the business to improve our decisions and processes. This opportunity is for you if you thrive in the technical aspects of Power BI, take pride in making reports easy to use and with clear communication, and you enjoy working with passionate and competent team members in a dynamic environment.

In our team we are among other things responsible for financial forecasting and target setting, follow-up on performances including daily reporting through Power BI as well as support our CFO with analysis and commercial insights, analysis and models for estimating financial impact.

Our team currently consists of four commercial analysts and one BI analyst, with one commercial analyst in the Netherlands and the rest working out of our headquarter in Copenhagen. We are all curious people, and we constantly strive to improve our understanding of causalities and through that what drives the business forward. We work both autonomously and as a team, but always diligently as we understand our responsibility as gatekeepers of the numbers. The team is a diverse group with different backgrounds and interests which makes the day full of interesting discussions. We value an environment built on trust, transparency and ownership.

As our new Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be reporting to our Head of Commercial Analysis and BI and work from out office in Copenhagen.

Responsibilities


Development and maintenance of existing reports, ensuring that they drive value for the business
Ensuring a robust backend for reporting together with the Datawarehouse team
Assist in defining and implementing the future of reporting in Saxo
Simplifying our reporting suite, ensuring that it is user friendly
Small analyses and data extracts
Danish is an advantage, but not a prerequisite


Your profile

We are looking for a curious colleague who wants to be smarter than you were yesterday and enjoy learning together with your team members so we all work smarter – together!

You are able to translate complex data into bite size insights and challenge stakeholders on their requests. You have the ability to both see things from a helicopter perspective while also zoom in and understand important details.

It also doesn’t hurt to have a good understanding of math and modelling, and a great sense of humor!

Furthermore, we are looking for you who


Has a commercial mindset in combination with a service minded nature – you want to be a part of the solution
Has strong capabilities in Power BI both in visualization and in DAX (M is a bonus)
Understands complex ideas and structures, but can communicate them in a simple manner
Understands SQL and has good Excel skills
Takes a structures approach to problem solving
Has a relevant educational background e.g. economy, finance, engineering and/or relevant work experience within the BI-field
May have worked in the intersection between data governance and general reporting (this is a bonus)
Speaks and writes English fluently, Danish is an advantage but not a requirement


Please don't hesitate to apply even if you are not fulfilling all of the mentioned requirements, but you think you are a great fit.

We get curious people invested in the world

When you work at Saxo, you become a Saxonian and part of a purpose-driven organisation, where good ideas are always taken seriously, and where you can make a true impact. We are invested in your development, and you can expect a robust career from day one when you join Saxo – no matter which role you take on.

You will join 2,500 other ambitious colleagues across 15 countries and become part of an international organisation. Working in Saxo, you will get to meet colleagues from many different cultures and backgrounds, and you should know that we value diversity and inclusion and see it as a genuine source of strength to drive growth, foster innovation and position us for long-term success.

We encourage an open feedback culture and supportive team environments enabling employees to grow and fulfil their career aspirations.

When you bring passion, curiosity, drive and team spirit, your learning journey will be dynamic and your career opportunities in Saxo will be immense.

At Saxo we don’t just offer a job – we offer an opportunity to invest in your future!

How To Apply

Click here to create an account and upload your resume and a short motivation. We look forward to getting to know you better!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you thrive at the intersection of data and strategy? Are you excited about turning complex analytics into impactful marketing insights? Then you might be our new Marketing Data Analyst, ready to join our dynamic and international marketing team!

First, who on earth is Dalux?

Dalux is an innovative Contech company committed to push the boundaries of how technology can secure a smarter and more efficient construction and real estate industry. Today we provide our user-friendly digital tools and BIM Technology (3D information models) to leading contractors and advisors in more than 147 countries. And we are not slowing down our expansion journey anytime soon, so this is a great time to join us and directly influence the future of Dalux! Today we are present in 24 countries and counting, and therefore this is a great time to join us, and directly influence the future of Dalux!

Awesome! But what will my new role be?

In this role, you’ll work at the intersection of data and marketing, analyzing and interpreting data from a wide variety of marketing channels such as ads, social media, website performance, webinars, events, and more. Your insights will drive decision-making, shape marketing strategies, and optimize performance across the organization.

Your responsibilities will include:


Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various marketing sources (e.g., Google Analytics, Google Ads, social platforms, events, webinars).
Developing and maintaining dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, SQL, and Access.
Providing actionable insights to optimize campaign performance and achieve marketing goals.
Collaborating with Performance Marketing and other teams (Content, Events, Commercial Revenue Operations) to align on data-driven strategies.
Monitoring and reporting on KPIs, campaign ROI, and trends to guide both short-term and long-term planning.
Identifying areas of opportunity and proposing data-informed strategies for growth and efficiency.


Sure, sounds exciting! How can I be considered for this role?

You have experience in marketing data analysis or a related field, with proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Microsoft Access. Strong knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Ads dashboards, as well as analytical and problem-solving skills, are essential. Experience visualizing data for non-technical stakeholders and strong collaboration skills are also key.

Preferred qualifications include experience in performance marketing or commercial revenue operations, familiarity with A/B testing, and additional data visualization tools.

If you’re collaborative, curious, and eager to learn, you’ll thrive in our supportive and creative environment.

Why Choose Dalux?

At Dalux, we care—not just about our work and customers but about each other. We believe in creating a work environment that is light-hearted, informal, and welcoming, with room for everyone. Forget fancy titles and rigid dress codes; we’re here to make your work life both rewarding and enjoyable.

At our HQ in Østerbro, you’ll join a team of 17 skilled colleagues dedicated to driving high customer engagement. Networking with our users is our passion, and we deliver great content, engaging events, and cutting-edge ConTech insights.

Being part of a social company, you’ll also enjoy activities like wine tasting, running club, knitting club, and more. At Dalux, your personal and professional growth is important to us.

Application deadline:

As soon as possible

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Copenhagen)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Ageras, we are redefining how entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking, and administrative tasks. Through seamless tools and innovative accounting & banking solutions, we help them focus on what matters most: growing their businesses.

Our vision is to become the best friend of every small entrepreneur across Europe. 💚

Over the years, Ageras has grown through the merging of top European FinTechs like Shine (🇫🇷), Kontist (🇩🇪), Tellow (🇳🇱), and more. Today, we’re a team of nearly 500 people, including 150 talented engineers, working together from Paris, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, and Berlin.




👀 Data at Ageras

At Ageras, we're revolutionizing the way entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking and administrative tasks. Operating in the ever-evolving FinTech space, we face one of the industry's most intricate challenges: building a robust, reliable architecture to enable seamless data collection, analysis, and visualization. Unsurprisingly, our Data team plays a pivotal role in driving Ageras' success!

Our Data department is organized into three specialized squads: Data Analytics, Data Modeling, and Data Platform, ensuring optimal efficiency and focus.

We are now seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics team, currently composed of 4 data analyst and 1 lead data analyst.

As for our tech stack, we work with Python, AWS, Snowflake, Big Query, Meltano, Terraform, Dagster, and dbt for data modeling. If you're passionate about leveraging these tools to shape the future of FinTech, we'd love to hear from you!

📋 Your Role as a Senior Data Analyst

Data analysis at Ageras means working with a large volume of data across diverse domains (payment transactions, user behavior and conversion, product usage, ticket volume, revenue, marketing...), and and draw business insights from it to support or impact the company strategy 💥




Your Responsibilities Will Include

Data Analysis & Visualization
Build and optimize analytical data models using dbt.
Develop and maintain dashboards on Looker Studio and Metabase to empower teams with actionable insights.
Analyze complex datasets to solve business challenges and provide recommendations.
Collaboration & Strategy
Work closely with Business, Tech, and Data teams to align on priorities and insights.
Translate stakeholder needs into effective data solutions.
Deliver clear, data-driven insights to support strategic decision-making.
You will work closely with Product team on the product roadmap and help them on applying analysis like A/B test
Team Development & Best Practices
Help grow and structure the Data Analytics team by sharing knowledge and mentoring junior members.
Advocate for and implement best practices in data analysis, visualization, and architecture.
Stay on top of emerging tools and methodologies to optimize our processes.




🔎 About you

You have 5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst with advanced skills in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Metabase, Tableau).
You have significant experience with modern data stacks (BigQuery, dbt) and a strong focus on detail and precision.
You simplify complex findings into clear, actionable insights for diverse stakeholders and decision-makers.
You demonstrate adaptability and proactivity, enabling you to thrive in dynamic and challenging work environments.
Teamwork is key for you: you enjoy mentoring others while continuing to grow and learn.
You are fluent in English and excited to work in an international team.




🎉 Our Perks

Remote Work Culture: Located in Paris with possibility of two remote working days per week but also you can you can work in all Ageras offices: Berlin, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, Poland
Office Perks: Complimentary tea, coffee, refreshments, fruits, and snacks available daily.
Career Growth Opportunities: Build a successful career with ample opportunities for professional growth within the firm.
Team Building and Events: Participate in biannual team-building activities and summer/winter corporate events.




💚 Our recruitment process

1️⃣ A 45’ introductory call with Annaïg (Talent Acquisition Specialist) to learn more about each other and give you an overview of Ageras.

2️⃣ A 90’ interview with Saghar (Lead Data Analyst) to discuss your experience, dive into the role, and evaluate your SQL skills.

3️⃣ A 30' business case presentation, where you’ll showcase your technical expertise and problem-solving abilities.

At Ageras, we are redefining how entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking, and administrative tasks. Through seamless tools and innovative accounting & banking solutions, we help them focus on what matters most: growing their businesses.

Our vision is to become the best friend of every small entrepreneur across Europe. 💚

Over the years, Ageras has grown through the merging of top European FinTechs like Shine (🇫🇷), Kontist (🇩🇪), Tellow (🇳🇱), and more. Today, we’re a team of nearly 500 people, including 150 talented engineers, working together from Paris, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, and Berlin.


👀 Data at Ageras

At Ageras, we're revolutionizing the way entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking and administrative tasks. Operating in the ever-evolving FinTech space, we face one of the industry's most intricate challenges: building a robust, reliable architecture to enable seamless data collection, analysis, and visualization. Unsurprisingly, our Data team plays a pivotal role in driving Ageras' success!

Our Data department is organized into three specialized squads: Data Analytics, Data Modeling, and Data Platform, ensuring optimal efficiency and focus.

We are now seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics team, currently composed of 4 data analyst and 1 lead data analyst.

  • Teamwork is key for you: you enjoy mentoring others while continuing to grow and learn.
  • You are fluent in English and excited to work in an international team.


🎉 Our Perks

  • Remote Work Culture: Located in Paris with possibility of two remote working days per week but also you can you can work in all Ageras offices: Berlin, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, Poland
  • Office Perks: Complimentary tea, coffee, refreshments, fruits, and snacks available daily.
  • Career Growth Opportunities: Build a successful career with ample opportunities for professional growth within the firm.
  • Team Building and Events: Participate in biannual team-building activities and summer/winter corporate events.


💚 Our recruitment process

1️⃣ A 45’ introductory call with Annaïg (Talent Acquisition Specialist) to learn more about each other and give you an overview of Ageras.

2️⃣ A 90’ interview with Saghar (Lead Data Analyst) to discuss your experience, dive into the role, and evaluate your SQL skills.

3️⃣ A 30' business case presentation, where you’ll showcase your technical expertise and problem-solving abilities.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.  

We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a Data Analyst in our Copenhagen office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change? 

The Role 

As a Data Analyst at Viaplay Group, you will play a pivotal role in transforming complex data into actionable insights, enabling us to deliver exceptional experiences to our customers. By leveraging your analytical, visualization, and data modeling skills, you’ll inspire and lead the way toward a more data-informed business. Collaborating with diverse teams, you’ll be integral in evaluating trends, optimizing strategies, and supporting data-driven decision-making. Your expertise will help shape the future of Viaplay Group through enhanced user engagement, content performance, and operational excellence.

Key Responsibilities


Data Analysis & Insights: Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights that drive business strategies and improve user experiences
Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to bring the business closer to data by offering expertise, advice, and insights. Actively contribute to creating a data-informed culture across all levels of the organization
Data Visualization: Build dashboards and reports with a strong focus on storytelling, making complex data easy to understand for stakeholders
Strategic Impact: Partner with stakeholders to align data strategies with business goals, support roadmap decisions, and ensure appropriate tracking is in place for new initiatives
Self-Service Analytics:Champion a self-service analytics culture across the organization, empowering teams to access, interpret, and utilize data independently
Education & Communication: Lead and participate in data education initiatives to improve understanding and utilization of data tools and methodologies across the organization
Process Automation: Identify opportunities for automation in data tracking, analysis, and reporting to streamline processes and improve scalability
Documentation: Create standardized and accessible documentation to ensure clarity, reduce dependencies, and enable teams to operate autonomously


What We’re Looking For 

We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following: 


Proven experience as a Data Analyst, demonstrating the ability to work independently and proactively drive change
Strong knowledge of SQL and proficiency in visualization tools like Tableau or ThoughtSpot
Expertise in data storytelling, with the ability to translate complex insights into clear, compelling presentations for technical and non-technical audiences
A passion for setting up dashboards, KPIs, and reporting structures that inspire action and align with business goals
A collaborative mindset, with the ability to build strong relationships and work cross-functionally
A proactive approach to problem-solving, actively seeking new solutions and considering scalability in your work
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a talent for making others enthusiastic about data
Strong proficiency in Danish, both written and spoken


It’s a bonus if you have: 


Experience with analytical engineering or tools like Databricks
Background in the streaming or media industry


What we offer you


We’ve got you covered! 25 days + 5 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more. 


Hit play today 

If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position. 

Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.   
Show more
