Title: Consultant - McKinsey Digital
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you’ll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have


Continuous learning Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package, which includes medical, dental, mental health, and vision coverage for you, your spouse/partner, and children.


Your Impact

As a junior associate, you will join a client service team and take ownership of a workstream to solve some of the toughest challenges our clients face. And these aren’t just any clients—they're some of the most influential organizations around, from Fortune 500 giants to innovative startups. We will expect you to go the extra mile, delivering solutions that solve immediate problems and drive long-term change. And we’ll rely on your judgment and integrity to ensure our recommendations are effective and long-lasting.

You will take on a role that goes beyond advising. You’ll be at the heart of the action—helping to uncover the true challenges behind a client’s strategy and creating actionable plans that drive real change. Working alongside clients and other McKinsey colleagues, you’ll combine research, analyzing data, interviews, and brainstorming to generate fresh insights and breakthrough solutions. Your commitment to our values will be crucial in earning our clients' trust and delivering results that matter.

As you collaborate directly with clients, you’ll help them solve problems, refine strategies, and implement transformations. By equipping them with the tools and knowledge to continue innovating and improving after we’ve left, you’ll ensure the impact of our work endures. In doing so, you’ll uphold McKinsey’s commitment to making a meaningful difference in the industries and communities we serve.

Read more about McKinsey Digital here.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in a technical subject such as computer science, engineering, IT, hard sciences or mathematics; advanced degree is a plus
Excellent organization capabilities, including the ability to initiate tasks independently and see them through to completion.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English and local office language(s), with the ability to adjust your style to suit different perspectives and seniority levels.
Proficient in rational decision making based on data, facts, and logical reasoning.
Ability to create work product-focused materials / outputs, which may include PowerPoint decks, Excel models, articles, or other written deliverables.
Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment.
Ability to work or attend meetings outside of traditional business hours or take on projects with limited or no notice at times.
Ability to travel to and work in varying environments that may be challenging and/or not accessible (e.g., factories, hospitals, mines).
Show more

Title: Statistician
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
HTML:
About Agreena

Agreena is an exciting, dynamic, and purpose-oriented organisation united in a mission to mobilise farmers and corporations to unlock the value of nature and help restore the planet. While we’re rooted in agriculture, finance, and technology, our team of experts range from soil carbon scientists and software developers to market strategists and regulatory affairs experts. Over 230 employees across more than 40 nationalities are gathered under the common Agreena flag – either working from our headquarters in Copenhagen, offices in London, or remotely across Europe.

As a rapidly scaling climate agtech, Agreena provides solutions that drive both environmental and financial sustainability in farming. We have helped farmers across 20 countries in their journey from conventional agriculture to regenerative farming practices to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and remove CO2 from the atmosphere, storing it in soil. Our company offers a supportive and positive work environment with opportunities for learning, leading and growth no matter where you are in your professional journey. We believe in giving our employees a lot of responsibility, and we encourage new thinking, innovation and fun.

We are looking for an in-house statistician to assist our Programme and Data teams. Across both, we are looking to better understand and explain our data in order to bolster our scientific rigour. You will sit between both teams and should be confident working with different types of statistical analysis, process-based modelling, and sampling/stratification.

Equally, you should have a good understanding of statistical modelling and bring a fresh perspective to our machine learning and process-based approaches. Thus, you will be a strong communicator capable of translating complex analysis into simplified insights to both internal and external stakeholders.

The Programme and Data teams are integral to the scientific operations of the company, and you will work closely together with them and our Product teams to ensure state of the art science drives our world leading carbon platform. As such, you will be part of a dynamic and high-paced work environment constantly subject to innovation.

How Will You Make An Impact

  • Estimating uncertainty and error propagation in our models;
  • Applying Bayesian methods for the calibration of complex process-based models;
  • Designing sampling strategies for our data collection campaigns;
  • Evaluating the quality and quantity of our data;
  • Communicating and visualising key insights;

Who We’re Looking For

  • Self-driven individual capable of collaborating in a multi-disciplinary environment;
  • Minimum Bachelors in Statistics, Mathematics, or appropriate science/engineering field;
  • 3+ years of experience working in a relevant field, with experience in some or all of the following:
  • Statistical and data-sampling techniques such as regression, imputation, random forest, Monte Carlo, stratification, and/or clustering;
  • Working with temporal and spatial data;
  • Experience coding in R;
  • Strong scientific writing, report creation and communication skills to audiences with a range of technical expertise.

Bonus Points If You Have

  • Masters or PhD in one of the relevant Science fields mentioned above;
  • A baseline understanding of greenhouse gas accounting frameworks and methodologies;
  • Strong theoretical background in Bayesian Statistics;
  • Knowledge or experience working with crop, pedometrics, or process-based models;
  • Experience coding in Python;
  • Handling unstructured/imbalanced data.

What’s In It For You

  • A unique opportunity to join and help shape a fast-growing tech scale up with the determination and ambitious mission to reverse climate change;
  • A truly global environment where you can collaborate and socialise with diverse and passionate colleagues;
  • Competitive compensation package and holidays;
  • Centrally located modern office in Copenhagen or London and the option to work from home a couple days a week;
  • Team events throughout the year;
  • An exciting purpose-led culture and mission;
  • Open communication and supportive feedback culture.

🌱 Not quite what you're looking for?

Stay connected with us by following our Agreena LinkedIn page. It's the best way to stay updated on our latest content, articles, and exciting new opportunities.

Plus, if you want to be the first to know about job openings in the departments you're interested in, you can subscribe to our job alerts talent pool.

🌍 Be your best self every day at Agreena

At Agreena, we are devoted to building an environment that promotes equality, inclusion, and diversity. As we embark on our journey of expansion and growth, we recognise the value of celebrating and embracing everyone's uniqueness. This diversity is crucial to our success and innovation. We aspire to build a product that is loved by our customers and we want the same to be reflected in our teams.

With this in mind, we're dedicated to ensuring that Agreena remains a welcoming and diverse environment for all.

Title: Reporting & BI - Product & Market, AS Performance
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for a Reporting & BI - Product & Market, AS Performance to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Marketing Knowledge & Data Analytics Manager.

How you can contribute and have an impact?


Reporting & insights, trend visualization, AI modelling, performance analysis
Responsible for the preparation, extrapolation and analysis of product and market
Analyze product / aftersales performance based on specific reports (price position, trends, competitors' actions)
Frequent reporting of campaign performance
Media KPIs (GRP, reach, impressions, clicks, CPC)
Number of qualified visitors, cost per QVs
Showroom traffic
Captive bank data analysis based on request
Supervise and monitor quarterly and seasonal campaigns & action plans, execution of European Aftersales marketing strategies and programs, webpage development
Review AS campaign data and evaluate the results of the performed campaign, lead strategic direction for future campaigns
Ensure sufficient training (internal) for reporting
Control budget related to the dealer data and systems
Managing special projects and ad-hoc reporting and analysis for regional and national management


What we look for:


Minimum 5 years professional experience preferably within the automotive industry, EV experience is a plus
Experience within an international, matrix organization is highly advantageous
Experience in Data management / engineering
Higher education at Bachelors' level
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage
Analytical skills
Advanced PC skills
Experienced MS Office user, especially in Excel
Presentation skills
Data-driven decision-making
Borderless and virtual mindset
Ability to simplify
Familiarity with data Management principles and practices
Experience creating and documenting policies and procedures
Ability to work with both business stakeholders and technical support teams to resolve data issues
Ability to communicate successfully with stakeholders at all levels to understand their needs and translate those needs
Ability to communicate with highly technical individuals about the desires, insights, and observations of the business and to ensure development and deployment of appropriate solutions


Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands


Show more

  • Experienced MS Office user, especially in Excel
  • Presentation skills
  • Data-driven decision-making
  • Borderless and virtual mindset
  • Ability to simplify
  • Familiarity with data Management principles and practices
  • Experience creating and documenting policies and procedures
  • Ability to work with both business stakeholders and technical support teams to resolve data issues
  • Ability to communicate successfully with stakeholders at all levels to understand their needs and translate those needs
  • Ability to communicate with highly technical individuals about the desires, insights, and observations of the business and to ensure development and deployment of appropriate solutions

Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

Title: Junior Data & IT Support Analyst
Description:
Are you precise, detail-oriented, and passionate about solving technical challenges while ensuring an exceptional support experience for colleagues around the world? Do you want to develop your skills in IT support, software development, and data analytics within a professional work environment, while ensuring high-quality and efficient global processes? Then make a smarter move and unleash your potential as Student Analyst in Frey.




Role & Responsibilities:

We are looking for a Student Analyst to join our Data team in Aarhus. In this role, you’ll be responsible for providing IT support, managing Microsoft Office 365 solutions, and assisting with data analytics projects built on Microsoft Azure Technologies. Your primary focus will be to ensure the smooth operation of IT systems while enhancing the support experience for our colleagues both nationally and internationally.

In collaboration with the team, you will help optimize customer processes, support system integrations, and ensure effective onboarding and offboarding processes. We offer approximately 20 hours a week, with tasks including:

Acting as the primary point of contact for IT-related questions and challenges.
Supporting and maintaining IT equipment, ensuring proper setup and functionality.
Managing and troubleshooting Microsoft Office 365 solutions on various platforms
Assisting with maintaining and optimizing data analytics solutions built on Microsoft Azure.
Managing O365 licenses, subscriptions, and user administration.




Expected skills & Experience:

In this role, you’ll join an international culture where English is the corporate language, so we expect you to be comfortable communicating both written and spoken English. Additionally, we expect that you:

Are enrolled in bachelor’s or master’s degree program.
Have a strong interest in IT and data analytics with a service-oriented mindset.
Possess problem-solving/troubleshooting skills and are passionate about delivering a great support experience.
Are familiar with O365 environment, including Microsoft Teams, SharePoint and Exchange Server
Have proficiency in at least one of the following: SQL, Python, or JavaScript.




It’s an advantage, but not a requirement, if you have:

Experience with IT support, including troubleshooting and maintaining equipment.
Knowledge of M365 administration and data analytics solutions on Microsoft Azure.
Familiarity with creating and maintaining technical documentation for IT systems and processes.
Have experience with Power BI and basic scripting.




About Frey:

We optimize containerized agricultural commodity flows by unifying diverse global expertise and backgrounds with an ambition for growth and a strong belief in simple, digital, and transparent trading of commodities providing affordable possibilities for any kind of business. We are entrepreneurs with advanced expertise in trading, logistics, and data that utilize technology and great minds to connect local businesses with suppliers across the globe, enabling new access and opportunity to markets, materials, and products. In short, we make commodity trading easy, efficient, and affordable. By living our values of being Trustworthy, Rethinking, Ambitious, Data-driven, and Entrepreneurial, we rethink commodity trading and logistics and build a culture of empowering our employees to challenge the status quo and make a smarter move.




Next step:

Send your application, including a cover letter, CV, and other relevant material to job@freycommodities.com marked “Junior Data & IT Support Analyst”. We will review applications and conduct interviews on an ongoing basis.




We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us, be part of more.

We’re so much more than an energy company. We’re a family of brands revolutionising how we power the planet. We're energisers. One team of 21,000 colleagues that’s energising a greener, fairer future by creating an energy system that doesn’t rely on fossil fuels, whilst living our powerful commitment to igniting positive change in our communities. Here, you can find more purpose, more passion and more potential. That’s why working here is #MoreThanACareer. We do energy differently – we do it all. We make it, store it, move it, sell it and mend it.

About your team:

At Centrica Energy, our mission is to move it.

We’re energy movers by nature. We’re a global renewable energy trading company which helps move energy from source to use – powering businesses, homes, and societies as they transition to a new sustainable energy future. If the idea of working to create a sustainable energy future also moves you, we may very well be the right place for you.

At Centrica Energy, our mission is to move it.

We’re energy movers by nature. We’re a global renewable energy trading company which helps move energy from source to use – powering businesses, homes, and societies as they transition to a new sustainable energy future. If the idea of working to create a sustainable energy future also moves you, we may very well be the right place for you.

About the role:

The Quantitative Analytics team at Centrica Energy is part of the Trading Analytics and Algorithms centre of excellence, and is responsible for:


Delivering quantitative analysis of complex and structured products, that provides insight to help traders to maximise value and manage risk
Designing and implementing complex mathematical models that allow for consistent pricing and joint risk quantification across multiple portfolios, enabling more holistic and optimal hedging decisions
Assisting originators in development of structured products across the Renewables, LNG, Gas & Power sectors.


As a Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of an agile team of c10 people located across our offices in both London (UK) and Aalborg (Denmark).

The successful candidate will be required to:


Produce high quality increments to the team’s model library working both individually and collaboratively
Assist/advise trading and origination via quantitative analysis and a strong mathematical/financial intuition
Leverage the teams cross-asset expertise to connect business locations, helping to identify synergies and increase efficiency.


What we’re looking for:


Master’s Degree or PhD qualification within science, mathematics or other quantitative subject
Good understanding of a variety of mathematical and statistical models used in finance
Experience with derivatives pricing and risk management systems
Experience of code development (ideally Python)
Familiarity or high level of interest in Energy / commodity markets
Strong Communicator and fluent in English language
Strong interpersonal skills.


Why should you apply?

We’re not a perfect place – but we’re a people place. Our priority is supporting all of the different realities our people face. Life is about so much more than work. We get it. That’s why we’ve designed our total rewards to give you the flexibility to choose what you need, when you need it, making sure that you and your family are supported not only financially, but physically and emotionally too. Visit the link below to discover why we’re a great place to work and what being part of more means for you.

https://www.morethanacareer.energy/centricaenergy

If you're full of energy, fired up about sustainability, and ready to craft not only a better tomorrow, but a better you, then come and find your purpose in a team where your voice matters, your growth is non-negotiable, and your ambitions are our priority.

Help us, help you. We would love for you to share any information about yourself throughout our recruitment process so that we can better understand you and help shape your journey.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Gladsaxe, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Would you like to support the management in strategic decision-making with your analytical capabilities and business acumen? Are you ready to turn large volumes of complex data into insights and decisions? Do you want to impact the decisions taken in our clinical development organisation, ensuring alignment with business goals to bring life-changing treatments?

Then, this is your chance to join us as a Senior Data Analyst in Global Clinical Business Analysis, Global Trial Portfolio.

Apply now for a life-changing career!

The position
As a Senior Data Analyst, you will act as a value-adding business partner with a key focus on speed, productivity, cost, and performance analysis across our global clinical development organisation. Establishing strong collaboration with the project organisation will be one of your goals in this role.

You will also have the opportunity to:



Turn complex analysis into clear conclusions and easy-to-understand communication slides
Support our leadership teams with in-depth analysis and recommendations on how to improve productivity and performance ensuring that we meet our ambitus targets
Create transparency and analysis for informed decision-making and further develop your presentation skills




This role is an exciting chance to further develop your career in a market-leading global pharmaceutical company. You will be engaging in cross-organisational projects and developing your stakeholder management skills even further. We can offer challenging assignments, flexible working conditions, and continuous personal and professional development.

Qualifications

To thrive and succeed, we imagine you have:



A master’s degree in business, business data science or another relevant scientific field combined with strong business acumen
6-10 years of experience in big-data analysis, data science, or business analysis showing both strong analytical and communication skills, as well as proficiency with IT- tools
Proven track record translating data into strategic and actionable recommendations, determining the added value and potential risks, combined with experience in creating compelling presentations for senior executives, preferably from business consulting background
Curiosity and willingness to learn about clinical drug development and the pharma industry
Fluency in written and spoken English




As a person, you are outgoing, self-driven, ambitious, analytical, a good communicator and you thrive in a dynamic global environment. Furthermore, you enjoy collaborating with many different stakeholders with diverse cultural backgrounds.

About The Department

Global Clinical Business Analysis is a global department of 15 dedicated professionals supporting and collaborating across the global clinical development organisation which is responsible for the clinical research and project management of our products in development with approximately 1100 people in the headquarters function and approximately 2500 in our regions. It is a complex environment with many projects in our development portfolio. Transparency and in-depth analysis on global trial performance, capacity and performance management is critical to us.

Working at Novo Nordisk
At Novo Nordisk, we don’t wait for change. We drive it. We’re a dynamic company in an even more dynamic industry, and we know that what got us to where we are today is not necessarily what will make us successful in the future. We embrace the spirit of experimentation, striving for excellence without fixating on perfection. We never shy away from opportunities to develop, we seize them. From research and development, through to manufacturing, marketing and sales – we’re all working to move the needle on patient care.

Contact
For further information please call Simon Munch Hermansen, Senior Director, at + 45 3075 3792.

Deadline
19 March 2025

Please note that applications will be reviewed continuously, and interviews will be conducted accordingly

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more

Title: Analyst
Description:
Would you like to make an impact on how BESTSELLER competes in the fashion industry, and are you excited about working in an agile environment? Then BESTSELLER TECH is the place for you! 

We are looking for a Tech Analyst to help us build great material management solutions for the buyers and suppliers within BESTSELLER. We do this by balancing and supporting demands from our business, understanding, and challenging complex processes and introducing modern technology and new ways of working.

YOUR TEAM

You will join a cross-cultural team of highly skilled colleagues who are curious and always searching for new ways of creating value. The team consist of Product Owners, a Scrum Master and the development team of analysts, developers and a designer. With us, you will experience an informal tone, and even though we sit in Malaga, Brande and Aarhus, we connect virtually and psychically as much as possible.

YOUR ROLE

As our Tech Analyst, you interact with the team, the product owners, and the business to gather, understand, and translate requirements into solutions and optimizations of business processes. In our team, we own the products we build, and you will – together with the rest of the team – be responsible for the successful implementation of the solutions.

More specifically, your tasks include:


Supporting and leading various projects, incl. stakeholder management, documentation, and facilitation
Identifying data needs based on business needs and identifying business needs based on data
Supporting the business in the implementation and realization of solutions
Participating in team events as required per our agile setup
Staying up-to-date on current business initiatives, technology trends and best practices within the product development and buying field


YOUR PROFILE

We are looking for a team player who can work independently and maintain focus despite changing demands. You work in a structured and determined manner, meeting deadlines with a focus on quality. You contribute constructively to team discussions, enjoy finding creative solutions to complex challenges, and take an analytical and data-driven approach to problem-solving. Finally, having an outgoing mindset will help you build relations and communicate with colleagues across brands, functions, and organisational levels - and ultimately succeed in the position.

The Material Tech team is looking for an analyst, with:


The ability to understand and communicate complex flows
A positive and proactive mindset and an eagerness to learn
An ability to stay focused despite changing demands and deadlines.


In addition, we’re looking for the following specific qualifications:


Relevant degree, e.g. within supply chain, engineering, or information technology
Experience with analysis of data using SQL, Excel, and/or PowerBI
A solid understanding of business processes within supply chain
Experience being a part of software development
Fluent in written and spoken English – any Danish skills are considered an advantage, but not a requirement.


WORK LOCATION

Aarhus, Denmark.

CURIOUS FOR MORE?

To get a glimpse of what life is like in BESTSELLER TECH follow this link and be sure to visit us on us on LinkedIn.

WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

For any further questions, you are welcome to contact Varun Kashiva +45 30852868. Otherwise, please send us your application and CV as soon as possible and no later than April 19, 2025. We review applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to take down the ad, when we find the right candidate.

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 300 people strong, located in Denmark and in Spain. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.

The Quantitative Analytics team at Centrica Energy is part of the Trading Analytics and Algorithms centre of excellence, and is responsible for:


Delivering quantitative analysis of complex and structured products, that provides insight to help traders to maximise value and manage risk
Designing and implementing complex mathematical models that allow for consistent pricing and joint risk quantification across multiple portfolios, enabling more holistic and optimal hedging decisions
Assisting originators in development of structured products across the Renewables, LNG, Gas & Power sectors.


As a Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of an agile team of c10 people located across our offices in both London (UK) and Aalborg (Denmark).

The successful candidate will be required to:


Produce high quality increments to the team’s model library working both individually and collaboratively
Assist/advise trading and origination via quantitative analysis and a strong mathematical/financial intuition
Leverage the teams cross-asset expertise to connect business locations, helping to identify synergies and increase efficiency.


What we’re looking for:


Master’s Degree or PhD qualification within science, mathematics or other quantitative subject
Good understanding of a variety of mathematical and statistical models used in finance
Experience with derivatives pricing and risk management systems
Experience of code development (ideally Python)
Familiarity or high level of interest in Energy / commodity markets
Strong Communicator and fluent in English language
Strong interpersonal skills.


Why should you apply?

We’re not a perfect place – but we’re a people place. Our priority is supporting all of the different realities our people face. Life is about so much more than work. We get it. That’s why we’ve designed our total rewards to give you the flexibility to choose what you need, when you need it, making sure that you and your family are supported not only financially, but physically and emotionally too. Visit the link below to discover why we’re a great place to work and what being part of more means for you.

https://www.morethanacareer.energy/centricaenergy

If you're full of energy, fired up about sustainability, and ready to craft not only a better tomorrow, but a better you, then come and find your purpose in a team where your voice matters, your growth is non-negotiable, and your ambitions are our priority.

Help us, help you. We would love for you to share any information about yourself throughout our recruitment process so that we can better understand you and help shape your journey.

Title: Impact Analyzer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".

We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.

How you can contribute and have an impact?


Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.


What we look for:


Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
Business viability mindset.
New business model experience
Customer journey understanding.
Lifecycle management.
New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
Workshop animation.
Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.


Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.

Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Amsterdam Netherlands

Title: Data Analytics Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
HTML:
Copenhagen, hybrid

This role is part of our Data team in Copenhagen. At DEPT®, we combine data, technology and marketing to solve brands’ business problems and drive revenue through a variety of digital solutions.

Job Purpose

As an Analytics Consultant at DEPT®, you work with our clients on the best data setup, implement these and educate the clients in the world of Analytics. Of course this role has its challenges. The death of the cookie is near, and in this role you will consult our clients to deal with this new reality. How do they need to set up their server-side measurement? Which new products and features should we test? How can we make the best use of Consent Mode, conversion uploads and more? And GA4. The end of the session, which is changing analytics like we know it. You like to dive into these questions and want to help our clients answer them. As an Analytics Consultant, you are the absolute expert in data collection and solving complex analytics cases. You know how to create and implement measurement setups, take care of server-to-server connections between owned and marketing platforms and help clients to implement the best data collection setup.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and configure tag management systems (eg. GTM) to ensure accurate data collection;
  • Develop measurement plans in collaboration with clients;
  • Troubleshoot and fix data discrepancies & tracking issues;
  • Conduct audits of data collection setups;
  • Collaborate with development teams to develop and maintain tracking across digital platforms;
  • Use data visualisation tools (eg. Looker Studio, Power BI) to present data in an easily understandable format;
  • Consult with clients and help them take their analytics setup to the next level.


What We Are Looking For

  • At least 2 years of experience in a data role, preferably at agency side;
  • Hands-on experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager;
  • Are proficient in Javascript;
  • Maybe you don't have the technical skills yet, but are eager to learn more about SQL, Python and Cloud;
  • Full working proficiency in the English language - spoken and written (proficiency in Danish is considered a plus, not a requirement);
  • Somebody who can switch from serious to play in a heartbeat;
  • An analytical, technical, independent profile with good communication skills.


WE OFFER

  • A healthy, varied and delicious lunch at the office;
  • A lot of fun social events such as Friday bars, company parties, team events, etc.;
  • A flexible, hybrid working policy and a great workplace in our awesome office in Christianshavn;
  • A reputation for doing good. DEPT® has been a Certified B Corp® since 2021 and named ‘Agency of the Year’ at both The Lovies and The Webby Awards;
  • Awesome clients. Whether big or small, local or global — at DEPT® you’ll get the opportunity to work with clients of all sizes and across all industries;
  • The opportunity for possibility. We want to enable you to do what you do best and help you develop your skills further with training and development;
  • Stay happy and healthy with a contribution to your health through the OpenUp platform, gym and wellness discounts, and healthy lunches at the office;
  • Global annual DEPT® Cares Month in which employees come together and donate their skills to support local charities.


WHO ARE WE?

We are pioneers at heart. What does that mean? We are always looking forward, thinking of what we can create tomorrow that does not exist today. We were born digital and we are a new model of agency, with a deep skillset in tech and marketing. That’s why we hire curious, self-driven, talented people who never stop innovating.

Our culture is big enough to cope and small enough to care. Meaning, that with people across 30+ countries, we’re big enough to provide you with the best tools, global opportunities, and benefits that help you thrive. While acting small by investing in you, your growth, your team, and giving you the autonomy to solve our clients problems, no matter where you are in the world.

DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION

At DEPT®, we take pride in creating an inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal opportunity to thrive. We actively seek to recruit, develop, nurture, and retain talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with varying skills and perspectives.

Not sure you meet all qualifications? Apply, and let us decide! Research shows that women and members of underrepresented groups tend not to apply for jobs when they think they may not meet every requirement, when in fact they do. We believe in giving everyone a fair chance to shine.

We also encourage you to reach out to us and discuss any reasonable adjustments we can make to support you throughout the recruitment process and your time with us.

Want to know more about our dedication to diversity, equity, and inclusion? Check out our efforts here.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Description

Are you passionate about data and looking to make a significant impact in a dynamic and innovative company? Micro Matic is seeking a talented Data Engineer to join our Group IT team. As a Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, building, and maintaining our data infrastructure, ensuring that our data is reliable, scalable, and accessible for various business needs.




Location: Odense, Denmark or Kaunas, Lithuania,




Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver high-quality data solutions.
Optimize and improve existing data systems for performance and scalability.
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous testing and validation.
Implement data security and privacy best practices.
Work with Microsoft Fabric to integrate and manage data across various platforms.
Be a part of Group IT and contribute to the implementation of a new global data platform setup.
Perform backend work to support data infrastructure and applications.




About you

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with database management systems.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure).
Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric and its applications in data engineering.
Experience with backend development and data infrastructure.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.




Why join us?

Be part of a forward-thinking company that values innovation and continuous improvement.
Work in a collaborative and supportive environment with opportunities for professional growth.
Contribute to exciting projects that have a real impact on the business.

Title: Data Analyst for Offshore Wind
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to contribute to the growth of a unique offshore wind data intelligence company within the Renewable Energy industry? Sea Impact is looking for a Data Analyst to drive software development and push the boundaries for different datasets.




Innovative Market Intelligence based on Unique Big Data Analysis for a Growing Offshore Wind Industry

At Sea Impact, we specialise in market intelligence for the offshore wind industry. We have developed a revolutionary market intelligence platform that provides key benchmarks for the design, installation, and maintenance of offshore wind farms. Our analyses are based on an innovative methodology of analysing vessel positions for market intelligence. We work with some of the world’s leading offshore wind developers, turbine OEMs and consultancies.




Help Us Create Unique Market Intelligence for Offshore Wind

Based in our Copenhagen office, you will lead the development of our data-driven solutions by analysing offshore wind activity and combining our unique offshore wind data with any publicly available data about the market development.




Your key responsibilities will include:

Data Analysis: Analyze offshore wind activities using Python, Power BI, and QGIS, extracting geospatial and operational insights.
Database Management & Integration: Maintain and optimize cloud-based PostgreSQL databases and develop efficient data pipelines for seamless integration with Power BI.
Predictive Analytics & Machine Learning: Design and implement ML-driven solutions to enhance market intelligence insights and expand our product offering.
Ad-hoc tasks: provide support for ad-hoc tasks such as developing custom reports.
Be the driver of Sea Impact's IT development and have the opportunity to shape and form the development




As this is a role in a small company you will have plenty of room to influence your position and take on new and exciting tasks as we grow.




Solution-Driven Data Analyst with a Strong Drive

You have a master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or similar. You are proficient in Python and SQL, have some experience in developing ML-based solutions and have previously worked with some of these tools: QGIS, PostgreSQL, Microsoft Azure, Power BI. Our ideal candidate is excited about being part of establishing a new organisation and creating industry-leading market intelligence for offshore wind. If you combine this with a proactive and entrepreneurial attitude and thrive in a fast-paced environment, you will enjoy “building something bigger together”.




Furthermore, you must have strong communication skills and function well in a collaborative environment. You are structured, proactive, and you are ready to learn and take on new challenges. As Sea Impact is a global company, you must have strong English communication skills.




Experience the Highest Degree of Involvement

A unique and challenging opportunity, where you will be part of forming the future growth of Sea Impact and success towards our clients. You will have the opportunity to play a central role in the development of Sea Impact and have chance to drive the development of market intelligence. Alongside a small team of dedicated problem-solvers, you are given the chance to learn and challenge yourself, while playing a vital part in the continued success of Sea Impact. Above that, you will join an ambitious team that is dedicated to delivering the highest quality, utilizing the diverse expertise and skillset we all bring. It is a prerequisite that you have strong English communication skills.




Sea Impact is dedicated to fostering a work environment that values diversity. We encourage all interested candidates to apply, regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, religion, or ethnicity.




Interested and want to know more?

If you have any questions or want to know more about the position, please contact People & Development via recruitment@peak-wind.com. We look forward to receiving your application & CV as soon as possible, latest by March 16th, 2025. Please apply through our webpage. Applications will be assessed on an ongoing basis.

Title: 4x IT Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company: BluEdge
Max Price rate (SEK/h): Open to Bid
Location: Copenhagen (DK)
Start date: 2025-02-18
End date (renewable): 2025-02-28


We are currently seeking 4 IT Analysts to join our Core Banking program team.

Responsibilities

The primary objective of the program is to transition from old local legacy systems to a unified Nordic core banking program and establish an Agreement Directory Service. The ideal candidates should be capable to contribute to the team responsible for building the Common Booking Component. They will be responsible for gathering requirements from business stakeholders and documenting them in the form of features and user stories. They should be capable of independently driving the requirements process, from collection and documentation to handover to developers. The role requires the ability to operate in a complex environment with multiple stakeholders and dependencies. Familiarity with tasks such as data mapping and data governance is essential.

Requirements


Professional knowledge of data mapping and data governance
Experience in the banking sector, preferably within a larger bank.
Extensive knowledge in the accounting area.
Extensive experience as a senior Business analyst and/or senior IT analyst.
Previous experience in a larger program with approximately 300+ employees.
Experience in a Nordic bank is advantageous.


Required Skills


IT Governance
Mapping
Business Analyst
IT Analyst


Languages


English (Proficient)


Start-date: ASAP

End-date: 28-02-2025

Location: Denmark, Nordics

Title: Data Analytics Business Partner
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 114 million registered users and 241,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 423+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.144.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are looking for a Data Analytics Business Partner to strengthen our knowledge around how to drive excellence in Operations.

While you will report directly to the Director of Analytics, you will work closely with our Strategy & Expansion teams, as well as members of the Global Management Team. Your mission will be to work as a trusted advisor to leadership in driving key strategic decisions, mapping strategy to data-driven ways of working, and championing scaled analysis across our Cluster Business Partnering team. You will be 1 of 6 Business Partners: while the others are dedicated to an Operational Leadership team in regional markets, you’ll be working on connecting the dots at the global level. The Business Partnering team works closely together to share cross-country insights in an efficient and scalable way.

Your role


Provide deep analytical insights to inform timely Sales, Strategy and Leadership decisions - either proactively, on a regular cadence (QBRs, MBRs), or through ad hoc projects
Mobilize the Cluster Business Partners to bring relevant & actionable insights from the rest of the Data & Analytics team to the Regional Operations leadership teams
Utilize the deep in-market expertise of the Cluster Business Partner team to proactively identify and build opportunities for scale and automation; prioritize and advocate for further scale via data products with our Solutions team
Elevate our Global Analytics specialisation by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects
Opportunity size and prioritise analytics ideas and questions from common themes across our markets and clusters, with the support of the COO, the Strategy team, and Operations VPs in our Expansion Markets


Requirements


You have significant experience in an analytical role supporting 2 or more of the following functions: Sales, Marketing, Operations, Finance, Strategy, Business Operations; or relevant work experience in Consulting
You are proficient in SQL, comfortable with Python or R, and proficient in manipulating data efficiently for ad-hoc analysis
You are experienced with Data Visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, PowerBI or similar
You are comfortable describing statistical uncertainty and educating non-technical audiences on how best to interpret and action off of new insights
You have proven experience in stakeholder management, with the ability to manage a high influx of requests in a structured way
You are driven by the “why” behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure you’re solving for the right thing
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment
You have the ability to communicate effectively and convincingly in an English-speaking organisation
Previous experience in a hyper growth start-up environment will be valued


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


A rare opportunity to work in a social impact company (and certified B Corporation!) where you get to wake up every day knowing you’re achieving positive change.
The opportunity to truly drive impact within your domain towards a planet with no food waste.
The experience of being part of an international company with 1300 + enthusiastic and highly talented teammates across 19 countries (and counting) – always ready to share knowledge and support!
Strong personal as well as professional development in an intense and high-growth scale-up environment.
An open company culture where you have the independence and room to unleash your creativity.
A strong team culture where successes are celebrated together.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.


This role can be based either in our Copenhagen office or in our London office.

How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 114 million registered users and 241,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 423+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.144.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are looking for a Data Analytics Business Partner to strengthen our knowledge around how to drive excellence in Operations.

While you will report directly to the Director of Analytics, you will work closely with our Strategy & Expansion teams, as well as members of the Global Management Team. Your mission will be to work as a trusted advisor to leadership in driving key strategic decisions, mapping strategy to data-driven ways of working, and championing scaled analysis across our Cluster Business Partnering team. You will be 1 of 6 Business Partners: while the others are dedicated to an Operational Leadership team in regional markets, you’ll be working on connecting the dots at the global level. The Business Partnering team works closely together to share cross-country insights in an efficient and scalable way.

Your role

  • Provide deep analytical insights to inform timely Sales, Strategy and Leadership decisions - either proactively, on a regular cadence (QBRs, MBRs), or through ad hoc projects
  • Mobilize the Cluster Business Partners to bring relevant & actionable insights from the rest of the Data & Analytics team to the Regional Operations leadership teams
  • Utilize the deep in-market expertise of the Cluster Business Partner team to proactively identify and build opportunities for scale and automation; prioritize and advocate for further scale via data products with our Solutions team
  • Elevate our Global Analytics specialisation by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects
  • Opportunity size and prioritise analytics ideas and questions from common themes across our markets and clusters, with the support of the COO, the Strategy team, and Operations VPs in our Expansion Markets

Requirements

  • You have significant experience in an analytical role supporting 2 or more of the following functions: Sales, Marketing, Operations, Finance, Strategy, Business Operations; or relevant work experience in Consulting
  • You are proficient in SQL, comfortable with Python or R, and proficient in manipulating data efficiently for ad-hoc analysis
  • You are experienced with Data Visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, PowerBI or similar
  • You are comfortable describing statistical uncertainty and educating non-technical audiences on how best to interpret and action off of new insights

  • A rare opportunity to work in a social impact company (and certified B Corporation!) where you get to wake up every day knowing you’re achieving positive change.
  • The opportunity to truly drive impact within your domain towards a planet with no food waste.
  • The experience of being part of an international company with 1300 + enthusiastic and highly talented teammates across 19 countries (and counting) – always ready to share knowledge and support!
  • Strong personal as well as professional development in an intense and high-growth scale-up environment.
  • An open company culture where you have the independence and room to unleash your creativity.
  • A strong team culture where successes are celebrated together.
  • We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.

This role can be based either in our Copenhagen office or in our London office.

  • We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.

Title: Jr. Data Engineer
Description:
The Job

We are looking for a Junior Data Engineer to join us at HelloFresh Nordics. Working in the Operations Tech team, you will support the design, build, and maintenance of data-driven solutions that impact our daily operations. Working closely with experienced team members, you’ll help develop reliable data pipelines, internal applications, and infrastructure—all while growing your technical skills and operational understanding.


This role is in-office at our Nordic HQ at Islands Brygge, Copenhagen.
You’ll join a close-knit team of four engineers, one student assistant, and a Technical Product Manager.
We value innovation, mutual respect, and personal growth in an inclusive environment.


If you’re excited by the prospect of working in a code-first, fast-moving environment—while ensuring the highest level of quality and reliability—then we’d love to hear from you!

You will…


Design, build, and maintain data pipelines using Databricks or Airflow on Kubernetes.
Develop and deploy Streamlit applications, backed by Postgres, to streamline operational workflows.
Write clean, efficient, and well-tested Python code, building a strong foundation in software best practices.
Learn and contribute to managing infrastructure using Terraform and configuring CI/CD pipelines via GitHub Workflows.
Gain exposure to AWS services (e.g., S3 and Glue) for data storage and transformation.
Work with cross-functional teams (e.g., logistics, procurement, production) to understand requirements and support operational systems.
Help monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data pipelines and internal apps to ensure smooth operations.
Contribute to an agile, detail-oriented culture, balancing speed with the need for robust and dependable operational systems.


You have…


A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or an Engineering field related to Operations / Supply Chain.
Proficiency in Python with a focus on writing maintainable, testable code.
Relevant internships or academic projects demonstrating hands-on work with data engineering or software development are a strong plus.
Good knowledge of SQL and familiarity with relational databases is a plus.
Basic understanding of orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow) and containerized environments (e.g., Kubernetes, Docker) is a plus.
An interest in learning about AWS services and Infrastructure as Code tools (e.g., Terraform) along with CI/CD processes.
Knowledge of operations and supply chain management is a plus.
Good communication skills in English, a proactive attitude, and the ability to work collaboratively with both technical and non-technical teams.
A keen eye for ensuring operational stability in a fast-paced environment.


We offer…


A diverse and vibrant international environment of 35+ different nationalities
The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe
A significant discount on your weekly HelloFresh box or Factor_ meals
Annual learning and development budget to grow and develop your skills
Subsidized healthy lunches everyday in our Copenhagen office
Mental health resources through online subscriptions
Monthly pension scheme including health insurance benefits
Additional perks: Discounts for our neighboring gyms, company events and parties, fruit & snacks in the office and free Friday bar


Are you up for a challenge?


Apply with your CV (In English please)
If we see a match, you’ll have a call with one of our recruiters to share more about what you can bring to the team
Are both sides still positive? Then we proceed to the assessment stage to assess key skills required for the job
We will be conducting interviews on an ongoing basis and will close down the position once the successful candidate has been found.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Senior Foundations Analyst)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 108 million registered users and 245,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 395+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1066.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (called "Senior Foundations Analyst" internally) to strengthen our use of data to inform our most business critical decisions. On a daily basis, you will be working with business leaders across various functional areas to inform how they measure success, how they use data to inform strategic decisions, and ensure they have the data visibility and tools they need to make progress on those strategies every day.

Your role


Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Design and deliver self-service tools to various functional groups for operational excellence
Generate new ideas for how to leverage the data we have to drive business performance
Elevate data literacy across the organisation, with an eye toward consistency, ease of understanding, and educating on the right way to use data in each function
Elevate the Global Analytics team by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects


Requirements


You have previous experience in analytical roles overtime
You are strongly proficient in Looker
You are strongly proficient in SQL
You have a breadth of experience mapping business questions to data problems
You are a great communicator and storyteller - someone who enjoys helping non-technical audiences see what you see in the numbers!
You are driven by the “why” behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure you’re solving for the right thing
You have experience managing multiple projects
You are passionate about data literacy
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: Game Analytics Team Lead
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
It’s an exciting time to join Tactile. We're a diverse team of storytellers, puzzle enthusiasts and casual mobile game creators. Our story began in 2008 in the heart of beautiful Copenhagen, and since then we have experienced continuous growth, establishing ourselves as one of the largest gaming companies in Denmark. In more recent years, we have been scaling fast, in big part thanks to the success of a little game called Lily’s Garden. Now we’re on a mission to solidify our position as one of the leaders in creating out-of-the-ordinary casual puzzle games.

With more than 350 talented individuals, we are a mix of over 55 nationalities and 43% women. We truly appreciate the richness of different experiences and perspectives that Tactilers bring to the game. This is why we foster a lean organisational culture, in which each individual is encouraged to take responsibility, be open and grow in their own way. We pride ourselves in cultivating a studio environment that stays away from crunch, that fosters your skills no matter what your discipline is, and one that gives you a place to be creative alongside other passionate and invested storytellers.

🚀 Your Role & Impact

We are currently growing our Analytics team and are in the search for the Lead Game Analyst.

In this key role, you will be responsible for ensuring that the foundation of our data infrastructure for Lily's Garden game is solid and consistent (from as early on as possible), as well as contributing to a broader vision for our game analytics as a whole. You'll lead a team of game analysts, shape the vision for analytics, provide data-driven insights to senior leadership, and drive initiatives to improve processes and solutions across the company.

So if you have prior experience in data analytics, team leadership, along with a big interest in understanding how games work and what makes them successful, then you might just be our missing piece! 🧩

This role is based in our beautiful Copenhagen office, as we truly believe that when talented people work closely together, amazing things happen! We therefore offer full relocation support to those coming from outside of Denmark. Here’s what you'll do on the day-to-day:


You will uncover insights, identify challenges and opportunities and develop strategies for improving our games
Enhance our capabilities in detailed game analytics and operational reporting by shaping our data stack and platform
Managing one of our talented Data teams
You will be collaborating closely with the rest of the game team to establish, measure and track key metrics for success
Communicating key insights and findings to cross-functional teams
Keeping an up-to-date knowledge of project KPIs
Stay on top of the current industry trends and best practices, applying them where appropriate to enhance product insights capabilities


What we’re looking for:


Strong background in leading strategic data projects and mentoring a diverse team of data analysts
You have a proven track record of working in a senior capacity with multiple stakeholders in fast paced environments.
You have a strong background in data analytics and a good understanding of applied statistics (such as sampling, hypothesis testing and ab testing)
Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and effectively communicate findings to all audiences to drive informed product decisions.
Strong technical skills, with proficiency in SQL and Python or other scripting languages
Experience with large data sets and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker, PowerBI)


You'll make us extra excited if you also have:


Experience with casual mobile games and an understanding of today’s casual mobile games market


What’s in it for you?

🌆 Beautiful office space with probably the best view in Copenhagen

🩺 Pension and private health insurance

💻 A chance to work with the latest tools and technology

📚 Opportunities for individual growth with development talks as well as workshops, books and courses

🌮 Daily, healthy organic breakfast and lunch prepared by our professional chefs in-house

🥳 Social activities, including game nights, book club, Friday bar and more

✈️ Relocation package if you are coming from outside of Denmark

🔍 Free Danish lessons with our in-house Danish teacher

Our interview process

Submit your application via the fill-in form at the top of this page. This is the easiest and fastest way to get in touch with our recruiters. We foster an inclusive culture and accessible workplace and want to make sure we provide everyone with the same opportunities for success. This is why we encourage you to apply regardless of your gender, sexuality, age, nationality, neurodiversity or disability. We review applications based on competencies and experience, so please do tell us about your favourite projects and technologies.

After we review your application, you can expect to go through the following conversations: ☕ Introductory chat with your recruiter to make sure we’re aligned on the scope of the role and your skillset and to provide more context for you. 🤝 Chat with a Data analytics leadership member. 🧪 A test assignment, to see your skills in action. 🤝 In this final step, you’ll be meeting with the team to present your test solutions and discuss the more technical aspects of the role.

We are pretty thorough with our hiring process. It is important to us that we choose new Tactilers carefully - just as it is vital to ensure that we are the right place for you.‍

We want to ensure you have a great candidate experience whilst in our recruitment process. We will do everything we can within reason to make sure that your interview takes place in an environment that fairly and accurately assesses your skills. If you need assistance or accommodation, please let us know. We look forward to receiving your application! 👋
