Title: Data Engineer
Place: Vejle, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
GPV is on a journey towards implementing a modern Data Platform and we want you to join us!

Maybe you are currently working as a consultant but are tired of time registration and having to focus on five different projects at the same time? Or maybe you are stuck as an in-house developer at a place where things are standing still, and you feel like you being there doesn’t make a difference? Then join GPV for a greenfield project where we are moving from a mix of on-prem technologies to a modern setup using Microsoft Fabric.




Your role

As a Data Engineer you will initially support our on-prem Microsoft data solutions, before transitioning into a key player in our future Fabric solution. Expect that your primary work the first 6 months will be focused on learning our legacy Microsoft platforms, taking over the responsibility from a colleague moving to a different IT position. The role will then be a split with approximately 50/50 time on maintaining and optimising the old platforms, and developing the new solution in Fabric with the knowledge you have gained in the first half year.

GPV currently have several legacy ERP systems due to mergers, and your job is to secure reporting in the data platforms on top of these systems. Further we are in the process of rolling out D365FO with the first pilot site going live at the end of 2025. You will be an important part of this project, where the new Data Platform should contain the needed reporting at go-live. For both the existing and new platform you will be part of the complete process from requirement gathering with end-users, extracting source data, data modelling and building the cubes or semantic models in PowerBI.




What We Offer

You will be part of the team that transitions GPV into a digitized future, going from a complex setup with several different on-prem data platforms to a more streamlined setup in Microsoft Fabric.
We offer a job where you can really make a difference and be challenged, while at the same time having fun with your colleagues.
You will be offered a competitive salary that matches your qualifications and there are of course the standard things you would expect from the workplace, like mobile phone, internet provided at your home, modern maternity terms, great coffee and a good canteen.
Further there are social activities with the staff association and the opportunity to being part of an already established Data ERFA group with associated companies.
To support learning there are possibilities to attend relevant conferences and take relevant certifications, to help your transition from the on-prem tech-stack to the Fabric experiences.




We are looking for a data engineer with a relevant educational background and 3+ years of experience, with a focus on data solutions on the on-prem Microsoft tech-stack and an eager to learn new cloud tools together with skilled colleagues. You speak and communicate fluently in English, and Danish language is also an advantage but not a requirement.

You are probably humble by nature and cannot checkoff all the requirements below, but hopefully there are a lot of known topics and you are able to quickly learn the rest because you are curious and like to explore.

Microsoft T-SQL, with good knowledge of writing efficient SQL code, defining views and stored procedures, looking at execution plans, etc.
SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), with hands-on experience of extracting data from different source systems, develop ELT logic and deployment to SQL servers, using the SQL Agent for orchestration and monitoring of nightly loads
SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), having developed logic preferably both in tabular cubes (DAX) and multidimensional cubes (MDX)
SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), with some understanding of how to build reports, deployment and access management
Data Modelling, using SQL code and the Kimball methodology to build facts and dimensions
Azure DevOps, where Git repositories is a natural part of the development process
Communication skills, because your job is to collaborate with both the rest of the Data Team and in general with end-users in the business, in an international setup




Further it is beneficial if some of the following topics are also in your toolbelt:

Microsoft PowerBI, building reports and the underlying semantic models (DAX), maybe utilizing external tools like Tabular Editor
Microsoft Fabric (excluding PowerBI), either hands-on from a project or self-learning with some of the components. Maybe you have or are planning to take the DP-600 certification.
Azure Services, that are used in batch related data solutions (ADF, SQL, KeyVault, Storage Accounts, etc.)
Power Platform, using Power Apps and Power Automate, both on its own and in combination with PowerBI reports
D365FO, understanding of the data model from the ERP system where you have preferably worked with data modelling and reporting on top




GPV is an international company and the 3 members of the Data Team are located in 2 different countries. You will be working closely with the Data Platform Manager and Lead Data Engineer in the Vejle area and we expect that the transportation from your place of residence to the office to be a maximum of 60 minutes. You will also cooperate with our external partners that support our journey, where they have provided the Fabric framework and needed support in the project.

Learn more about GPV in our website: https://gpv-group.com/

Show more

Title: Senior Data Strategist
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to set the strategic direction for our data architecture and collaborate with architects and cross-functional teams to integrate digital technologies, data management practices, and IT infrastructure? And do you want to develop yourself professionally and personally in a global conglomerate within hearing instruments, audio-, video-, and gaming equipment? Then you might be our new colleague.

As our Senior Data Strategist, you will be responsible for the design, implementation, and management of our data landscape. In this key position, you will ensure a scalable and robust architecture that aligns with, and empowers, our vision for the data domain.

This position is important for progressing key initiatives and improving our data-centric efforts throughout GN;

"This role is crucial in driving our data strategy forward, directly impacting our ability to innovate and remain competitive across our industries".


Elaborates, Ann Fogelgren, CIO of the GN Group.


The team you will be part of:

Based at our global HQ, located in Ballerup, Denmark, you will be part of our newly established Data & Intelligence domain– and report to Director Stefan Wideland.

As part of an innovative and collaborative team, you will transform our data architecture. You will thereby collaborate across the organization with other architects and experts within data management, data governance, platform development, data engineering, data activation, BI, Analytics, GenAI enablement, to name a few.

We are a diverse team tied together by the aspiration to deliver the best solutions together with our business partners across the organization – including the wider Global IT organization – Digital, Data and IT(DDI). With colleagues from across the world – and at different geographical locations – you are part of a collaborate, fun and hybrid work environment.

Your contribution is appreciated, and you will be directing efforts in the following areas:


Implementing Data Strategy: Directing the definition and operationalization of our Data Strategy, managing one or more workstreams in a cross-functional setting, with a focus on decentralized data architectures and data product thinking.
Directing overall Data Architecture: Develop and implement a comprehensive data platform architecture that aligns with the organization's strategic goals and establish the needed structures to facilitate decision-making - including domain data architectures.
Establish Frameworks for Data Distribution, Governance, and Activation: Develop and implement robust frameworks and principles to facilitate seamless data flows and accessibility. Focus on creating standardized processes and best practices for data integration and pipeline management. Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and compliance with regulations by setting clear standards. Leverage high-quality data through these established practices to consistently generate business value, including the use of data contracts, data federation and federated data governance.
Innovation and AI Integration: Stay updated on industry trends and technologies and manage the integration of AI into our strategic roadmaps to support future aspirations and enhance data capabilities.
Technical Teams and Manage Architecture Projects: Provide leadership and advisory to technical teams and guide architectural decisions across projects, ensuring they meet established standards and align with business objectives.


To thrive in the role, we imagine that you:


Extensive Knowledge of Data Technologies: You have comprehensive skills in data technologies, particularly around Cloud (Azure), Data Integration and Distribution technologies (Integration platforms, API’s, Data Products), Data storage and Management (such as, Data Warehouse, Data Lake, and Data Lakehouse), and possess a solid view of how to utilize and activate business value through Analytics and AI-technologies, with an emphasis on scalable data management.
Proficient in Data Management Principles and Best Practices: You exhibit deep knowledge of data management principles and industry best practices to develop robust and scalable solutions, for example the design and application of Data Mesh.
Communication and Collaboration Skills: Your communication skills effectively convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. You are comfortable communicating and collaborating with a wide variety of business stakeholders, including Executive Management on data strategy initiatives.
Innovative and Creative Mindset: You bring a creative approach to problem-solving, with a willingness to challenge established practices and secure innovation in data architecture and strategy.
Leadership and Project Management Abilities: You have the capability to inspire leadership, effectively guiding technical teams and overseeing architecture projects to ensure they align with business aims and are completed effectively.


We encourage you to apply

Even if you don’t match all the above-mentioned skills, we will gladly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value a mindset, motivation, and energy, that aligns with our core values, to not only ensure success for you, but for your team and the wider GN organization as well.

We are dedicated to an inclusive recruitment process

All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment. As such, we encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

Should you have any special requirements for the Interview please let the hiring manager know upon accepting invitation to interview.

How to apply?

Use the ‘APPLY’ link no later 23rd of March 2025. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don’t wait to send yours.

On a time crunch? Feel free to only submit your up-to-date CV including a few sentences outlining your motivation for applying – quick and easy.

If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Director, Data & Intelligence Domain, Stefan Wideland on LinkedIn.

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our leading intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and driven by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We help people with hearing loss overcome real-life challenges, improve communication and collaboration for businesses and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiast.

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application.

Title: Data Engineer - Challenger Academy 2025
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you excited about transforming industries with cutting-edge data technologies? Imagine working with clients across various sectors, helping them harness the power of data to solve their toughest challenges. We are looking for Challengers ready to dive into exciting data engineering projects from day one, designing scalable data pipelines and turning raw data into actionable insights.




Perks of joining our amazing team

You will be joining our NewTech team, who drive business transformation through innovation, automation, and data-driven insights. Our team delivers impactful projects across industries, always pushing the boundaries of AI, automation, and strategic analysis to create real value for clients. Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do, with a diverse team of business analysts, automation experts, and technology enthusiasts.




We foster a supportive, open culture where new ideas are encouraged and valued. Our team thrives on collaboration and continuous learning, ensuring everyone has opportunities for personal and professional growth. Beyond work, we enjoy social events and team-building activities that strengthen our close-knit community.




What sets us apart is our relentless focus on innovation, consistently staying ahead with the latest technology in automation and AI. Through our hands-on "consulting-by-doing" approach, we provide real-world experience from day one, empowering our team to make a tangible impact while accelerating both professional development and client success.




KPMG Challenger Academy

Are you looking for a graduate programme? We think we have something better! At KPMG, you have the freedom to shape your own career. With endless opportunities to grow, learn, and take on new challenges, the KPMG Challenger Academy is where you build a future you are excited about. As part of the Academy, you set your own goals, work on interesting client projects, and get the best training to develop yourself. To make things even better, you get your own Koach (not Coach—we did spell-check this job ad, but KPMG’s equivalent of a performance manager) to help you reach your full potential and achieve your goals.




The Academy is designed for your early career after graduating your master studies. The Academy is split into 3 dynamic off-site modules, each designed to get you started in your new role and develop you as a consultant. Regardless of whether you are a recent graduate or bring previous experience, we ensure that everyone starts from the same point with equal opportunities to grow professionally.




Curious to know more about the KPMG Challenger Academy? You can read much more here.




Do you recognize yourself in the following?

You are passionate about building data systems that empower organizations through intelligent data use. You thrive when solving complex challenges, especially in designing and managing scalable data pipelines and architecture. You enjoy working with SQL, ETL processes, and cloud platforms, ensuring the seamless flow of quality data across systems. Python, Microsoft tools, and Git are part of your toolkit, and you’re excited to apply these skills to build resilient data environments. Above all, you have a deep interest in data as the foundation for AI and analytics, and you’re driven to explore how cutting-edge technologies can enhance data systems.




Examples of tasks that you will do:

Design and develop data pipelines that efficiently handle large datasets across multiple platforms.
Design, develop, and maintain data infrastructure to support operational processes, reporting needs, AI and machine learning models
Collaborate with cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, GCP) to build scalable data architectures.
Implement ETL processes to ensure smooth data integration and maintain data quality.
Work with Python, Microsoft tools, and Git for coding, automation, and version control.
Contribute to building a robust data foundation for AI and analytics solutions.




Are you ready to take on the challenge and become part of KPMG? Send your application today!

If you have any questions or would like more information, please contact Christian Dausgaard cdausgaard@kpmg.com or on phone +45 40 99 77 56.




We are excited to receive your application. The deadline for applying is 13 April or as soon as we have found our new team member. This might be before the final deadline since we invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis.




Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail to ensure GDPR compliance.




At KPMG, we are committed to developing diverse talent at all levels. We encourage all interested candidates to apply, regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, religion, or ethnicity.




We can’t wait to hear from you!

Show more
HTML:
Are you excited about transforming industries with cutting-edge data technologies? Imagine working with clients across various sectors, helping them harness the power of data to solve their toughest challenges. We are looking for Challengers ready to dive into exciting data engineering projects from day one, designing scalable data pipelines and turning raw data into actionable insights.


Perks of joining our amazing team

You will be joining our NewTech team, who drive business transformation through innovation, automation, and data-driven insights. Our team delivers impactful projects across industries, always pushing the boundaries of AI, automation, and strategic analysis to create real value for clients. Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do, with a diverse team of business analysts, automation experts, and technology enthusiasts.


We foster a supportive, open culture where new ideas are encouraged and valued. Our team thrives on collaboration and continuous learning, ensuring everyone has opportunities for personal and professional growth. Beyond work, we enjoy social events and team-building activities that strengthen our close-knit community.


What sets us apart is our relentless focus on innovation, consistently staying ahead with the latest technology in automation and AI. Through our hands-on "consulting-by-doing" approach, we provide real-world experience from day one, empowering our team to make a tangible impact while accelerating both professional development and client success.


KPMG Challenger Academy

Are you looking for a graduate programme? We think we have something better! At KPMG, you have the freedom to shape your own career. With endless opportunities to grow, learn, and take on new challenges, the KPMG Challenger Academy is where you build a future you are excited about. As part of the Academy, you set your own goals, work on interesting client projects, and get the best training to develop yourself. To make things even better, you get your own Koach (not Coach—we did spell-check this job ad, but KPMG’s equivalent of a performance manager) to help you reach your full potential and achieve your goals.


The Academy is designed for your early career after graduating your master studies. The Academy is split into 3 dynamic off-site modules, each designed to get you started in your new role and develop you as a consultant. Regardless of whether you are a recent graduate or bring previous experience, we ensure that everyone starts from the same point with equal opportunities to grow professionally.


Curious to know more about the KPMG Challenger Academy? You can read much more here.


Do you recognize yourself in the following?

You are passionate about building data systems that empower organizations through intelligent data use. You thrive when solving complex challenges, especially in designing and managing scalable data pipelines and architecture. You enjoy working with SQL, ETL processes, and cloud platforms, ensuring the seamless flow of quality data across systems. Python, Microsoft tools, and Git are part of your toolkit, and you’re excited to apply these skills to build resilient data environments. Above all, you have a deep interest in data as the foundation for AI and analytics, and you’re driven to explore how cutting-edge technologies can enhance data systems.


Examples of tasks that you will do:

  • Design and develop data pipelines that efficiently handle large datasets across multiple platforms.
  • Design, develop, and maintain data infrastructure to support operational processes, reporting needs, AI and machine learning models
  • Collaborate with cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, GCP) to build scalable data architectures.
  • Implement ETL processes to ensure smooth data integration and maintain data quality.
  • Work with Python, Microsoft tools, and Git for coding, automation, and version control.
  • Contribute to building a robust data foundation for AI and analytics solutions.


Are you ready to take on the challenge and become part of KPMG? Send your application today!

If you have any questions or would like more information, please contact Christian Dausgaard cdausgaard@kpmg.com or on phone +45 40 99 77 56.


We are excited to receive your application. The deadline for applying is 13 April or as soon as we have found our new team member. This might be before the final deadline since we invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis.


Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail to ensure GDPR compliance.


At KPMG, we are committed to developing diverse talent at all levels. We encourage all interested candidates to apply, regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, religion, or ethnicity.


We can’t wait to hear from you!

Title: Student Analyst
Place: Haderslev, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about finding answers in our data and eager to gain hands-on experience in a dynamic, fast-paced environment? Do you want to contribute to a data-driven decision making at BESTSELLER?

If yes to the above, the role of Student Analyst within our Data & Reporting team is the perfect opportunity for you!

THE TEAM

As a part of the Logistics Data & Reporting team, you will get experienced colleagues that work with passion and commitment to drive innovation and lead the data path forward . We have the necessary priority and trust from the business that we support to execute on our ambitious goals. We must deliver one truth and data transparency, which requires us to test new technologies and ideas. All while balancing accuracy and continuous improvement, supporting BESTSELLER’s continued global success.

THE ROLE

As a Student Analyst, you’ll play an important role in supporting our journey towards data transparency. Your tasks will include:


Build Power BI reports in accordance with a specification
Supporting our full-time Analysts in understanding the data and build reports
Verifying and cross-checking data to ensure accuracy and consistency
Investigate reports that shows incorrect data
Creating and improving data visualisations and dashboards in Power BI for better user experience


Your Benefits


Gain practical experience in presenting and communicating data
Work alongside a supportive, experienced team
Develop and sharpen your skills in data analysis
Be part of a fast-growing, global fashion company


YOUR PROFILE

We’re looking for someone who is curious, proactive, and eager to learn. Ideally, you’ll bring:


Current enrolment in a relevant programme, such as supply chain management or data analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
A desire to contribute and thrive in a fast-paced environment
Knowledge of MS Power BI, DAX or basic SQL is a plus, but not required


This is a fantastic opportunity to gain real-world experience and make a meaningful impact on our supply chain. If you’re ready to take on this exciting challenge, we’d love to hear from you!

WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact Mikael Bertelsen at +45 30 85 37 15. If not, apply today with your CV and cover letter. We review applications on an ongoing basis, so don’t miss your chance to join our dynamic team – the deadline is April 6th 2025.

EMPLOYMENT

15-20 hours per week, with flexible working hours and expected presence in the office 1-2 days a week.

LOCATION

Your work location is our distribution centre in Haderslev.

About Bestseller Logistics

BESTSELLER Logistics is responsible for all inbound and outbound logistics in BESTSELLER Group. We operate five logistics centres in Denmark, with a sixth centre being constructed in the Netherlands. We have more than 400,000 m2 of warehouse space and import approx. 16 million boxes per year. More than 600 colleagues keep the wheels running and we offer career opportunities within Logistics Development, Customs, Shipping, HSE, Operations, Controlling, Facility Services and more.

Join us and become part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.
Show more

Title: Graduate, Dataanalytiker til Kreditprocesser
Description:
Bliver du færdig med din kandidat til sommer og overvejer, hvad du skal gøre herefter? Så har du nu muligheden for at blive Graduate hos Jyske Bank!

Her kan du udfolde dit potentiale i en organisation med et højt fagligt niveau og blive en del af et spændende og socialt arbejdsmiljø. Vi er klar til at guide dig hele vejen, og sammen skræddersyr vi et forløb, der passer til netop dine faglige ønsker.

Som Graduate hos os får du muligheden for at afprøve forskellige jobfunktioner i en stor organisation, hvilket bygger et solidt fundament for din fremtid.

Vi tilbyder:



Et intensivt forløb med fokus på din karriere og garanteret fastansættelse efter 18 måneder
En fleksibel arbejdsplads med en sund balance mellem arbejde og fritid
En fast mentor fra dag et for at sikre kontinuerlig udvikling
Et godt netværk af Graduates og kolleger
Løbende evalueringer med din Graduateprogrammanager og nærmeste leder
Attraktiv løn- og pensionspakke, sundhedsforsikring, dækning ved kritisk sygdom, heltidsulykkesforsikring, tandforsikring og virksomhedsoverenskomst.



Graduate i Kreditprocesser

Hos Kreditprocesser arbejder vi målrettet på digitalisering og automatisering indenfor kreditområdet. Vores primære kunde er bankens rådgivere og servicecentre indenfor privatkundeområdet.

Vi har stor erfaring med at automatisere dele af forretningsprocessen, og din opgave bliver at gennemskue og skabe mening i data, så de kan omsættes til modeller og værktøjer til understøttelse af kreditprocessen. Dette sker i tæt samarbejde med både forretningsudviklere og IT-udviklere, som indgår som en del af teamet. Det er en fordel, hvis du har erfaring med strukturering og analyse af store datasæt og gerne via bearbejdning i SAS og T-SQL.

Dine arbejdsopgaver vil blive tilpasset dine interesser, erfaringer og uddannelsesbaggrund. De kunne være:



Dataanalyse og afdækning af forretningsmæssige potentialer i tæt samarbejde med vores erfarne forretningskonsulenter
Modeludvikling – fra den indledende refinement til kodning i Java
Porteføljetest og analyse af konsekvenser ifm. implementering af ændringer til modellerne
Opfølgning og analyser på hvordan vores produkter bliver anvendt



Afdelingen, Kreditprocesser, består af 28 medarbejdere fordelt på fire agile teams. Vi har et godt sammenhold og værdsætter både faglig og social trivsel. Vi tilbyder fleksible arbejdsforhold, mulighed for hjemmearbejde og frihed under ansvar. Der er rig mulighed for faglig udvikling og karriereveje i hele Jyske Bank-koncernen.

Din profil

Vi forestiller os, at du læser eller har læst en kandidatuddannelse indenfor økonomi, matematik, datalogi, data science eller lign. Har du en anden relevant kandidatuddannelse og interesse i opgaverne, ser vi meget gerne en ansøgning fra dig, hvor du beskriver, hvordan din uddannelse kan spille sammen med ovenstående opgaver.

Din hverdag som Graduate i Jyske Bank

Vi praktiserer værdibaseret ledelse i banken, hvilket betyder, at tillid gives fra dag ét. Du får derfor hurtigt få et selvstændigt opgaveansvar. Vi ved, at overgangen fra studielivet kan være udfordrende, så du får støtte fra din leder, mentor og Graduate programmanager for at tilpasse dig bedst muligt.

Vores rekrutteringsproces

Send din ansøgning, cv og karakterer hurtigst muligt og senest den 1. april, da vi evaluerer ansøgningerne løbende.

Den første samtale vil foregå online via Teams. Går du videre, vil der være en fysisk anden samtale med to analyser: en logisk- og en personlighedsanalyse. HR Rekrutteringspartner Jens Trøst Poulsen og ansættende leder Helle Brøndum deltager i begge samtaler.

Din arbejdsplads vil være Jyske Banks hjemsted i Silkeborg. Der er parkeringsmuligheder for medarbejdere med bil, og tog- og busstationer ligger i nærheden af arbejdspladsen.

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen eller Graduateprogrammet, så er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Programmanager Jens Trøst Poulsen på +45 89 89 25 90 eller employerbranding@jyskebank.dk.
Show more

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen eller Graduateprogrammet, så er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Programmanager Jens Trøst Poulsen på +45 89 89 25 90 eller employerbranding@jyskebank.dk.

Title: (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst - based at our Luxembourg
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Legal Directorate (JU) – Coordination Division (COORD) – at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst* - This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.


internal benchmark (Associate) Officer Business Support for IT Applications


Panel interviews are forseen as of March 2025.

Purpose

This role is based in the Coordination Division of the Legal Directorate. As an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst, you will work in coordination with a Senior Legal Engineering and Innovation Officer to: (i) co-ordinate the prospecting of new applications suitable for the Legal Directorate, (ii) ensure maintenance, assistance, development and deployment of IT applications for the Legal Directorate, (iii) liaise with stakeholders in the Legal Directorate to ensure close alignment with business needs, and (iv) contribute to successful IT project delivery and change management. You will also contribute to the development and maintenance of the Legal Directorate’s intranet presence and to compliance with the Bank’s data governance and data quality frameworks.

Operating Network

You will report to and work under the supervision of the Head of Division of JU Coordination. You will work closely with the senior management team of the Legal Directorate, JU divisions and various other counterparts. You will cooperate with central IT Services with other Data Officers and with external consultants.

Accountabilities


Contribute to the development and deployment of new IT applications in the Legal Directorate to ensure broad-based, timely and efficient take up of new technologies
Provide support to internal clients concerning existing IT applications used by the Legal Directorate
Develop, deploy and provide ongoing support for the intranet presence of the Legal Directorate
Find new use cases for existing or new IT applications, taking into account the needs of the Legal Directorate relative to the overall IT environment of the Bank
Perform the role of JU Data Officer by: (i) taking the lead in matters related to compliance with EIBG’s data governance, data management and data quality framework, (ii) identifying and remedying data governance issues adversely affecting the functioning of the Legal Directorate; and (iii) participating in meetings of the Information Governance Steering Committee and analogous bodies to represent the interests of the Legal Directorate
Contribute to streamlining of JU internal processes and map, standardize, control, and automate legal workflows, documents, templates, and electronic records
Provide change management support to IT, Legal Tech & Innovation projects in the Legal Directorate


Qualifications


University degree, preferably in Business Administration, Computer Science/Engineering and / or in another area relevant to the job
At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in a role related to IT engineering and/or innovation
Familiarity with the SDLC (software development lifecycle), ideally at the EIBG or other relevant organization, is required
Business analysis and change management experience would be a strong asset
Knowledge of all or most of the following: Microsoft Sharepoint online, Business Object, Microsoft 365, OpenText Livelink, Smart-IT is required
Excellent organisational skills and ability to prioritise and meet deadlines, with strong result and customer orientation
Understanding of the EIB ’s mission, organisation and activities
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (*) with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage


Competencies

Find out more about EIB core competencies here

To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

Title: Senior Product Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

But what truly sets us apart? Our people. We’re a diverse group of innovative thinkers, creators, and problem-solvers who believe in delivering an incredible product—and having fun while doing it.

The Opportunity

We're looking for a Senior Product Analyst to join our Product Analytics Team - a team focused on instrumenting and using data to enable better product decisions and opportunities.

You’ll be bringing your perspectives and recommendations on our business and customers to help drive better decisions for our product, and communicate and influence teams and stakeholders through close collaboration.

Veo is in a foundational stage in how we approach building a shared understanding of metrics, baselines and drivers, and so you will play a key role in ensuring proper instrumentation and tracking, as well as ensuring that teams have common metrics which best align with goals and are build with an eye towards reusability.

Key Responsibilities


Common Metrics & KPIs: Define, implement, and maintain the metrics that align with product goals—ensuring they’re reusable, well-documented, and widely understood across teams
Quantitative Research & Insights: Conduct deep-dive analyses and experiments to verify product opportunities, making data-driven recommendations that inform our roadmap
Instrumentation & Event Tracking: Oversee proper tracking for product features. Validate, test, and document analytics events to ensure accurate and consistent data collection
Cross-Functional Alignment: Ensure all relevant teams—product, marketing, engineering, etc.—have access to meaningful insights that guide decision-making and align with our business objectives




Requirements


5+ years of professional experience in a data analytics role, ideally within SaaS, sports technology, or other analytics-driven products
Proven ability to handle ad-hoc requests, manage stakeholder expectations, and deliver actionable insights
Solid experience with setting up event tracking and instrumenting features (we use Segment)
Strong experience based knowledge in SQL and Python (or similar language)
Acumen on product intuition
Experience with BigQuery, Looker, Amplitude, Segment or similar tools
Track record of translating complex analyses into actionable recommendations
Experience setting up and running experiments
Full professional proficiency in English




Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

We value diversity and inclusion and welcome applicants from all backgrounds, even if your experience doesn’t completely match every qualification listed. What matters most is your creativity, potential, and ability to contribute meaningfully.

Title: Data Analytics Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
HTML:
Copenhagen, hybrid

This role is part of our Data team in Copenhagen. At DEPT®, we combine data, technology and marketing to solve brands’ business problems and drive revenue through a variety of digital solutions.

Job Purpose

As an Analytics Consultant at DEPT®, you work with our clients on the best data setup, implement these and educate the clients in the world of Analytics. Of course this role has its challenges. The death of the cookie is near, and in this role you will consult our clients to deal with this new reality. How do they need to set up their server-side measurement? Which new products and features should we test? How can we make the best use of Consent Mode, conversion uploads and more? And GA4. The end of the session, which is changing analytics like we know it. You like to dive into these questions and want to help our clients answer them. As an Analytics Consultant, you are the absolute expert in data collection and solving complex analytics cases. You know how to create and implement measurement setups, take care of server-to-server connections between owned and marketing platforms and help clients to implement the best data collection setup.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and configure tag management systems (eg. GTM) to ensure accurate data collection;
  • Develop measurement plans in collaboration with clients;
  • Troubleshoot and fix data discrepancies & tracking issues;
  • Conduct audits of data collection setups;
  • Collaborate with development teams to develop and maintain tracking across digital platforms;
  • Use data visualisation tools (eg. Looker Studio, Power BI) to present data in an easily understandable format;
  • Consult with clients and help them take their analytics setup to the next level.


What We Are Looking For

  • At least 2 years of experience in a data role, preferably at agency side;
  • Hands-on experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager;
  • Are proficient in Javascript;
  • Maybe you don't have the technical skills yet, but are eager to learn more about SQL, Python and Cloud;
  • Full working proficiency in the English language - spoken and written (proficiency in Danish is considered a plus, not a requirement);
  • Somebody who can switch from serious to play in a heartbeat;
  • An analytical, technical, independent profile with good communication skills.


WE OFFER

  • A healthy, varied and delicious lunch at the office;
  • A lot of fun social events such as Friday bars, company parties, team events, etc.;
  • A flexible, hybrid working policy and a great workplace in our awesome office in Christianshavn;
  • A reputation for doing good. DEPT® has been a Certified B Corp® since 2021 and named ‘Agency of the Year’ at both The Lovies and The Webby Awards;
  • Awesome clients. Whether big or small, local or global — at DEPT® you’ll get the opportunity to work with clients of all sizes and across all industries;
  • The opportunity for possibility. We want to enable you to do what you do best and help you develop your skills further with training and development;
  • Stay happy and healthy with a contribution to your health through the OpenUp platform, gym and wellness discounts, and healthy lunches at the office;
  • Global annual DEPT® Cares Month in which employees come together and donate their skills to support local charities.


WHO ARE WE?

We are pioneers at heart. What does that mean? We are always looking forward, thinking of what we can create tomorrow that does not exist today. We were born digital and we are a new model of agency, with a deep skillset in tech and marketing. That’s why we hire curious, self-driven, talented people who never stop innovating.

Our culture is big enough to cope and small enough to care. Meaning, that with people across 30+ countries, we’re big enough to provide you with the best tools, global opportunities, and benefits that help you thrive. While acting small by investing in you, your growth, your team, and giving you the autonomy to solve our clients problems, no matter where you are in the world.

DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION

At DEPT®, we take pride in creating an inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal opportunity to thrive. We actively seek to recruit, develop, nurture, and retain talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with varying skills and perspectives.

Not sure you meet all qualifications? Apply, and let us decide! Research shows that women and members of underrepresented groups tend not to apply for jobs when they think they may not meet every requirement, when in fact they do. We believe in giving everyone a fair chance to shine.

We also encourage you to reach out to us and discuss any reasonable adjustments we can make to support you throughout the recruitment process and your time with us.

Want to know more about our dedication to diversity, equity, and inclusion? Check out our efforts here.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Description

Are you passionate about data and looking to make a significant impact in a dynamic and innovative company? Micro Matic is seeking a talented Data Engineer to join our Group IT team. As a Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, building, and maintaining our data infrastructure, ensuring that our data is reliable, scalable, and accessible for various business needs.




Location: Odense, Denmark or Kaunas, Lithuania,




Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver high-quality data solutions.
Optimize and improve existing data systems for performance and scalability.
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous testing and validation.
Implement data security and privacy best practices.
Work with Microsoft Fabric to integrate and manage data across various platforms.
Be a part of Group IT and contribute to the implementation of a new global data platform setup.
Perform backend work to support data infrastructure and applications.




About you

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with database management systems.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure).
Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric and its applications in data engineering.
Experience with backend development and data infrastructure.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.




Why join us?

Be part of a forward-thinking company that values innovation and continuous improvement.
Work in a collaborative and supportive environment with opportunities for professional growth.
Contribute to exciting projects that have a real impact on the business.

  • Contribute to exciting projects that have a real impact on the business.

Title: Student Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re searching for a Student Analyst to join our Commercial team based in Copenhagen Denmark!




About PureGym:




Founded in 2009, the PureGym Group is one of the largest gym operators in Europe and provides high-quality, low-cost fitness facilities. The Group has more than 2million members across 500+ gyms and holds market leading positions across the UK, Denmark and Switzerland. By providing quality gyms at affordable prices, and where everybody is welcome, we help more people in more places live healthier lives.




The Role




PureGym is looking for a Student Analyst (approx. 15-20 hours per week) to play a key role in supporting the business in making data-led commercial decisions. The essence of the role is to conduct performance tracking for us to spot and react to developments in a timely manner and to conduct ad hoc analyses to answer questions related to strategic or operational opportunities.




The Commercial Analyst will be part of a small but highly capable Commercial Management team, located in PureGym DK’s headquarters in Valby. However, you will be a part of the overall Group, which covers PureGym businesses in DK, UK and CH and a number of franchises around the world.

Therefore, the Student Analyst will have a broad interaction with colleagues from all functional areas as well as across different geographies.




Key Responsibilities:




The Student Analyst will have a leading role in the following:




Recurring performance reviews: Carry out recurring performance reviews, commenting on findings and trends
Commercial analysis: Support decision-making in the organization by conducting and presenting ad hoc analysis on business challenges
Price management: Support in generating overviews of prices, changes to member privileges and the associated performance
Execution of changes: Liaise with other teams (mainly IT, Marketing, Operations) to conduct tests to optimize commercial model/mechanisms and implement the resultant changes
Competitor analysis: Track trends in the industry and our competitive landscape




The Person




We are looking for an ambitious individual with the following core attributes:




Curious and driven: You constantly seek to learn and find new and better ways of doing things; not just solving problems but actively looking for how to improve any given situation
Love data crunching: You thrive working with large and complex data sets, finding the underlying patterns and insights
Highly structured: You enjoy bringing order to chaos and have an eye for detail – you probably like to organize your bookshelf by size or alphabet.
Operational mindset: You take pride in having a specific area of responsibility and working continuously on improving and executing this area over time.




The ideal candidate has the following qualifications:




At least one year left of study, preferably within an analytical area
Ideally has previous working experience from a full-time position, another student job or internship
Strong business acumen and a solid methodological toolkit from your studies, capable of reflecting and advising on the best approach from case to case
Ability to work with various data sources, ranging from BI data over surveys to more qualitative data
Experienced in Excel, working quickly and efficiency with all the main formulas
Speak and write English fluently
Ability to work on Mondays would be appreciated but not a necessity




Our Values




Make a difference. Excite and inspire others. ‘Own it’ and be the best we can be.

Stand Shoulder to Shoulder. Collaborate and share with each other. Include everyone and embrace uniqueness.

Focus on the detail. Care about the little things. Have determination and resilience to get the job done.

Play to Win. Improve and innovate – never get complacent. Challenge ourselves and each other. Celebrate our success.




** Please apply with your CV in English **




PureGym is proud to be an equal opportunities employer. Our company mantra is ‘Everybody Welcome’ and we are dedicated to promoting a diverse and inclusive place to work. From a hiring standpoint, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to ensuring that our PureGym colleagues reflect the diversity of the nation as well as our millions of gym members we serve.




#LI-DNI

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Hvidovre Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Engineer / Analytics Engineer




NTG Nordic Transport Group (NTG)

NTG is listed on Nasdaq OMX Nordic and is one of the fastest-growing freight forwarders in Europe. Since the Group’s foundation in Denmark in 2011, our unique partnering-model has successfully expanded NTG to a revenue of more than DKK 8 billion in 2023, presence in +30 countries and ~100 companies. Our culture is characterized as entrepreneurial, trusting, and accountable.




The Position

We are currently looking for a Data Engineer or Analytics Engineer to join our newly established BI team at our Global Headquarters in Hvidovre (Copenhagen), Denmark. Your main responsibilities will be:

· Develop and maintain our Data Warehouse platform

· Build and maintain data ingestion pipelines in DBT

· Design and create Analytics Models for consumption in PowerBI

· Collaborate with business users to create concise and meaningful data assets that fit our platform architecture

· Advise on the design, and optimization of our data storage solutions, ensuring best practices are followed and influencing the strategic direction of our Data Warehouse.

You will work closely with our Head of Group Business Intelligence to support our broader organization within IT, Finance and operations.




The Candidate

· Possess a strong analytical mindset

· Ability to work independently and as part of a team

· Solid communication and collaboration skills

· Previous experience with solutions like Snowflake, Databricks hosted on one of the big cloud providers (Azure, AWS or GCP)

· Proficiency with Python, SQL, dbt

· Data modelling and schema design for relational databases

· Fluent in English (Danish is a plus)

· Experience with PowerBI is a plus




How do I apply?

If you would like to join our team, apply for the position by clicking the button below. We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible.

We hope we got your attention and look forward to receiving your application!




If you have any questions about the position, please don't hesitate to reach out to Martin Staal-Olsen (mso@ntg.com), Christian Herskind Louring (clo@ntg.com) or Tomasz Kotarski (tko@ntg.com

Title: Data Analyst for Offshore Wind
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to contribute to the growth of a unique offshore wind data intelligence company within the Renewable Energy industry? Sea Impact is looking for a Data Analyst to drive software development and push the boundaries for different datasets.




Innovative Market Intelligence based on Unique Big Data Analysis for a Growing Offshore Wind Industry

At Sea Impact, we specialise in market intelligence for the offshore wind industry. We have developed a revolutionary market intelligence platform that provides key benchmarks for the design, installation, and maintenance of offshore wind farms. Our analyses are based on an innovative methodology of analysing vessel positions for market intelligence. We work with some of the world’s leading offshore wind developers, turbine OEMs and consultancies.




Help Us Create Unique Market Intelligence for Offshore Wind

Based in our Copenhagen office, you will lead the development of our data-driven solutions by analysing offshore wind activity and combining our unique offshore wind data with any publicly available data about the market development.




Your key responsibilities will include:

Data Analysis: Analyze offshore wind activities using Python, Power BI, and QGIS, extracting geospatial and operational insights.
Database Management & Integration: Maintain and optimize cloud-based PostgreSQL databases and develop efficient data pipelines for seamless integration with Power BI.
Predictive Analytics & Machine Learning: Design and implement ML-driven solutions to enhance market intelligence insights and expand our product offering.
Ad-hoc tasks: provide support for ad-hoc tasks such as developing custom reports.
Be the driver of Sea Impact's IT development and have the opportunity to shape and form the development




As this is a role in a small company you will have plenty of room to influence your position and take on new and exciting tasks as we grow.




Solution-Driven Data Analyst with a Strong Drive

You have a master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or similar. You are proficient in Python and SQL, have some experience in developing ML-based solutions and have previously worked with some of these tools: QGIS, PostgreSQL, Microsoft Azure, Power BI. Our ideal candidate is excited about being part of establishing a new organisation and creating industry-leading market intelligence for offshore wind. If you combine this with a proactive and entrepreneurial attitude and thrive in a fast-paced environment, you will enjoy “building something bigger together”.




Furthermore, you must have strong communication skills and function well in a collaborative environment. You are structured, proactive, and you are ready to learn and take on new challenges. As Sea Impact is a global company, you must have strong English communication skills.




Experience the Highest Degree of Involvement

A unique and challenging opportunity, where you will be part of forming the future growth of Sea Impact and success towards our clients. You will have the opportunity to play a central role in the development of Sea Impact and have chance to drive the development of market intelligence. Alongside a small team of dedicated problem-solvers, you are given the chance to learn and challenge yourself, while playing a vital part in the continued success of Sea Impact. Above that, you will join an ambitious team that is dedicated to delivering the highest quality, utilizing the diverse expertise and skillset we all bring. It is a prerequisite that you have strong English communication skills.




Sea Impact is dedicated to fostering a work environment that values diversity. We encourage all interested candidates to apply, regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, religion, or ethnicity.




Interested and want to know more?

If you have any questions or want to know more about the position, please contact People & Development via recruitment@peak-wind.com. We look forward to receiving your application & CV as soon as possible, latest by March 16th, 2025. Please apply through our webpage. Applications will be assessed on an ongoing basis.

Title: 4x IT Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company: BluEdge
Max Price rate (SEK/h): Open to Bid
Location: Copenhagen (DK)
Start date: 2025-02-18
End date (renewable): 2025-02-28


We are currently seeking 4 IT Analysts to join our Core Banking program team.

Responsibilities

The primary objective of the program is to transition from old local legacy systems to a unified Nordic core banking program and establish an Agreement Directory Service. The ideal candidates should be capable to contribute to the team responsible for building the Common Booking Component. They will be responsible for gathering requirements from business stakeholders and documenting them in the form of features and user stories. They should be capable of independently driving the requirements process, from collection and documentation to handover to developers. The role requires the ability to operate in a complex environment with multiple stakeholders and dependencies. Familiarity with tasks such as data mapping and data governance is essential.

Requirements


Professional knowledge of data mapping and data governance
Experience in the banking sector, preferably within a larger bank.
Extensive knowledge in the accounting area.
Extensive experience as a senior Business analyst and/or senior IT analyst.
Previous experience in a larger program with approximately 300+ employees.
Experience in a Nordic bank is advantageous.

Mapping
Business Analyst
IT Analyst


Languages


English (Proficient)


Start-date: ASAP

Title: Data Analytics Business Partner
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 114 million registered users and 241,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 423+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.144.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are looking for a Data Analytics Business Partner to strengthen our knowledge around how to drive excellence in Operations.

While you will report directly to the Director of Analytics, you will work closely with our Strategy & Expansion teams, as well as members of the Global Management Team. Your mission will be to work as a trusted advisor to leadership in driving key strategic decisions, mapping strategy to data-driven ways of working, and championing scaled analysis across our Cluster Business Partnering team. You will be 1 of 6 Business Partners: while the others are dedicated to an Operational Leadership team in regional markets, you’ll be working on connecting the dots at the global level. The Business Partnering team works closely together to share cross-country insights in an efficient and scalable way.

Your role


Provide deep analytical insights to inform timely Sales, Strategy and Leadership decisions - either proactively, on a regular cadence (QBRs, MBRs), or through ad hoc projects
Mobilize the Cluster Business Partners to bring relevant & actionable insights from the rest of the Data & Analytics team to the Regional Operations leadership teams
Utilize the deep in-market expertise of the Cluster Business Partner team to proactively identify and build opportunities for scale and automation; prioritize and advocate for further scale via data products with our Solutions team
Elevate our Global Analytics specialisation by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects
Opportunity size and prioritise analytics ideas and questions from common themes across our markets and clusters, with the support of the COO, the Strategy team, and Operations VPs in our Expansion Markets


Requirements


You have significant experience in an analytical role supporting 2 or more of the following functions: Sales, Marketing, Operations, Finance, Strategy, Business Operations; or relevant work experience in Consulting
You are proficient in SQL, comfortable with Python or R, and proficient in manipulating data efficiently for ad-hoc analysis
You are experienced with Data Visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, PowerBI or similar
You are comfortable describing statistical uncertainty and educating non-technical audiences on how best to interpret and action off of new insights
You have proven experience in stakeholder management, with the ability to manage a high influx of requests in a structured way
You are driven by the “why” behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure you’re solving for the right thing
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment
You have the ability to communicate effectively and convincingly in an English-speaking organisation
Previous experience in a hyper growth start-up environment will be valued


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


A rare opportunity to work in a social impact company (and certified B Corporation!) where you get to wake up every day knowing you’re achieving positive change.
The opportunity to truly drive impact within your domain towards a planet with no food waste.
The experience of being part of an international company with 1300 + enthusiastic and highly talented teammates across 19 countries (and counting) – always ready to share knowledge and support!
Strong personal as well as professional development in an intense and high-growth scale-up environment.
An open company culture where you have the independence and room to unleash your creativity.
A strong team culture where successes are celebrated together.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.


This role can be based either in our Copenhagen office or in our London office.

How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: Jr. Data Engineer
Description:
The Job

We are looking for a Junior Data Engineer to join us at HelloFresh Nordics. Working in the Operations Tech team, you will support the design, build, and maintenance of data-driven solutions that impact our daily operations. Working closely with experienced team members, you’ll help develop reliable data pipelines, internal applications, and infrastructure—all while growing your technical skills and operational understanding.


This role is in-office at our Nordic HQ at Islands Brygge, Copenhagen.
You’ll join a close-knit team of four engineers, one student assistant, and a Technical Product Manager.
We value innovation, mutual respect, and personal growth in an inclusive environment.


If you’re excited by the prospect of working in a code-first, fast-moving environment—while ensuring the highest level of quality and reliability—then we’d love to hear from you!

You will…


Design, build, and maintain data pipelines using Databricks or Airflow on Kubernetes.
Develop and deploy Streamlit applications, backed by Postgres, to streamline operational workflows.
Write clean, efficient, and well-tested Python code, building a strong foundation in software best practices.
Learn and contribute to managing infrastructure using Terraform and configuring CI/CD pipelines via GitHub Workflows.
Gain exposure to AWS services (e.g., S3 and Glue) for data storage and transformation.
Work with cross-functional teams (e.g., logistics, procurement, production) to understand requirements and support operational systems.
Help monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data pipelines and internal apps to ensure smooth operations.
Contribute to an agile, detail-oriented culture, balancing speed with the need for robust and dependable operational systems.


You have…


A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or an Engineering field related to Operations / Supply Chain.
Proficiency in Python with a focus on writing maintainable, testable code.
Relevant internships or academic projects demonstrating hands-on work with data engineering or software development are a strong plus.
Good knowledge of SQL and familiarity with relational databases is a plus.
Basic understanding of orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow) and containerized environments (e.g., Kubernetes, Docker) is a plus.
An interest in learning about AWS services and Infrastructure as Code tools (e.g., Terraform) along with CI/CD processes.
Knowledge of operations and supply chain management is a plus.
Good communication skills in English, a proactive attitude, and the ability to work collaboratively with both technical and non-technical teams.
A keen eye for ensuring operational stability in a fast-paced environment.


We offer…


A diverse and vibrant international environment of 35+ different nationalities
The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe
A significant discount on your weekly HelloFresh box or Factor_ meals
Annual learning and development budget to grow and develop your skills
Subsidized healthy lunches everyday in our Copenhagen office
Mental health resources through online subscriptions
Monthly pension scheme including health insurance benefits
Additional perks: Discounts for our neighboring gyms, company events and parties, fruit & snacks in the office and free Friday bar


Are you up for a challenge?


Apply with your CV (In English please)
If we see a match, you’ll have a call with one of our recruiters to share more about what you can bring to the team
Are both sides still positive? Then we proceed to the assessment stage to assess key skills required for the job
We will be conducting interviews on an ongoing basis and will close down the position once the successful candidate has been found.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Senior Foundations Analyst)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 108 million registered users and 245,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 395+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1066.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (called "Senior Foundations Analyst" internally) to strengthen our use of data to inform our most business critical decisions. On a daily basis, you will be working with business leaders across various functional areas to inform how they measure success, how they use data to inform strategic decisions, and ensure they have the data visibility and tools they need to make progress on those strategies every day.

Your role


Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Design and deliver self-service tools to various functional groups for operational excellence
Generate new ideas for how to leverage the data we have to drive business performance
Elevate data literacy across the organisation, with an eye toward consistency, ease of understanding, and educating on the right way to use data in each function
Elevate the Global Analytics team by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects


Requirements


You have previous experience in analytical roles overtime
You are strongly proficient in Looker
You are strongly proficient in SQL
You have a breadth of experience mapping business questions to data problems
You are a great communicator and storyteller - someone who enjoys helping non-technical audiences see what you see in the numbers!
You are driven by the “why” behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure you’re solving for the right thing
You have experience managing multiple projects
You are passionate about data literacy
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.
