Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses samt laver MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi arbejder med en række spændende teknologier, herunder Databricks, Fabric, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory, Azure Synapse og Spark, og laver ikke bare dataudtræk, men bygger ting, der skal i Prod. Vi leder derfor efter flere profiler med erfaring indenfor enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som har lyst til at bygge dataløsninger for vores kunder.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. Cvation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development, og er på forkant med mange af de nye teknologier, herunder IoT. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle får du?




Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




rådgive om og bygge datamigrerings- og datamoderniseringsprojekter
rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code
fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videregående uddannelse i data engineering, data science, Human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring og kan skrive Python - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme. Vi skal nok lære dig det, du mangler på Azure, IaC, MLOps etc.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Infrastructure as code er måden du arbejder på, f.eks. Bicep eller Terraform
Du har erfaring med nogle - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Spark - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling




Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere




Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.




Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.




Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Show more
HTML:
Azure Data Engineer


Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses samt laver MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi arbejder med en række spændende teknologier, herunder Databricks, Fabric, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory, Azure Synapse og Spark, og laver ikke bare dataudtræk, men bygger ting, der skal i Prod. Vi leder derfor efter flere profiler med erfaring indenfor enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som har lyst til at bygge dataløsninger for vores kunder.


cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. Cvation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development, og er på forkant med mange af de nye teknologier, herunder IoT. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.


Hvilken rolle får du?


Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.


Din rolle bliver at


  • rådgive om og bygge datamigrerings- og datamoderniseringsprojekter
  • rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
  • rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
  • bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
  • sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code
  • fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger


Hvad forventer vi af dig?


  • Du har en videregående uddannelse i data engineering, data science, Human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU
  • Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring og kan skrive Python - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme. Vi skal nok lære dig det, du mangler på Azure, IaC, MLOps etc.
  • Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
  • Infrastructure as code er måden du arbejder på, f.eks. Bicep eller Terraform
  • Du har erfaring med nogle - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Spark - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
  • Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
  • Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
  • Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling


Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Title: Consultant / Senior Consultant – Data & Analytics
Description:
Are you passionate about helping leading companies to harness their data to become data-driven? Does consulting and solving challenging business problems appeal to you? Do you thrive in a collaborative, entrepreneurial, and supportive work culture?




Then join our growing consulting team in Copenhagen!




At BearingPoint Denmark, you’ll join an environment that brings together the best of both worlds—the agility of a fast-growing practice and the resources of a global consultancy. Since opening our Copenhagen office in 2021, we’ve built a team of 10+ professionals, working from a brand-new office in the heart of the city.




As we continue growing our business and team, you’ll have the chance to work with Denmark’s leading companies and collaborate with our international teams across the Nordics and beyond. We foster a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment where everyone plays a role in our shared success, shaping both our team’s future and that of our clients.




Your role:

As a Data & Analytics Consultant / Senior Consultant, you’ll deliver insights from data into concrete processes and decisions to create value for the customer. Working alongside our AI Lead in Denmark and collaborating with our Nordic team, you will for example:

Implement analytics solutions, to predict risks or perform simulations of financial scenarios, and forecast trends to improve our clients’ performance and profitability.

Deliver insights using machine learning models, static analyzes and optimization methods.
Conduct experiments, ensure that they are carried out correctly and analyzing the results.
Visualize and present data in an actionable and clear manner using tools like Power BI to support decision-making.
Contribute to business development, including creating client proposals, identifying opportunities, and developing our offerings and internal practices.




As your expertise grows, you'll take on bigger responsibilities—leading projects or project streams, working closely with clients, and driving business growth. Throughout the recruitment process, we’ll shape the role to match your expertise and experience, ensuring the best fit for all.




We are looking for:

A few years of prior experience in working with data (f.ex. as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, consulting role or similar)
Analytical skills, such as mathematical modeling and statistical analysis
Proficiency in programming languages like Python
Experience with visualizing data (f.ex. Power BI, Tableau) and large datasets using SQL
Knowledge of and/or experience with relevant cloud technologies
Academic degree in a relevant field (for example computer science, data science, business analytics or related field)
Fluent communication skills in Danish and English, both written and spoken




As an advantage we see:

Experience in the financial sector or analytics, such as credit risk modeling, financial crime prevention, segmentation, or customer profiling
Previous client-facing role




In addition, we’re looking for strong problem-solving skills, proactive mindset and curiosity to learn. We hope you are a true team player, as collaboration is an essential part of our culture. An entrepreneurial mentality and commitment to contribute to developing our practice in Denmark will take you far in this role.




What you can expect:

Joining us isn’t just about the job—it’s about the opportunities, the people, and the impact you’ll have. Here’s what you can expect:




Steep learning curve & interesting projects: You’ll have the chance to work with leading-edge solutions and continuously develop your skillset as you work with diverse client projects together with a team of consultants. We have a vibrant global data & analytics community within the company to share and deepen your knowledge and collaborate with.
Entrepreneurial spirit and people-centric growth – We embrace an entrepreneurial mindset where dedication and teamwork are keys to our success. As a new practice with ambitious growth targets, we are committed to making our mark by building strong brand awareness through a people-centric approach.
Commitment and quality – We value those who actively contribute to shaping an environment where everyone is seen, heard, and engaged. With a long-term commitment and a dedication to quality in everything we do, we are creating something lasting—for our clients, our team, and our workplace.
Professional & personal growth – We invest in our people. Through regular discussions with your development manager, formal trainings and hands-on project work, we’ll support your personal and professional development every step of the way.
Competitive salary, benefits & flexible work options – We offer a competitive salary and benefits, along with hybrid working options to promote a healthy work-life balance. Our centrally located office offers a dynamic space for focus, collaboration, and connection.




If this sounds like the next step in your career, join us at BearingPoint!




We are looking forward to receiving your application by Monday 31st of March. For more information, please contact Sara Lyng (+45 29 91 68 92) during office hours. We review applications and may start the process before the deadline—so don’t wait to apply! This is a permanent full-time position.




BearingPoint is an equal opportunities employer. We’re all about helping people reach their full potential, and we know that the best ideas come from different perspectives and experiences. To learn more about us, you can visit www.bearingpoint.com, and follow our latest news on LinkedIn.




About BearingPoint

BearingPoint is an independent management and technology consultancy with European roots and a global reach. The company operates in three business units: Consulting, Products, and Capital. Consulting covers advisory business with a clear focus on selected business areas. Products provides IP-driven digital assets and managed services for business-critical processes. Capital delivers M&A and transaction services. BearingPoint's clients include many of the world's leading companies and organizations. The firm has a global consulting network with more than 13,000 people and supports clients in over 70 countries, engaging with them to achieve measurable and sustainable success.




We are guided by our purpose – Together, we are more than business.




It revolves around three key focus areas – More innovation, More for our planet, and More for our people. To make sure we live that purpose, we’re steered by a set of values that bring our purpose to life and are the essence of our culture – We are easy to work with, We create lasting outcomes, We empower people to succeed. We are a strongly purpose & values-driven organization, both today and as we forge our way into the future. Learn more about our purpose and values here. BearingPoint is a certified B Corporation, meeting high standards of social and environmental impact.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Vejle, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
GPV is on a journey towards implementing a modern Data Platform and we want you to join us!

Maybe you are currently working as a consultant but are tired of time registration and having to focus on five different projects at the same time? Or maybe you are stuck as an in-house developer at a place where things are standing still, and you feel like you being there doesn’t make a difference? Then join GPV for a greenfield project where we are moving from a mix of on-prem technologies to a modern setup using Microsoft Fabric.




Your role

As a Data Engineer you will initially support our on-prem Microsoft data solutions, before transitioning into a key player in our future Fabric solution. Expect that your primary work the first 6 months will be focused on learning our legacy Microsoft platforms, taking over the responsibility from a colleague moving to a different IT position. The role will then be a split with approximately 50/50 time on maintaining and optimising the old platforms, and developing the new solution in Fabric with the knowledge you have gained in the first half year.

GPV currently have several legacy ERP systems due to mergers, and your job is to secure reporting in the data platforms on top of these systems. Further we are in the process of rolling out D365FO with the first pilot site going live at the end of 2025. You will be an important part of this project, where the new Data Platform should contain the needed reporting at go-live. For both the existing and new platform you will be part of the complete process from requirement gathering with end-users, extracting source data, data modelling and building the cubes or semantic models in PowerBI.




What We Offer

You will be part of the team that transitions GPV into a digitized future, going from a complex setup with several different on-prem data platforms to a more streamlined setup in Microsoft Fabric.
We offer a job where you can really make a difference and be challenged, while at the same time having fun with your colleagues.
You will be offered a competitive salary that matches your qualifications and there are of course the standard things you would expect from the workplace, like mobile phone, internet provided at your home, modern maternity terms, great coffee and a good canteen.
Further there are social activities with the staff association and the opportunity to being part of an already established Data ERFA group with associated companies.
To support learning there are possibilities to attend relevant conferences and take relevant certifications, to help your transition from the on-prem tech-stack to the Fabric experiences.




We are looking for a data engineer with a relevant educational background and 3+ years of experience, with a focus on data solutions on the on-prem Microsoft tech-stack and an eager to learn new cloud tools together with skilled colleagues. You speak and communicate fluently in English, and Danish language is also an advantage but not a requirement.

You are probably humble by nature and cannot checkoff all the requirements below, but hopefully there are a lot of known topics and you are able to quickly learn the rest because you are curious and like to explore.

Microsoft T-SQL, with good knowledge of writing efficient SQL code, defining views and stored procedures, looking at execution plans, etc.
SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), with hands-on experience of extracting data from different source systems, develop ELT logic and deployment to SQL servers, using the SQL Agent for orchestration and monitoring of nightly loads
SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), having developed logic preferably both in tabular cubes (DAX) and multidimensional cubes (MDX)
SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), with some understanding of how to build reports, deployment and access management
Data Modelling, using SQL code and the Kimball methodology to build facts and dimensions
Azure DevOps, where Git repositories is a natural part of the development process
Communication skills, because your job is to collaborate with both the rest of the Data Team and in general with end-users in the business, in an international setup




Further it is beneficial if some of the following topics are also in your toolbelt:

Microsoft PowerBI, building reports and the underlying semantic models (DAX), maybe utilizing external tools like Tabular Editor
Microsoft Fabric (excluding PowerBI), either hands-on from a project or self-learning with some of the components. Maybe you have or are planning to take the DP-600 certification.
Azure Services, that are used in batch related data solutions (ADF, SQL, KeyVault, Storage Accounts, etc.)
Power Platform, using Power Apps and Power Automate, both on its own and in combination with PowerBI reports
D365FO, understanding of the data model from the ERP system where you have preferably worked with data modelling and reporting on top




GPV is an international company and the 3 members of the Data Team are located in 2 different countries. You will be working closely with the Data Platform Manager and Lead Data Engineer in the Vejle area and we expect that the transportation from your place of residence to the office to be a maximum of 60 minutes. You will also cooperate with our external partners that support our journey, where they have provided the Fabric framework and needed support in the project.

Learn more about GPV in our website: https://gpv-group.com/

Show more

We are looking for a data engineer with a relevant educational background and 3+ years of experience, with a focus on data solutions on the on-prem Microsoft tech-stack and an eager to learn new cloud tools together with skilled colleagues. You speak and communicate fluently in English, and Danish language is also an advantage but not a requirement.

You are probably humble by nature and cannot checkoff all the requirements below, but hopefully there are a lot of known topics and you are able to quickly learn the rest because you are curious and like to explore.

  • Microsoft T-SQL, with good knowledge of writing efficient SQL code, defining views and stored procedures, looking at execution plans, etc.
  • SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), with hands-on experience of extracting data from different source systems, develop ELT logic and deployment to SQL servers, using the SQL Agent for orchestration and monitoring of nightly loads
  • SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), having developed logic preferably both in tabular cubes (DAX) and multidimensional cubes (MDX)
  • SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), with some understanding of how to build reports, deployment and access management
  • Data Modelling, using SQL code and the Kimball methodology to build facts and dimensions
  • Azure DevOps, where Git repositories is a natural part of the development process
  • Communication skills, because your job is to collaborate with both the rest of the Data Team and in general with end-users in the business, in an international setup


Further it is beneficial if some of the following topics are also in your toolbelt:

  • Microsoft PowerBI, building reports and the underlying semantic models (DAX), maybe utilizing external tools like Tabular Editor
  • Microsoft Fabric (excluding PowerBI), either hands-on from a project or self-learning with some of the components. Maybe you have or are planning to take the DP-600 certification.
  • Azure Services, that are used in batch related data solutions (ADF, SQL, KeyVault, Storage Accounts, etc.)
  • Power Platform, using Power Apps and Power Automate, both on its own and in combination with PowerBI reports
  • D365FO, understanding of the data model from the ERP system where you have preferably worked with data modelling and reporting on top


GPV is an international company and the 3 members of the Data Team are located in 2 different countries. You will be working closely with the Data Platform Manager and Lead Data Engineer in the Vejle area and we expect that the transportation from your place of residence to the office to be a maximum of 60 minutes. You will also cooperate with our external partners that support our journey, where they have provided the Fabric framework and needed support in the project.

Learn more about GPV in our website: https://gpv-group.com/

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented, curious, and data-driven problem solver who wants to build up and maintain a Data Platform for reporting and analytics in a fast-growing FinTech company? Then you might be the one we are looking for.




Banking Circle is a truly international and vibrant company with more than 600 skilled and dedicated employees worldwide, who are all passionate about creating next-generation mission-critical financial services infrastructure and leading the rise of a super-correspondent banking network.




About the role

We are looking to hire a highly skilled Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering team in Copenhagen, reporting to the Data Engineering Team Lead.




In this role you will get the chance to work on building and maintaining our next generation Data Platform in Azure. The Data Engineering team owns Banking Circle’s Data Platform, which is closely coupled to our payment processing system. Our tech stack includes Python, Terraform, Microsoft Azure cloud ecosystem, Azure DevOps, and Microsoft Power BI. Furthermore, we also use Databricks SQL warehouses and Astronomer/Airflow to orchestrate our processing pipelines.




What you will be doing

Build and maintain our Data Platform in collaboration with peers
Advocate for software architecture patterns, efficient data processing, modern data integration, and solid data modelling
Collaborate in the continual analysis of project requirements in collaboration with teams across the organization
Participate in Agile team rituals (stand-up, planning, and retrospective)
Contribute to continuous improvements of the team’s way of working
Take responsibility for own learning and development




What we are looking for

To be the right candidate for this position, we expect you to have an educational background within computer science, software engineering, or other related fields, with a bachelor's degree as a minimum. We expect you to have 3+ years of relevant work experience within pipelines, infrastructure, or the platform world, including strong Python skills. Furthermore, it is a big advantage if you have experience within Microsoft Azure cloud.




As a person we expect you to be open-minded, and willing to learn and further expand your existing experience in Data Engineering. You are curious, communicative, and able to work well on your own as well in a team.




As Banking Circle is an international company it´s a requirement, that you are fluent in English.




What we offer you

We offer a hybrid work model for our employees to allow for flexibility and productivity, however we do also expect you to spend time in the office on a regular basis to build community and efficiency in the team. Furthermore, we offer a competitive salary and a generous benefit package, opportunities for continuous learning, development, and a dynamic and collaborative culture that values personal initiative and professional achievements.




Would you like to join us?

We will be conducting interviews continuously; therefore, we urge interested candidates to apply online as soon as possible. Please note that we do not accept applications by email. If you have questions do not hesitate to contact Kheira Nougal, Global Recruitment Partner on khno@bankingcircle.com. No agencies, please.




Who we are

Banking Circle is a fully licensed next generation Payments Bank that is designed to meet the global banking and payments needs of Payments businesses, Banks, and Marketplaces. Through our API, we deliver fast, low-cost global payments and banking services by connecting to the world’s clearing systems – enabling our clients to move liquidity in real-time for all major currencies securely and compliantly. To learn more about Banking Circle, visit us at www.bankingcircle.com




We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, religion, sexual orientation, national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local laws, regulations and ordinances.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst for a Teleco & Technology Organisation

Location: London (2-3 days hybrid working)

Salary: Competitive

________________________________________

Company Overview:




We are looking for a dynamic, private equity-backed business. As the company continues to grow, we are seeking a Data Analyst to contribute to our exciting journey of integrating new systems and enhancing data capabilities. As part of a dynamic team focused on system and customer migration, you'll play a pivotal role in maturing our business processes. With your expertise in data analysis, you will help drive data-driven decision-making across the organization. This role is ideal for professionals with a strong commercial mindset and proficiency in SQL who are ready to make a significant impact.

________________________________________




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the finance team to optimize data analysis and generate meaningful insights.
Engage in the migration process focusing on system improvement and data enhancement.
Play an active role in driving better decision-making through in-depth data insights.
Work closely with finance business partners to align data initiatives with commercial objectives.
Support the integration of HOBS (billing system) and DOMO (reporting tool) to enhance data management and reporting.

________________________________________




Required Experience:

Proven experience in data analysis with a strong commercial mindset.
Exceptional SQL skills and proficiency in working with databases.
Demonstrated ability to generate actionable insights from complex datasets.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex information effectively.

________________________________________




Benefits and Opportunities

Opportunity to be at the forefront of system integration and process improvement.
Collaborate with a talented and dedicated finance team led by experienced professionals.
Be part of a structured organisation with a strategic vision for growth and innovation.
Potential for personal and professional growth by significantly impacting the company's data capabilities.

________________________________________




Candidate Profile:

Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills with a proven capacity to turn data into actionable insights.
Ability to work collaboratively across departments, particularly with finance and systems teams, to drive data-centric improvements.
Adept at balancing multiple projects and tasks while meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Passionate about integrating new technologies and tools to enhance data handling and reporting.
Experience working in telecom or technology sectors is a plus, bringing industry-specific insights.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role

At Deliveroo we have an outstanding data science organisation, with a mission to enable the highest quality human and machine decision-making. We work throughout the company - in product, business and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Deliveroo.

We are looking for a Data Analyst that is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. We have several roles open across different teams (grocery, loyalty, restaurants). Data Analysts at Deliveroo report into our data science management team.

You will be a professional in insights storytelling, communication and visualisation and know how to create action from metrics. Crafting effective intelligent benchmarks, understanding performance, caring about data quality, enabling automation and creating phenomenal visualisations and stories are things that drive you.

What you'll be doing



Work closely with commercial stakeholders to create value and business impact through better data availability, visualisation and analysis
Discover, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets to perform ad-hoc analyses and deliver insights to the executive team and senior management
Understand key drivers of the business and provide data driven guidance on key levers
Identify and specify data needs and quality requirements and work closely with Analytics Engineers to ensure data is available, accurate and corresponds to the business needs
Consolidate and distribute best analytical practices from different teams and countries



Requirements



Experience identifying the root cause of problems, assessing risks/impacts and determining and implementing effective solutions.
A good understanding of querying in SQL and understanding of database structure - you'll be expected to be able to extract the data you need for your analysis.
Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualisations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
Good knowledge of Excel/GSheets - depending on the task, there is a good chance that this is where some of your exploratory analysis will take place. Being comfortable with pivot tables and functions will be essential.
Developer experience with a data visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, Periscope)



Why Deliveroo

Our mission is to transform the way you shop and eat, bringing the neighbourhood to your door by connecting consumers, restaurants, shops and riders. . We are transforming the way the world eats and shops by making access to food and products more convenient and enjoyable. We give people the opportunity to buy what they want, as they want it, when and where they want it.

We are a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, looking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.

Workplace & Benefits

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. Benefits differ by country, but we offer many benefits in areas including healthcare, well-being, parental leave, pensions, and generous annual leave allowances, including time off to support a charitable cause of your choice. Benefits are country-specific, please ask your recruiter for more information. This role in a Hybrid position.

Diversity

At Deliveroo, we believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in a rapidly growing industry.

We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in all aspects of our hiring process. We recognise that some candidates may require adjustments to apply for a position or fairly participate in the interview process. If you require any adjustments, please don't hesitate to let us know. We will make every effort to provide the necessary adjustments to ensure you have an equitable opportunity to succeed.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Salary: £35k-£45k (DOE)




Are you a data enthusiast looking to make an impact across multiple industries? Join a leading data consultancy in London that partners with clients in finance, retail, and healthcare to deliver data-driven solutions that transform their business operations.




My client is seeking a Data Analyst with strong analytical skills and a passion for leveraging data to solve complex problems. In this role, you'll work with a diverse portfolio of clients, using data insights to drive meaningful business improvements.




Your Responsibilities:

Analyse large datasets: Extract, clean, and analyse data from various sources to uncover trends and insights that inform key business strategies across finance, retail, and healthcare sectors.
Support decision-making: Use statistical methods and predictive models to assist clients in making data-driven decisions that improve their performance and efficiency.
Create data visualisations: Design and maintain interactive dashboards and visual reports to clearly communicate data insights to stakeholders.
Collaborate with clients and internal teams: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, consultants, and client representatives, to ensure that data projects align with client goals.
Identify opportunities: Continuously explore ways to optimise processes, identify business opportunities, and deliver actionable recommendations to clients.




You Will Need:

Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field: Preferably in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
Experience with data analysis tools: Proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data analysis, manipulation, and reporting.
Data visualisation skills: Experience with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar to present complex data in a user-friendly format.
Strong analytical mindset: Ability to understand and interpret complex datasets, drawing clear and actionable conclusions for clients.
Excellent communication skills: Capable of conveying technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.




It's A Bonus If You Have:

Industry experience: Prior experience working with clients in finance, retail, or healthcare, and familiarity with sector-specific data challenges.
Exposure to advanced analytics: Knowledge of machine learning techniques, predictive modeling, or advanced statistical analysis.
Problem-solving approach: A proactive, solution-oriented mindset, with the ability to think critically and creatively.




The Benefits:

Diverse projects: Gain experience working with clients across multiple industries, ensuring no two days are the same.
Learning and development: Access to training and mentorship to support your growth and help you stay at the forefront of data trends.
Collaborative work environment: Join a dynamic and supportive team of data experts, all working towards delivering exceptional results for clients.
Competitive compensation: A salary that reflects your experience and expertise, along with performance-based incentives.




If you’re a motivated Data Analyst eager to work with a variety of clients and industries, apply now to become part of a dynamic consultancy shaping the future of data-driven decision-making!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Excellent opportunity Data Analyst for to be part of Cognizant’s Intelligent Process Automation practice, It combines advisory services with deep vendor partnerships and integrated solutions to create and execute strategic roadmaps.




Key Responsibilities :




Gather business requirements, perform detailed analysis, and produce associated functional specifications across multiple functions
Skilled in writing SQL, Python or R to analyse data, Develop Subject Matter Expertise on the key data elements
Responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in co-ordination with the Technology team
Ensuring proper development life cycle is followed with artefacts to support Internal Audit and any inquiries.
Consult with users and clients to solve complex system issues/problems through in-depth evaluation of business processes, systems and industry standards and recommends solutions
Support systems change processes from requirements through implementation and provide input based on analysis of information
Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and provides user and operational support .
Identify and communicate risks and impacts, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
Work with Data Governance and Quality teams to understand data issues, Work with various technology leads to ensure the gaps in the data completeness or accuracy are converted into prioritized Book of Work items
Provide regular updates to senior management in technology, middle office & front office. Training of relevant teams prior to go-live of new business processes/products, functionality or applications . Go-live support, investigation of issues




Essential Experience

Providing database engineering and data delivery to support during application development, working closely with application teams
Data Engineering to ingest, cleanse and collate data from a wide range of internal and external sources
Creation of reconciliations of data sets
Building analytical models to support reporting and analytics
Creation of reports and analytics
Experience facilitating workshops and discussions to effectively gather requirements and understand the client’s business challenges
Able to produce proposed implementation plans for data analysis work, including estimated effort and technical implications of data insight products
Able to review and comment on data models– for example pointing out why models are defective and suggesting improvements.
Clear written and verbal communications; able to communicate with a wide range of people.
Strong leadership, analytical and communication skills with a passion for data-driven decision making and for establishing best practice
Line management experience - able to give feedback and mentor more junior colleagues




Qualifications:

Experience working with Azure, AWS or Google Cloud
Experienced in software development lifecycles
Experienced with structured and unstructured data
Experience in combining qualitative and quantitative datasets
Experienced in either programming languages such as Python and/or R, data visualization tools such as Tableau
Experience working with large datasets
Experience in creation of B/FRDs – Good documentation and communication with the technology team both to provide requirements and understanding of any issues is paramount
Relevant experience in data-related topics - data warehousing, data governance, data quality, data profiling, master data management, ETL etc…
Data modelling, from contextual through to logical and physical modelling skills
Very strong Excel, SQL, Python, JIRA skills
Excellent communication skills, structured and organized
Excellent stakeholder and management reporting skills
Experience with project planning and tracking, including agile software i.e. JIRA

  • Experience in creation of B/FRDs – Good documentation and communication with the technology team both to provide requirements and understanding of any issues is paramount
  • Relevant experience in data-related topics - data warehousing, data governance, data quality, data profiling, master data management, ETL etc…
  • Data modelling, from contextual through to logical and physical modelling skills
  • Very strong Excel, SQL, Python, JIRA skills
  • Excellent communication skills, structured and organized
  • Excellent stakeholder and management reporting skills
  • Experience with project planning and tracking, including agile software i.e. JIRA

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Data Vault) - Contract Opportunity (Outside IR35) - Fully Remote

Are you a detail-oriented data professional with a strong analytical mindset and expertise in Data Vault modelling, business intelligence, and stakeholder collaboration? We are supporting a leading energy solutions provider in their search for a Data Analyst to work on a contract basis outside IR35.

In this role, you will collaborate with business stakeholders to define data requirements, analyse datasets, and contribute to data modelling efforts, ensuring high-quality insights that drive decision-making.

Key Responsibilities:

Partner with stakeholders to define the data inputs of business processes and translate them into technical requirements and a Data Vault model.
Analyse and document data sets across business workflows and systems, identifying key insights.
Reverse-engineer SQL scripts to create technical and business specifications, as well as use cases.
Work closely with data engineers and IT teams to ensure thorough and accurate data documentation.
Act as a bridge between business units and data teams, ensuring smooth integration of data processes.

What We're Looking For:

Strong proficiency in SQL, Microsoft Excel, and BI tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Ability to translate business rules into actionable data use cases.
Strong stakeholder management skills with the confidence to lead and facilitate workshops in a fast-paced, data-centric environment.
Experience in data modelling (Data Vault, Star/Snowflake) and presenting insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Skilled in Power BI data modelling and working with cloud-based data platforms, particularly Azure (Synapse Analytics).
Understanding of database structures, data warehousing, and ETL processes.
Knowledge of data governance principles and best practices.

This is an excellent opportunity to contribute to a high-impact data project with a leading organisation, offering full remote flexibility.

Interested? Apply now!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst - Tableau Specialist - Surveillance Analytics & Visualisations (MUST BE ABLE TO WORK WITHOUT SPONSORSHIP)

Location: London, UK

Salary: £50 - £60k plus bonuses/benefits

Ways of Working: 3x per week in London office

Engagement: Full-Time




Project Overview:

We are looking for a Tableau Specialist to join our Surveillance & Monitoring team, responsible for analyzing trading activity and business communications to detect potential market abuse. This role will focus on building impactful analytics and visualizations to enhance the effectiveness of the surveillance program. Your creativity in producing meaningful and visually compelling dashboards will be central to the product line, helping translate complex datasets into user-friendly insights.

In addition to developing high-quality visualizations, you will take a leading role in ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and quality of the data used within the surveillance framework. You'll also be involved in data mapping, product ownership of the surveillance system, and ensuring adequate surveillance coverage. If you're passionate about creating visualizations that drive insights and want to make a difference in identifying market abuse, this is the role for you.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop effective visualizations that clearly communicate key information.
Own the surveillance product line and manage the related work.
Partner with colleagues and stakeholders to understand their requirements.
Ensure that data is complete, accurate, and utilized sustainably.
Create MI, KPIs, and KRIs to enhance surveillance and governance.
Collaborate with IT and third-party vendors to ensure proper data mapping and coverage.
Produce documentation and procedures to support the visualizations.
Build and maintain a consistent team brand through visualizations.
Stay up to date with the latest trends and developments in Tableau and visualizations.#




Required Skills and Experience:

Proven track record of creating effective visualizations across a variety of subjects.
Strong knowledge of SQL, relational databases, data normalization, and blending.
Proficiency in query and reporting analysis tools, and Excel (macros, pivot tables, etc.).
Extensive experience with Tableau dashboards and analytics, with working knowledge of Tableau administration/architecture.
Ability to meet deadlines and manage multiple tasks.
Self-starter, with the ability to work independently and within a team.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Experience with SAP Web Intelligence and Power BI is a plus.
Knowledge of commodity trading or market abuse is advantageous but not required.




This role provides a fantastic opportunity for those looking to take ownership of a surveillance product and make a real impact through data visualization. If you’re passionate about building effective visualizations and improving market surveillance, apply now!

Title: Data Analyst (Power BI)
Description:
Salary: £500-550 per day (outside IR35)

Job Type: Contract (Initial 6 months)

Hybrid Model: 3 days a week onsite

Location: City of London




Key Responsibilities

Manage data sources and data flows from SQL databases into Power BI.
Design and optimize SQL views and stored procedures for efficient data retrieval.
Develop interactive loan portfolio reports in Power BI for real-time insights.
Embed Power BI reports into internal applications and ensure seamless integration.
Create paginated reports accessible via Power BI APIs.
Collaborate with teams to understand reporting needs and automate data-driven insights.
Maintain data security and compliance with financial regulations.




Requirements

5+ years of experience in BI, Data Analysis, or Reporting, preferably in financial services.
Strong expertise in Power BI, DAX, and Power Query for report development.
Advanced SQL skills, including views, stored procedures, and query optimization.
Experience integrating Power BI with SQL databases and APIs.
Ability to build embedded and paginated reports for business applications.
Strong understanding of data modelling, ETL processes, and performance tuning.
Familiarity with financial data analysis and reporting standards.




Desirable

Experience with Python or R for advanced analytics.
Knowledge of Azure Synapse, SSIS, or other data warehousing tools.
Exposure to financial compliance and regulatory reporting.




To be considered, please ensure you complete your application on the Computappoint website.

Services offered by Computappoint Limited are those of an Employment Business and/or Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Title: Associate Data Analyst, Revenue
Description:
Inclusion at Bumble Inc. 

Bumble Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and we strongly encourage people of all ages, colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, people with disabilities, and neurodivergent people to apply. We're happy to make any reasonable adjustments that will help you feel more confident throughout the process, please don't hesitate to let us know how we can help.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her, he/him, they/them, etc).




We’re looking for curious analysts interested in being considered for a Data Analyst role in the Advanced Data Analytics team and who are buzzing to solve impactful questions for exciting products in the online dating industry and beyond.

In this role, you’ll support our stakeholders with data and insights related to a variety of business areas. You’ll be involved in experimentation design and planning, visualisations, trend diagnostics, dashboarding and much, much more. 




What you'll do:
You’ll have access to the most diverse, varied and complex data sets in the technology world right now (10’s of billions of data points per day!!)
You’ll be doing all the typical day-to-day tasks such as generating practical insights from the data, manipulating complex datasets, helping us understand how to improve and optimise our members experience to facilitate the creation of meaningful, equitable and healthy relationships
Unlock your potential by upskilling in SQL, Python and other essential tools, empowering you to expand your skill set and excel in your career
You will help uncover tactical and strategic insights and support experimentation in a range of areas such as revenue management, operations and strategy. For instance, you could work on testing and validating pricing and promotion based opportunities across our portfolio of apps. 
You will make contributions to the data model and could contribute to building out data pipelines
You’ll collaborate closely with several potential teams including Product Managers, strategists, operations managers, and Data Engineers PLUS, you’ll be building detailed, entrepreneurial and business-minded insights that directly contribute to the successful growth of Bumble Inc





You have confidence in the following:
You are a data analyst with expertise in SQL, data visualisation, A/B testing, statistical knowledge and storytelling, etc, is entrepreneurial, gets excited about building from scratch, and is relentlessly experimenting in pursuit of building a product that members love. 
Supporting experimentation analytics (e.g. A/B testing, user group testing): significance analysis, non-parametric methods, bootstrapping, causal inference
Manipulating complex datasets using a range of tools such as SQL and Hive
Building effective self serve tools and visualisations to help optimise decision making
Engaging and collaborating with key stakeholders such as developers, product managers, and senior management
Identifying issues and opportunities, translating business problems into analytical diagnoses and delivering insights that answer the most pressing questions
Supporting engineers and teammates in improving data quality, and specifying requirements for new data collection
Partnering with the wider analytics / data science team to solve business problems
Experience in Python is desirable but not required
Experience with data modelling and make domain-specific data models is a plus








About Us

Bumble Inc. is the parent company of Bumble, Badoo, Bumble For Friends, and Geneva. The Bumble platform enables people to build healthy and equitable relationships, through Kind Connections. Founded by Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014, Bumble was one of the first dating apps built with women at the center and connects people across dating (Bumble Date), friendship (Bumble For Friends) and professional networking (Bumble Bizz). Badoo, which was founded in 2006, is one of the pioneers of web and mobile dating products. Bumble For Friends is a friendship app where people in all stages of life can meet people nearby and create meaningful platonic connections. Geneva is a group and community app for people to connect based on shared interests.

Show more

Title: Graduate Data Analyst - London
Description:
Job Position: Graduate Data Analyst (Engineer/Scientist) - via the Graduate Development Programme   

Locations: London

Starting Salary: £28,000  

Application Requirements:


Minimum 2:1 or above in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) subject
Experience in analysing data
Right to work in the UK unsponsored for the duration of the programme
Ability to work on site 5 days a week.


Grayce specialises in driving change and transformation for some of the world's most ambitious organisations. For over a decade, we've partnered with FTSE 100 and 250 companies to deliver impactful results by developing and deploying high-performing talent in the UK and beyond.

Grayce is not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register and is unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants. 

Our Accelerated Development Programme is designed to launch the careers of recent graduates eager to make an impact. We offer a fast-track route to expertise, allowing you to gain hands-on experience with one of our impressive clients in a variety of flexible roles such as Data Analysis, InfoSec, Software Testing and DevOps.

Join Grayce and accelerate your career!

Why Grayce?

Our Analysts are actively involved in major global transformation programmes across diverse industries.

Opportunity: You'll embark on a journey of continuous learning, gaining industry-accredited qualifications, whilst getting hands-on experience working full time on site directly with prestigious FTSE100, 250, and 500 organisations.

Delivery: You will work with one client, delivering high quality outcomes during your Grayce tenure, before transitioning to working directly for them. The skills required for exceptional client delivery include natural curiosity, proactivity, adaptability, effective communication and problem solving.

Mentoring: Thrive under the guidance of our experienced Delivery Managers and Technical Trainers. They'll be your go-to, offering support, insights, sharing experiences.

Progression: Starting as an Analyst with the potential for significant salary progression, you will pick up invaluable skills and complete a minimum of 6 industry recognised accreditations during your time on the development programme.

What Makes a Great Grayce Analyst

2:1 Undergraduate Degree: An undergraduate degree with a minimum 2:1 within in a STEM field. A solid academic basis within data analysis and science through an additional MSc would be an advantage.

Data Tools: Previous experience with tools such as Excel, R, SQL or Python are an essential for this role. If you have utilised visualisation programmes such as Tableau or Power BI in projects before, we are also keen to hear from you.

Analytical Problem Solving: We're looking for analytical minds that can spot patterns and think creatively. Whether it's dissecting complex issues or finding fresh angles, we highly value critical thinking skills and their application.

Soft Skills: From effective communication styles to planning, organisation and a learning development mindset, Grayce is committed to building core consultancy skills. Stakeholder and time management are core skills we utilise every day and we look for examples of those through our interview process.

Why work for us?

Competitive Salary: Starting at £28,000 with potential for significant growth

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing

Title: Data Analyst - SQL
Description:
We are looking for an experienced and technical Data Analyst, with a specific skills set to join our existing data team.


We are looking for an individual with Data Engineering skills who has the ability to map business requirements to technical requirements.
The individual must have strong SQL, and have proven experience of interrogate raw data through to manipulation.
Confident to write in SQL



About the department: Data Services is utilised throughout the company, and the Data Analysts are responsible for supporting business reporting for numerous teams. Data Services look after the data warehouse, where data is received internally and externally and is prepared and enriched, before being modelled to make it easily reportable. The team extract, transform and load the data into its end state.

Responsibilities:


Understanding the current business landscape (priorities, preferences and constraints)
Quantifying the potential effort/value to support prioritisation
Gathering and elaborate on business requirements
Analysis and data interpretation
Collaboration with development teams to translate requirements into design
Presentation of data via reporting and visualisation (e.g. Excel, Power BI, Cognos etc.)
Coordinating testing with end-users and ensure sign-off
Maintaining data/report documentation (report catalogue, business glossary etc.)
Evaluating outcomes and benefits to inform future planning
Identifying training needs for end-users



Requirements

Experience Required:


Advanced on SQL - looking for strong technical knowledge and experience
Strong understanding of business operations
Excellent business analytical skills
Documenting business and technical requirements
Knowledge and experience of IBM Cognos Suite and administration or relevant BI tools
Proficiencies in using Microsoft Office software, particularly Excel at an advanced level



The Individual:


Good time management and organisational skills
Strong written and verbal communication, including confidence in presenting
Self-motivated and proactive worker
Keen attention to detail
Able to work effectively with all levels of staff and external partners, including key stakeholders to understand their requirements and challenge these as necessary
Highly disciplined approach to analysis and documentation process



Benefits

At Toyota Financial Services (TFS) it is more than just an externally bench-marked salary and bonus, we also offer:


Hybrid working pattern is 2 days in the office and 3 days from a location of your choice
Access to attractive car schemes for you (& your family) for Toyota & Lexus cars
Excellent pension scheme (up to 6% employee contribution and 15% employer contribution)
Generous annual leave of 25 days which increases with service and holiday purchase option
Private Medical Healthcare (single, partner/spouse and dependent children) with Digital GP Service
Group Income Protection cover with Aviva including physical, mental, and financial wellbeing services
Employee Assistance Program
Eye tests
Onsite gym, Sports and Social Club, & flu jabs to keep you healthy
Wellbeing hour each month and many more initiatives throughout the year to encourage a healthy mind and body, and to raise awareness and celebrate diversity, equity and inclusion
Dress for your day policy to make you feel comfortable at work
Eco HQ, free parking & restaurant
Two volunteering days per year
Reward gateway voucher discounts
Flexible working scheme and we welcome flexible working conversations at interview
Regular 121s with your manager, a personal development review (PReview) each quarter
A wide range of learning & development opportunities including Linked In Learning courses
£250 contribution towards you learning something new outside of work
Annual events (e.g., summer party, BBQ & Xmas party) including Countdown to Christmas events every December - it is so much fun!



Our Recruitment Process:

At Toyota Financial Services (TFS) we value everyone and are pleased to be recognised as a Disability Confident Employer.

We are committed to supporting disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. Should you meet the minimum criteria for this role and wish to apply under the DC scheme, you may be moved forward to the next stage. Please ensure to add this information into your application.

When it comes to recruitment, please do let us know if we can adjust our process to be meet your accessibility needs.

Some examples of how we might be able to help are listed below:


Providing a copy of interview questions before the interview
Organising a time and location that best suits you
Allowing additional time for the assessment and interview


We are happy to review any adjustment on a case-by-case basis to support you to be your best self.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About Zego

At Zego, we understand that traditional motor insurance holds good drivers back. It's too complicated, too expensive, and it doesn't reflect how well you actually drive. Since 2016, we have been on a mission to change that by offering the lowest priced insurance for good drivers.

From van drivers and gig workers to everyday car drivers, our customers are the driving force behind everything we do. We've sold tens of millions of policies and raised over $200 million in funding. And we're only just getting started.




About the Role

We are looking for a highly motivated Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to support our growing insurance business in a co-insurance environment. This role involves managing communication across co-insurers and internal stakeholders, analysing complex data, and providing reports to our co-insurers. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analytics, insurance operations, and financial performance metrics, along with excellent interpersonal skills to facilitate conversations between co-insurers and Zego.




Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis & Reporting: Develop and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for insurance and financial operations, focusing on co-insurance arrangements. This includes claims analysis, underwriting performance, premium forecasts, and consumer duty metric
Stakeholder Communication: Act as the key point of contact for BI-related discussions with co-insurers, ensuring clarity and alignment on data-driven insights, performance metrics, and contract management. Facilitate regular communication and meetings with external and internal stakeholders
Financial Modeling: Collaborate with finance and data engineering teams to create financial models that provide insights into revenue, costs, and profitability under co-insurance arrangements. Ensure accurate forecasting, budgeting, and KPI monitoring
Data Management: Work closely with data engineering teams to ensure accurate and timely ingestion of data from key sources (e.g., claims management systems, co-insurers, and financial systems). Ensure data quality, integrity, and consistency across entities




About You

Proven experience in BI analysis within the insurance and finance sectors
Advanced proficiency with BI tools (e.g., Looker, Power BI, Tableau) and data analytics platforms
Strong understanding of insurance metrics (claims, premiums, loss ratios, underwriting performance) and financial reporting
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience managing relationships between co-insurers and internal teams
Strong attention to detail and a proactive problem-solving approach

Nice to have:

​Experience working in a co-insurance environment, including communication with multiple insurers
Familiarity with insurance-specific systems such as claims management platforms (e.g., Sharedo) and finance software
Experience in data modeling, SQL, and working with large datasets
Experience in financial reconciliation processes and insurance accounting




What's it like to work at Zego

Joining Zego is a career-defining move. People go further here, reaching their full potential to achieve extraordinary things.




We're spread throughout the UK and Europe, and united by our drive to get things done. We're proud of our company and our culture - a friendly and inclusive space where we can lift each other up and celebrate our wins every day.




Together, we're setting the bar higher, delivering exceptional work that makes a difference. Our people are the most important part of our story, and everyone here plays a role. There's loads of room to learn and grow, and you'll get the freedom to steer your career wherever you

want.




You'll work alongside a talented group who embrace each other's differences and aren't afraid of a challenge. We recognise our achievements, learn from our mistakes, and help each other to be the best we can be. Together, we're making insurance matter




How we work

We believe that teams work better when they have time to collaborate and space to get things done. We call it Zego Hybrid. We ask you to spend at least one day a week in our central London office. We think it's a good mix of collaborative face time and flexible home-working, setting us up to achieve the right balance between work and life.




Benefits

We reward our people well. Join us and you'll get a market-competitive salary, private medical insurance, company share options, generous holiday allowance, and a whole lot of wellbeing benefits. And that's just for starters. We also cover the costs for all company-wide events (3 per year), and also provide a separate hybrid contribution to help pay towards other travel costs




We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status

Title: Data Analyst, Company Intelligence
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst - Company Intelligence

Employment Type: Full-time

Comp: Circa £35K Basic Salary +Bonus

Location: Fully remote

Company: STOIX




About Us: STOIX is a challenger brand within Finance Executive Search and Interim Management. We combine best-in-class RecTech and AI with top quality human talent to support our clients in making truly transformative hires. Our mission is simple: to redefine the search experience. We reject traditional and unimaginative methodologies that often yield disappointing outcomes. A certified B Corp, we believe that it is possible to do good business whilst behaving with integrity. We work in a smart and flexible way, providing our clients and candidates with a high quality service whilst maintaining a healthy balance that allows our team to live life to the fullest.




Role Overview: We are seeking a data driven individual to join our fast growing, dynamic team! The Data Analyst - Company Intelligence plays a crucial role in building out a new client service for STOIX. STOIX has been helping our clients grow by hiring best in class people, and we now also partner with select clients to support their decision making around potential acquisitions. Additionally this position is responsible for gathering, organizing, and interpreting complex data to provide strategic insights that inform candidate sourcing and client engagement.




Key Responsibilities:

Company Data Acquisition and Management:

Conduct comprehensive research to gather relevant data on target companies, including organizational structures, financial performance, industry trends, and competitive landscapes.
Maintain and update a robust database of company information, ensuring accuracy and completeness.
Utilize various data sources and tools to extract and compile information efficiently.

Data Analysis and Interpretation:

Analyze company data to identify key trends, patterns, and insights that are relevant to assignments.
Develop and generate reports and presentations that effectively communicate findings to internal stakeholders.
Create detailed organizational charts and company maps to visualize relationships and hierarchies.

Strategic Support:

Provide strategic insights by identifying potential candidate pools and target companies.
Assist in the development of client presentations and proposals by providing data-driven market intelligence.
Contribute to the development of best practices for data collection and analysis.

Data integrity:

Ensure that all data is kept up to date, and that data is entered in a correct way.
Work to make sure that any data that is collected is done so in a way that is compliant with data protection laws.




Qualifications:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, databases).
Excellent research and information gathering abilities.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Effective communication and presentation skills.
An interest in business and how companies work




Why us?:

Competitive salary and benefits package. However much we love the job, money matters and we have a compensation scheme that rewards our people for the hard work that they put in.
Flexibility. We love what we do, but we all have lives and responsibilities outside of work and we provide a working environment that supports that.
Culture. We are a diverse group of individuals that bring different skills and experience to the business and genuinely enjoy working together. Though driven and ambitious, we work as a team and believe that, by working collaboratively with each other, we all enjoy work more and get better results for our clients and our business.
Reputation. We are still a young firm but have a great reputation to maintain. Our clients love working with us and we maintain a 100% record of delivery on retained mandates.
We do things differently! We are constantly learning and growing and are keen to hire people with ideas to bring to the table. If you have best in class skills in the executive search industry and want to leverage them in a forward-thinking, collaborative and fast-growing business, then get in touch.




We’re passionate about creating an inclusive workplace that promotes and values diversity. Companies that are diverse in age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, ethnicity, and perspective are proven to be better companies. More importantly, creating an environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work is the right thing to do

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Energy is always evolving. At Hartree Partners, we use our decades of experience in

the physical and financial energy and commodities markets to explore the opportunities this evolution provides. We assist our customers in participating in new markets and navigating their complexities for maximum revenues at minimum risk.




We provide a wide range of services to a substantial and diversified customer base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1997, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in many financial centers around the world. Hartree Partners LP is owned by the company’s Managing Partners, senior staff, and Oaktree Capital.




Find out more about us by visiting our website at: http://www.hartreepartners.com/




OUR VALUES:

We are DEEPLY ANALYTICAL, data driven, and methodical, research and application oriented, we seek to understand before we act.




We are ENTREPRENEURIAL, intellectually curious and enterprising, our goal is to develop new methods and find new opportunities.




We are INNOVATIVE, creative and cutting edge, we welcome opportunities to break new ground.




We are COLLABORATIVE, collegial and connected, our best work comes through the teams we have built.




We are ETHICAL, operating with respect and honoring commitments, we are dedicated to making ethical and sustainable business decisions that reflect our core value of integrity.




ROLE OVERVIEW:

As an Insight Analyst specialising in the European Gas Market, you will play a pivotal role in developing data-driven insights to optimise our understanding of gas market dynamics. You will work closely with Traders, Analysts and IT to uncover valuable information that informs trading decisions.




RESPONSIBILITIES:

Utilize advanced data analysis tools such as Tableau (or similar), Excel (with VBA), and SQL to extract, manipulate, and analyze large datasets related to European gas markets.
Collaborate closely with Traders, Analysts, and other stakeholders to understand business requirements and deliver actionable insights that drive trading strategies.
Improve robustness of automated reporting suite and create and monitor dashboards to minimize analytical down time.
Perform ad hoc analysis on Gas Market fundamentals and pricing.




REQUIREMENTS:

A minimum of 2 years of professional experience in developing analytical reporting solutions for production environments.
Excellent technical skills particularly in Tableau (or similar), Excel and SQL.
A minimum of a Bachelor's degree in quantitative field.
Exceptional communication skills, with the capability to simplify complex data insights.
Familiarity with python or similar programming languages, is not mandatory but will be viewed as an advantage.




WHAT'S ON OFFER:

Competitive salary up to £60,000 + bonus.
Comprehensive benefits package including health insurance, pension plan.
Hybrid working arrangement (minimum 3 days in the London office)
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




My client is looking for a Data Analyst to join their team. You'll analyze business performance, product features, and customer behavior, helping to shape data-driven decisions.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze customer, product, onboarding, and payment data to identify trends.
Conduct deep dives into product performance and user behavior.
Build reports and dashboards (Tableau or similar) to enable self-serve insights.
Work with Data Engineers to enhance data analytics capabilities.
Support A/B testing and experimentation for product improvements.




Key Skills & Experience:

Strong SQL skills (Redshift, MSSQL).
Experience handling large, complex datasets to generate insights.
