Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




About Workwear Express

Workwear Express is the UK’s market leader in customised workwear, providing businesses with high-quality, branded clothing for over 35 years. We continue to push boundaries by driving innovation through AI and data, ensuring our customers receive the best service, efficiency, and value. As part of our commitment to growth and technology-driven decision-making, we are expanding our data capabilities and looking for a skilled Data Analyst to join our team.







Position Summary:

We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to help us leverage data for strategic decision-making. You will be responsible for extracting, interpreting, and visualising data to provide insights that drive business performance. Your work will influence key operational and commercial strategies, supporting teams across the company to make data-driven decisions.







Key Responsibilities:

Write complex reports using SQL and Python to extract, manipulate, and analyse large datasets, delivering insights that support key business decisions.
Design, develop, and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports, ensuring they provide up-to-date, actionable insights for stakeholders.
Develop and maintain data models, data warehouses, and data pipelines to ensure efficient data flow and reporting.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., marketing, sales, finance) to understand business requirements and deliver relevant, actionable data insights.
Perform data cleaning, validation, and quality assurance on datasets to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses using SQL/Python and present findings to senior management in a clear, concise format.







Skills & Qualifications:

Proven experience in data analysis and reporting, with advanced proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation and report generation.
Expertise in Power BI for designing and maintaining dashboards and reports, with a strong ability to ensure data visualisations remain accurate and relevant.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently on data projects.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex technical concepts into clear reports and presentations for non-technical users.
Strong attention to detail, organisational skills, and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment while maintaining a focus on high-quality deliverables.







Desirable Skills:

Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) for automation.
Understanding of cloud-based data solutions (e.g., Azure, AWS, Google Cloud).
Experience with statistical analysis, machine learning, or AI-driven insights.




Salary: £40,000. On-Site, DH1 1TF.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
VPZ is a family-run business with 600+ staff. We have grown from just 1 store in Edinburgh to over 180 stores across the whole of the UK and we’re not stopping there. We are known for setting and driving the standards within the vape industry.




This is a great chance to join our growing Data team within our Head Office in Newbridge, Edinburgh.




About the role:




Covering day-to-day reporting along with ad hoc requests, providing verbal and written context to reports as well as taking the initiative to provide key insights based on your findings or from the wider team.




You will be responsible for updating and maintaining databases and day-to-day reporting, while troubleshooting issues that might arise within the reporting suite. Providing regular sales, product, and customer reports throughout the business and creating new reporting as and when required for stakeholders at all levels.




What you'll need:




Full understanding of data structuring, modelling, and cleansing.
Extensive experience building dashboards from the ground up using data visualization software (Power BI or Tableau preferably).
Strong Excel skills




Nice to have:




Experience of analyzing data within a retail environment.
Experience with SQL or Python.




Applicants must be 18 years old or above, any subsequent job offer is subject to pre employment screening checks.

Title: Data Analyst – Systematic Hedge Fund
Description:
Data Analyst sought to join the Systematic Investment arm of a major Multi-Strategy Hedge Fund.




This talented Data team are responsible for the timely delivery of comprehensive and error-free data to some of the most demanding and successful systematic Portfolio Managers in the world.




You will join a small team of Data Analysts and Scientists who play a vital role in ensuring the smooth day-to-day implementation of a large Research Infrastructure, and the live production trading of billions of dollars of capital across Global Capital Markets, including Equities, Futures, Options and other financial instruments.




You will identify potential Data Sources, assist with Data-related questions and requests from Investment teams, set up Data Feed downloads and monitor automated Data Collection and Cleansing Infrastructure, as well as coordinating meetings and conference calls between Data Users and Experts.




Requirements

Masters degree in a Quantitative / STEM subject from a top-ranked University, along with 3-6 years post-graduate commercial experience.
Strong Data Analysis experience, ideally gained in a Quantitative Trading and/or Investment setting.
Programming skills in R, MATLAB, Python, SQL, Java or similar.
Strong organization, communication and interpersonal skills.
Attention to detail and a love of process




This is an excellent opportunity for a Data Analyst to join the Systematic Investment arm of a major Multi-Strategy Hedge Fund. Please note that this firm has a four-day-per week onsite policy.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – AI & Ad Performance Insights

£45,000 - £55,000 base

‼️Location: Office-based (4 days per week near Liverpool St, London), with flexibility for customer and prospect meetings.




An innovative AI-driven SaaS company is looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join their team and play a key role in transforming digital advertising. This is a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of data, AI, and product strategy, with a clear path to Product Ownership.




What You'll Do

Automate and enhance prospect account analysis to accelerate deal cycles
Assess digital advertising accounts using commercial, industry, and AI adoption insights
Develop Python-based analytics to measure performance and AI effectiveness
Standardise key metrics for paid media efficiency, AI scoring, and industry benchmarking
Build automation pipelines to reduce manual analysis and surface insights instantly
Work with engineers to productise automated performance assessments
Engage with sales and customers to translate data insights into business impact
Influence product direction by identifying AI automation and reporting opportunities




What We’re Looking For

1 year+ technical Skills: Python, SQL, data visualisation (they use Shiny, but open to Looker, Tablaeau, matplotlib)
Communication: Ability to present insights and bridge technical analysis with commercial goals - storytelling and gravitas.
Ad-Tech & Analytics: Experience with Google Ads APIs, marketing automation - must have

Added bonus for:

AI & Product Thinking: Passion for AI-driven decision-making and structured analytical models
SaaS B2B start up exposure.




Why Join

Pathway to Product Ownership – grow from data analyst to AI-driven product leader
Hands-on exposure to cutting-edge automation and decision intelligence
Work across Product, Sales, and Engineering in a hybrid, high-impact role
Join a fast-growing, dynamic environment where innovation and collaboration drive success




If you're passionate about AI, analytics, and automation, apply now and be part of the future of AI-driven advertising.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re Hiring: Data Analyst




An exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced Data Analyst to join an enterprise-level Scottish business embarking on a major tech transformation journey. With a focus on modernising data governance, improving data quality, and lifecycle management, this role offers the chance to play a key part in shaping the future of the company’s data landscape.




Role Overview

This position is ideal for a detail-oriented professional with a strong background in data governance and data quality. The Data Analyst will work closely with multiple departments to gather and integrate data from various sources, ensuring its accuracy, accessibility, and compliance with regulatory standards. By maintaining the integrity of business data, the Data Analyst will be instrumental in supporting ongoing and future transformation initiatives.

This is initially a fixed-term position until May 2026, however, there is strong potential for permanent extension.




What’s In It For You?:

Competitive salary up to £50,000 + up to 30% bonus
Hybrid - 1/2 days in Glasgow office per week
9-Day Fortnight, every 2nd Friday off
Range of benefits e.g. life assurance, generous holiday scheme, onsite masseuse and yoga classes, gym and retail discounts + more!




There is also the opportunity to up-skill and contribute to the development of data visualisation tools using Tableau and Power BI in collaboration with Data Engineers - creating insightful dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights for senior leadership and operational teams.




Key Responsibilities:

Ensure data quality and governance standards are upheld across the business
Work closely with multiple departments to integrate and process data accurately
Develop and maintain data pipelines, reporting tools, and analytics processes
Collaborate with Data Engineers to create insightful data visualisations in Tableau and Power BI
Support business transformation efforts by providing actionable insights through data analysis
Ensure data compliance with regulatory and organisational governance standards
Participate in technical due diligence and governance activities
Identify and recommend improvements to existing data systems and workflows




Skills & Experience:

Minimum 2 years’ experience in a data analyst or related data governance role
Proven track record of working on large-scale data governance and transformation projects
Strong knowledge of data quality principles and regulatory compliance
Experience working with data governance tools such as Aperture Data Studio and Purview
Proficiency in Tableau and Power BI for data visualisation is advantageous
Ability to work cross-functionally with IT and business teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with commercial acumen




If this aligns with your career goals, please click “apply,” and a member of the Provn team will be in touch to discuss this position further.




Provn Talent Solutions Ltd is operating as an employment agency under the Conduct of Employment Agencies and Employment Businesses Regulations 2003. Your application will be considered in line with the agency’s Privacy Policy, which can be found on our website.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About

Our client are seeking a passionate Data Analyst with a strong technical skillset. You’ll manage and analyse customer and supplier data, automate data processes, and work with IT teams to improve reporting systems.

Key Responsibilities


Collate and analyse data from WMS systems
Create customer MI packs and reports, including SLA data point
Analyse customer spend and assist with rate cards and tariffs
Ensure accurate data capture, tariff application, and system configuration
Monitor product/client volumes, identify trends, and provide analysis
Reconcile invoices via Xero
Work with IT teams to streamline data flows and solve inventory/data issues


Required Skills & Qualifications


Advanced Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, Macros), Power BI, SQ
Strong financial and analytical reporting skills
Data analysis experience
Highly numerate, with strong problem-solving and communication skills
Self-motivated, adaptable, and results-driven


If you have a passion for data and experience of data automation, then don’t delay and apply with your most up to date CV showcasing your relevant skills.

Due to high volumes of applications, we can’t always reply to everyone, if you haven’t heard from us within 48 hours please assume that your application has not been successful on this occasion

Nice-to-have skills


Power BI
SQL
Hounslow, England


Work experience


Data Analyst


Languages


English

Title: Graduate Data Analyst - London
Description:
Job Position: Graduate Data Analyst (Engineer/Scientist) - via the Graduate Development Programme   

Locations: London

Starting Salary: £28,000  

Application Requirements:


Minimum 2:1 or above in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) subject
Experience in analysing data
Right to work in the UK unsponsored for the duration of the programme
Ability to work on site 5 days a week.


Grayce specialises in driving change and transformation for some of the world's most ambitious organisations. For over a decade, we've partnered with FTSE 100 and 250 companies to deliver impactful results by developing and deploying high-performing talent in the UK and beyond.

Grayce is not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register and is unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants. 

Our Accelerated Development Programme is designed to launch the careers of recent graduates eager to make an impact. We offer a fast-track route to expertise, allowing you to gain hands-on experience with one of our impressive clients in a variety of flexible roles such as Data Analysis, InfoSec, Software Testing and DevOps.

Join Grayce and accelerate your career!

Why Grayce?

Our Analysts are actively involved in major global transformation programmes across diverse industries.

Opportunity: You'll embark on a journey of continuous learning, gaining industry-accredited qualifications, whilst getting hands-on experience working full time on site directly with prestigious FTSE100, 250, and 500 organisations.

Delivery: You will work with one client, delivering high quality outcomes during your Grayce tenure, before transitioning to working directly for them. The skills required for exceptional client delivery include natural curiosity, proactivity, adaptability, effective communication and problem solving.

Mentoring: Thrive under the guidance of our experienced Delivery Managers and Technical Trainers. They'll be your go-to, offering support, insights, sharing experiences.

Progression: Starting as an Analyst with the potential for significant salary progression, you will pick up invaluable skills and complete a minimum of 6 industry recognised accreditations during your time on the development programme.

What Makes a Great Grayce Analyst

2:1 Undergraduate Degree: An undergraduate degree with a minimum 2:1 within in a STEM field. A solid academic basis within data analysis and science through an additional MSc would be an advantage.

Data Tools: Previous experience with tools such as Excel, R, SQL or Python are an essential for this role. If you have utilised visualisation programmes such as Tableau or Power BI in projects before, we are also keen to hear from you.

Analytical Problem Solving: We're looking for analytical minds that can spot patterns and think creatively. Whether it's dissecting complex issues or finding fresh angles, we highly value critical thinking skills and their application.

Soft Skills: From effective communication styles to planning, organisation and a learning development mindset, Grayce is committed to building core consultancy skills. Stakeholder and time management are core skills we utilise every day and we look for examples of those through our interview process.

Why work for us?

Competitive Salary: Starting at £28,000 with potential for significant growth

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My client is an insurtech creating and incubating cutting-edge AI and automation technology to bring efficiency and simplicity to claims. Founded by insurtech veterans with deep experience in SaaS and digital claims, they are venture-backed by Bain Capital and Altai Ventures and began operations in May 2022. They are focused on automating highly manual tasks to tackle long-standing problems in claims and set a new standard for TPAs, insurance technology providers, and adjusters alike.




They have ambitious (but attainable!) goals and need people who can work in an evolving environment. If building a leading TPA and the prospect of tackling the long-standing challenges of the claims role sounds exciting, get in touch.




In this role, you will be an integral part of the company’s data organisation, working with customers to deliver exemplary data management of their claims portfolios. The ideal candidate will be an analytics professional with strong technical skills and the desire to learn and grow in their role. This role will require you to own day to day reporting and analyses for customers, whilst automating away mundane and repetitive reporting and building processes with the operations team that benefit our data asset.




Experience

Knowledge of the data stack: Python (Pandas to Langchain), Postgres, Looker, ECS, Docker etc.
Confident shipping reporting code and operational processes that solve the customers’ needs
Serve as the analyst responsible for the monthly reporting packages
Liaise with the operations teams solving their nuanced data issues
Communicate ideas and specifications through detailed, precise writing
Influence the culture, values, and processes of a growing technology team




Requirements

Experience in a data science or analytics role, preferably within the insurance and/or claims space, with experience working independently / in a small team
Have a proven track record of shipping high quality data analysis at a high cadence
Experience using modern analytics and programming languages with an emphasis on statistical analysis
A proven ability to manage relationships with high value customers and communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences alike
The ability to wear adjacent hats as you grow your scope: analyst, developer, customer manager




This is a fully remote role with occasional client meetings, mainly in London.




Benefits include a generous health-insurance package, industry qualifications paid by the company (after a qualifying period), work from anywhere to facilitate your work-life balance and quality home tech set up.

Founded by insurtech veterans with deep experience in SaaS and digital claims, they are venture-backed by Bain Capital and Altai Ventures and began operations in May 2022. They are focused on automating highly manual tasks to tackle long-standing problems in claims and set a new standard for TPAs, insurance technology providers, and adjusters alike.


They have ambitious (but attainable!) goals and need people who can work in an evolving environment. If building a leading TPA and the prospect of tackling the long-standing challenges of the claims role sounds exciting, get in touch.


In this role, you will be an integral part of the company’s data organisation, working with customers to deliver exemplary data management of their claims portfolios. The ideal candidate will be an analytics professional with strong technical skills and the desire to learn and grow in their role. This role will require you to own day to day reporting and analyses for customers, whilst automating away mundane and repetitive reporting and building processes with the operations team that benefit our data asset.


Experience

  • Knowledge of the data stack: Python (Pandas to Langchain), Postgres, Looker, ECS, Docker etc.
  • Confident shipping reporting code and operational processes that solve the customers’ needs
  • Serve as the analyst responsible for the monthly reporting packages
  • Liaise with the operations teams solving their nuanced data issues
  • Communicate ideas and specifications through detailed, precise writing
  • Influence the culture, values, and processes of a growing technology team


Requirements

  • Experience in a data science or analytics role, preferably within the insurance and/or claims space, with experience working independently / in a small team
  • Have a proven track record of shipping high quality data analysis at a high cadence
  • Experience using modern analytics and programming languages with an emphasis on statistical analysis
  • A proven ability to manage relationships with high value customers and communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences alike
  • The ability to wear adjacent hats as you grow your scope: analyst, developer, customer manager


This is a fully remote role with occasional client meetings, mainly in London.


Benefits include a generous health-insurance package, industry qualifications paid by the company (after a qualifying period), work from anywhere to facilitate your work-life balance and quality home tech set up.

Title: Data Analyst (Power BI)
Description:
Are you ready to write your next chapter?

Make your mark at one of the biggest names in payments. With proven technology, we process the largest volume of payments in the world, driving the global economy every day. When you join Worldpay, you join a global community of experts and changemakers, working to reinvent an industry by constantly evolving how we work and making the way millions of people pay easier, every day.

We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our ever evolving Customer Experience team to help us unleash the potential of every business.

Are you ready to make your mark? Then you sound like a Worldpayer.

About The Team

Our Customer Experience Worldpayers are at the heart of it all — enabling us to provide world-class support to customers. Unwavering dedication and full of enthusiasm, they’re always finding ways for us to grow together.

Our Global Planning Team are hiring an exciting new role for a driven data analyst creating data lead analytics to deliver crucial insights to further enhance customer service offering and business performances.

What You’ll Own


Extracting and manage data sets to deliver vital reports and dashboards
Communicating with stakeholders to understand data content and business requirements
Organising and transforming information into comprehensible structures
Performing statistical analysis of data
Creating visually appealing and interactive charts, graphs and dashboards to represent data analysis results


Where you’ll own it

You’ll own it in our buzzing Gateshead hub. Our sites are hubs of activity, conversation, and openness. With inspiring, stylish workspaces we want people to feel excited to come and do their best work.

What You Bring


Data management and analytic skills
Advanced Knowledge of excel, Power Query and Power BI
Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail
Knowledge of Tableau, DAX code & Power Automate preferred


What Makes a Worldpayer

What makes a Worldpayer? It’s simple: Think, Act, Win. We stay curious, always asking the right questions to be better every day, finding creative solutions to simplify the complex. We’re dynamic, every Worldpayer is empowered to make the right decisions for their customers. And we’re determined, always staying open – winning and failing as one.

Does this sound like you? Then you sound like a Worldpayer. Apply now to write the next chapter in your career.

To find out more about working with us, find us on LinkedIn.

Worldpay Perks - What We’ll Bring For You

We know it’s bigger than just your career. It’s your life, and your world. That’s why we offer global benefits and programs to support you at every stage. Here’s a taste of what you can expect.


A competitive salary and benefits.
Time to support charities and give back to your community.
Global recognition platform
Global employee assistance program.


Privacy Statement

Worldpay is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how Worldpay protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.

Sourcing Model

Recruitment at Worldpay works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. Worldpay does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

#pridepass

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
SRG are currently working with a long-term partner of ours in the Pharmaceutical industry to add a Business Data Analyst to them. As one of the global leaders in the space, they are going through continuous growth, with their UK division now looking to expand their Business Excellence team.




As a Business Data Analyst within the Business Excellence team you can expect to:




Have input in key decision making across the UK business, using analytical solutions and data driven insight.
Partner with key stakeholders within the business to support the overall strategy of the business and the execution of this.
Develop and deliver data visualisation platforms for users.
Work with both local and offshore teams, assisting the offshore teams to develop data visualisation tools aligned to business needs and timelines.
Also work closely with stakeholders and the offshore teams to translate business requirements into actionable tasks.




This role is perfect for anyone with a Healthcare or Life Sciences background within Data Analysis or Business Analysis.




Now you know what to expect in the role, what can you expect outside of this?




Be part of an employee-first organisation; this means 25 days holiday, private healthcare for you and your family, health days, reduced gym membership costs, life insurance, pension scheme, and many more benefits.
Company car or car allowance.
Bonus scheme through recognition program to reward employees.
Continuous training provided & encouragement to progress up the career ladder where opportunities are available.




Sounds good, right? Not only do the organisation pride themselves on being employee-centric, they also have an industry leading benefits package and a great work-life balance.




If you're still interested by this stage, to be considered it's imperative that you have the below:




Experience in Data Analysis, Business Intelligence, or Analytical roles within the Healthcare or Life Sciences industries.
Knowledge of SQL, Data Warehousing, and ETL processes.
Understanding of CRM and ERP systems.
Direct experience with Data Visualisation and Analytics Platforms (Qlik is highly preferred but not required)
Degree in a related field e.g. Data Science, Business Analytics, or similar area, is preferred.
Ability to work 2-3 days in the office in one of the two locations listed (West Yorkshire or Essex); if based in the Essex office, this may mean travel to the other office on occasion - costs and accommodation covered by the business.




Please note: This position is hybrid and can be based in either West Yorkshire OR Essex in the UK.




If you feel like you could be a good fit, please apply directly here or email me at: adrian.link@srgtalent.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Glasgow, 3 Days a Week On-Site

Industry: IT Consultancy




About Us:

Are you passionate about transforming data into actionable insights? Join a leading IT consultancy in Glasgow and help our clients make data-driven decisions. We are looking for a talented Data Analyst who thrives in a dynamic environment and enjoys collaborating with cross-functional teams to solve complex business challenges.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide meaningful business insights.
Develop reports and interactive dashboards using BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver solutions.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through effective data validation techniques.
Present findings to clients in a clear and compelling manner.




Key Requirements:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, or Python.
Experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and presentation abilities.




Why Join Us?

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunity to work with diverse clients across various industries.
Hybrid working model with flexibility.
Career growth and professional development opportunities.




How to Apply:

Ready to advance your career with a dynamic IT consultancy? Apply now by sending your CV and a brief cover letter to [Contact Email].




#Hiring #DataAnalyst #ITConsultancy #GlasgowJobs #DataInsights #PowerBI #Tableau #CareerOpportunity

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Salary: £31,000

Location: Coventry (On site 5 days a week)










A fantastic opportunity has come up to work for an exciting organisation located in Coventry, which is looking to expand its data team.




They are looking for a Junior BI Analyst to help support the business with resolving queries and issues that the teams are experiencing. In this challenging yet exciting role you will use your SQL skills to investigate and troubleshoot problems and resolve them. They are looking for a proactive person who is a self-starter.




They are looking for a BI Analyst who has enthusiasm and commitment to excel in their IT department. A keen eye for detail, a highly structured approach, a personal drive to succeed and the ability to learn and grow are all key assets you will possess. They are a company that believes in their staff and will always back you in terms of support, personal development and progression.




From a technical standpoint, you will be using an advanced and practical knowledge of SQL, as well as expert usage of Excel to deliver and present results (e.g. advanced formulas, pivot tables).







Essential skills and experience:




Knowledge of MS SQL Server; T-SQL is essential
Writing SQL queries
Excellent Microsoft Excel skills
Good problem identification and solving skills
Excellent attention to detail and analytical skills
Ability to manage time effectively, meet deadlines and prioritise
Minimum of 1 years’ experience in a similar role
Strong written and verbal communication skills




Applying for the opportunity:




If you like the sound of this opportunity, and you feel you have the required skills requested for the role. Please apply, and someone will contact you within 24 hours if you meet the requirements of the opportunity.

Title: Data Analyst - Multiple Industries
Description:
Graduate - Mid-Level Analyst Roles | London & UK-Wide

Over 90+ London-based roles + more across the UK! 🌍




Are you a BSc, MSc, or PhD graduate eager to launch your career in Data Analysis, Risk Analysis, Quantitative Research, or Business Intelligence? We specialise in placing junior to mid-level candidates in top-tier roles across multiple industries—helping you secure the perfect opportunity tailored to your skills and interests!




Industry-Specific Opportunities:

We work with cutting-edge companies across various sectors, including:

📊 Finance & FinTech – Risk analysis, market research, quantitative trading, fraud detection.

💰 Investment & Asset Management – Portfolio analytics, algorithmic trading, financial modeling.

🏥 Healthcare & Biotech – AI-driven medical research, clinical trial data analysis, health informatics.

🌱 Sustainability & Energy – Carbon footprint analysis, renewable energy forecasting, ESG analytics.

🛍 Retail & E-Commerce – Customer insights, pricing strategy, supply chain analytics.

🚗 Transport & Logistics – Predictive demand planning, route optimisation, fleet analytics.

⚽ Sports & Media – Player performance analysis, audience engagement, sponsorship ROI.

✈️ Aerospace & Manufacturing – Operational efficiency, process optimisation, predictive maintenance.




If you have a niche passion for applying analytical skills in a specific industry, we’ll help you find a role that aligns with your ambitions.




💼 Top Active Roles in London & Beyond:

📈 Risk Analyst – Assess financial and operational risks for investment and corporate strategy.

📊 Quantitative Analyst (Quant) – Use statistical models to drive trading and investment decisions.

💡 Business Intelligence Analyst – Extract insights from big data to support strategic decision-making.

📉 Market Research Analyst – Analyse industry trends and consumer behaviour to guide business growth.

💳 Fraud & Compliance Analyst – Detect fraudulent activities and ensure regulatory compliance.

🛒 E-Commerce Data Analyst – Optimise pricing strategies, customer segmentation, and marketing efforts.

⚡ Renewable Energy Analyst – Predict energy demand and optimise sustainable energy use.

⚽ Sports Data Analyst – Help teams and organisations leverage performance and audience data.

📢 Marketing & Consumer Insights Analyst – Track customer behaviour and optimise ad campaigns.

🚀 AI & Automation Analyst – Apply machine learning to optimise business processes.




These are just a few of the 90+ live London-based roles—plus even more opportunities across the UK! We collaborate with leading financial institutions, tech firms, investment banks, and industry disruptors to launch your career in data and analytics.




📌 Why Apply?

✔️ 90+ London-based Analyst roles + more across the UK.

✔️ Exclusive access to top employers in finance, fintech, healthcare, retail, and beyond.

✔️ Career growth & mentorship in cutting-edge analytical fields.

✔️ Work with innovative companies from startups to global enterprises.




🎯 What We’re Looking For:

✅ BSc, MSc, or PhD graduates in Data Science, Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field.

✅ Strong analytical, statistical, and problem-solving skills.

✅ Proficiency in tools like Python, R, SQL, Excel, Power BI, Tableau, SAS or similar.

✅ Passion for leveraging data to drive insights and decision-making.

✅ Interest in applying analytical skills across different industries.




🚀 Ready to Launch Your Career in Analytics?

London is a global hub for data-driven decision-making—making it the perfect place to start your journey. Whether you're interested in finance, technology, sustainability, or cutting-edge business intelligence, we’ll connect you with the best opportunities.




🔗 Apply now and let’s find your ideal role! 💡

Title: Data Analyst - Zoopla
Description:
At Zoopla, we're here to help everyone make intelligent decisions about their home. Do the best work of your life!

We're a part of Houseful, home to trusted brands Zoopla, Alto, Hometrack, Calcasa and Prime Location. Together we're creating the connections that power better property decisions by unlocking the combined strength of software, data and insight.

We make moves with head and heart to achieve our big ambitions and to drive progress in the property market. There's never been a better time to join us.

Position Overview

Every month millions of people visit Zoopla searching over 500,000 homes for sale and rent, finding the best agents and securing the latest mortgage deals looking for help on one of the biggest decisions in life. Where's my next home going to be?

We want to help even more people make better property decisions, and that's why we care so much about data. Whether someone is looking for their next home or an estate agent is looking to list, we need a best-in-class journey for both. Measurement, experimentation, and insights are the keys to unlocking this.

Responsibilities


Taking ownership of the data relationship with business stakeholders
With support from the rest of the Analytics team
Reporting on our baseline performance and trends. Keeping our finger on the pulse
Driving us towards a self-serve first culture
Reporting on complex experimentation
Close analyst-stakeholder relationships are the most crucial component of a well-functioning data team. Stakeholders should consider you part of their team
Varied work across other data disciplines, e.g. dashboarding, AE modelling, business unit level deep dives and data sprints, supporting ML projects
We make time for innovation, so if you have an idea, shout, and we'll make the space


Requirements


What does a great candidate look like


Experience analysing pricing strategies. For example competitive pricing, value based pricing, and penetration pricing
Demonstrates curiosity and a proactive approach to learning, constantly seeking opportunities to deepen understanding and explore new ideas
Exhibits a strong desire for ownership and accountability, taking the initiative to drive projects forward and deliver impactful results
Skilled at translating complex business challenges into actionable data insights, driving meaningful outcomes and business impact
Excellent communication skills, able to convey ideas clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
While recognising the value of experience, greater emphasis is placed on finding the right cultural fit and individual capabilities for the role
Strives to set high standards and continually seeks opportunities for personal and team growth, fostering an environment of continuous improvement
Inspired by the prospect of contributing to industry innovation and eager to participate in reimagining the future landscape



Essential

Technical Skills


Proficient in SQL with a proven track record of handling complex data queries and manipulation
Demonstrable experience with Tableau or similar data visualisation tools, including the ability to create insightful and user-friendly dashboards and reports



Desirable


Experience with DBT (Data Build Tool) or similar data transformation technologies, with a keen understanding of data modelling and ETL processes
A background in statistics and/or programming, with the ability to apply statistical methods and algorithms to extract insights from data
Especially surrounding experimentation

Familiarity with machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) techniques, preferably in Python, R, or another programming language, enabling the development and implementation of predictive models and data-driven solutions

Benefits


Everyday Flex - greater flexibility over where and when you work
25 days annual leave + extra days for years of service
Day off for volunteering & Digital detox day
Festive Closure - business closed for a period between Christmas and New Year
Cycle to work and electric car schemes
Free Calm App membership
Enhanced Parental leave
Fertility Treatment Financial Support
Group Income Protection and private medical insurance
Gym on-site in London
7.5% pension contribution by the company
Discretionary annual bonus up to 10% of base salary
Talent referral bonus up to £5K
Show more

What does a great candidate look like

  • Experience analysing pricing strategies. For example competitive pricing, value based pricing, and penetration pricing
  • Demonstrates curiosity and a proactive approach to learning, constantly seeking opportunities to deepen understanding and explore new ideas
  • Exhibits a strong desire for ownership and accountability, taking the initiative to drive projects forward and deliver impactful results
  • Skilled at translating complex business challenges into actionable data insights, driving meaningful outcomes and business impact
  • Excellent communication skills, able to convey ideas clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • While recognising the value of experience, greater emphasis is placed on finding the right cultural fit and individual capabilities for the role
  • Strives to set high standards and continually seeks opportunities for personal and team growth, fostering an environment of continuous improvement
  • Inspired by the prospect of contributing to industry innovation and eager to participate in reimagining the future landscape


Essential

Technical Skills

  • Proficient in SQL with a proven track record of handling complex data queries and manipulation
  • Demonstrable experience with Tableau or similar data visualisation tools, including the ability to create insightful and user-friendly dashboards and reports


Desirable

  • Experience with DBT (Data Build Tool) or similar data transformation technologies, with a keen understanding of data modelling and ETL processes
  • A background in statistics and/or programming, with the ability to apply statistical methods and algorithms to extract insights from data
    • Especially surrounding experimentation
Familiarity with machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) techniques, preferably in Python, R, or another programming language, enabling the development and implementation of predictive models and data-driven solutions

Benefits

  • Everyday Flex - greater flexibility over where and when you work
  • 25 days annual leave + extra days for years of service
  • Day off for volunteering & Digital detox day
  • Festive Closure - business closed for a period between Christmas and New Year
  • Cycle to work and electric car schemes
  • Free Calm App membership
  • Enhanced Parental leave
  • Fertility Treatment Financial Support
  • Group Income Protection and private medical insurance
  • Gym on-site in London
  • 7.5% pension contribution by the company
  • Discretionary annual bonus up to 10% of base salary
  • Talent referral bonus up to £5K

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
Zeal Group is one of the leading trading platforms with a focus on developing markets and great plans for international expansion.

At the heart of our company's data-driven strategy lies our Business Intelligence team, a specialized group dedicated to the art and science of data analysis. Our team is the backbone in transforming raw data into a treasure trove of insights, guiding the strategic direction of the company. With a laser focus on identifying and building key indicators for crucial areas within the organization, we strive to help key stakeholders in strategic decision-making.

We are a compact team of data analysts and BI engineers, each with a deep understanding of how data shapes business outcomes. Our expertise spans across various domains, enabling us to craft bespoke analytical solutions that meet the unique needs of different departments. From sales and marketing to operations and finance, our work informs strategies, optimizes performance, and uncovers opportunities for growth and innovation.

In our pursuit of excellence, we leverage cutting-edge BI tools and technologies, ensuring our stakeholders access reliable, timely, and actionable data. Our collaborative ethos fosters a culture of shared knowledge and continuous learning, enabling us to push the boundaries of what is possible with data.

As a Data Analyst/BI Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable insights and strategic recommendations. Your mission is to delve deep into the analysis of company indicators, unraveling the stories the data tells to empower business decisions, optimize processes, and drive product innovation. You will:


Analyze company indicators to provide actionable business insights and product improvement recommendations
Develop and own business intelligence solutions, including BI/data visualisation tools, dashboards, and reports to meet business needs
Collaborate with stakeholders as a data business partner, understanding and defining business requirements for data assets
Develop and maintain the semantics layers of the data analytics platform through effective data modelling and data orchestration
Ensure data quality and integrity by establishing and enforcing data governance standards
Create and manage documentation, including technical specifications, data catalog, and other related documents for BI processes, systems, and procedures



Requirements


Fluency in SQL is a must (CTE, Window functions)
Hands-on experience with BI tools, Dashboards, and Data Visualizations (Power BI, Metabase or similar tools)
Proven track record of end-to-end implementation of data analysis projects, from gathering requirements and data processing to effectively presenting insights to stakeholders
Proficient in data modeling, building high quality datasets and products


Nice to have


Proficiency in Data Modelling, building high quality datasets and products
Experience in Python
Experience with DBT, Airflow, Dagster or similar tools
Experience with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Spark)
Background in online trading or related financial sectors



Benefits


State-of-the-art technologies (Power BI, Metabase, BigQuery, Dagster, DBT, Datahub, Spark, Python, SQL)
A collaborative and friendly team of professionals
High engineering standards (with a focus on change management and data quality)
Flexible schedule and remote friendliness
Show more

Title: Graduate Data Analyst - London
Description:
Job Position: Graduate Data Analyst (Engineer/Scientist) – via the Graduate Development Programme   

Locations: London

Starting Salary: £28,000  

Application Requirements


Minimum 2:1 or above in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) subject
Experience in analysing data
Right to work in the UK unsponsored for the duration of the programme
Ability to work on site 5 days a week.


Grayce specialises in driving change and transformation for some of the world’s most ambitious organisations. For over a decade, we've partnered with FTSE 100 and 250 companies to deliver impactful results by developing and deploying high-performing talent in the UK and beyond.

Grayce is not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register and is unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants. 

Our Accelerated Development Programme is designed to launch the careers of recent graduates eager to make an impact. We offer a fast-track route to expertise, allowing you to gain hands-on experience with one of our impressive clients in a variety of flexible roles such as Data Analysis, InfoSec, Software Testing and DevOps.

Join Grayce and accelerate your career!

Why Grayce?

Our Analysts are actively involved in major global transformation programmes across diverse industries.

Opportunity: You'll embark on a journey of continuous learning, gaining industry-accredited qualifications, whilst getting hands-on experience working full time on site directly with prestigious FTSE100, 250, and 500 organisations.

Delivery: You will work with one client, delivering high quality outcomes during your Grayce tenure, before transitioning to working directly for them. The skills required for exceptional client delivery include natural curiosity, proactivity, adaptability, effective communication and problem solving.

Mentoring: Thrive under the guidance of our experienced Delivery Managers and Technical Trainers. They’ll be your go-to, offering support, insights, sharing experiences.

Progression: Starting as an Analyst with the potential for significant salary progression, you will pick up invaluable skills and complete a minimum of 6 industry recognised accreditations during your time on the development programme.

What Makes a Great Grayce Analyst

2:1 Undergraduate Degree: An undergraduate degree with a minimum 2:1 within in a STEM field. A solid academic basis within data analysis and science through an additional MSc would be an advantage.

Data Tools: Previous experience with tools such as Excel, R, SQL or Python are an essential for this role. If you have utilised visualisation programmes such as Tableau or Power BI in projects before, we are also keen to hear from you.

Analytical Problem Solving: We're looking for analytical minds that can spot patterns and think creatively. Whether it's dissecting complex issues or finding fresh angles, we highly value critical thinking skills and their application.

Soft Skills: From effective communication styles to planning, organisation and a learning development mindset, Grayce is committed to building core consultancy skills. Stakeholder and time management are core skills we utilise every day and we look for examples of those through our interview process.

Why work for us?

Competitive Salary: Starting at £28,000 with potential for significant growth

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Scotland (Hybrid - Full driving license is essential)

Industry: Energy & Environmental Consultancy

Employment Type: Full-time, Permanent




About Us:

We are a forward-thinking energy and environmental consultancy committed to providing innovative solutions to the challenges posed by climate change, energy transition, and sustainable development. As a team of passionate professionals, we work across a range of industries including energy, water, waste, and environmental policy. We are looking to expand our team and are seeking a motivated and analytical Data Analyst to join us in driving the future of sustainable energy.




Position Overview:

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in helping our clients navigate the complex landscape of energy and environmental data. You will work with a variety of data sources, analyze trends, and support decision-making through your insights and expertise. This role will involve collaborating with project teams, managing datasets, performing statistical analysis, and presenting findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and organize large datasets from various sources related to energy consumption, emissions, environmental factors, and sustainability metrics.
Conduct in-depth analysis of energy usage trends, carbon footprints, and environmental data to support clients in their sustainability goals.
Apply statistical techniques and models to identify patterns, correlations, and forecasts relevant to energy transition and environmental management.
Develop data visualizations, dashboards, and reports to communicate findings and recommendations to clients in a clear and actionable format.
Work closely with project teams and clients to understand their data needs and tailor analytical solutions to specific requirements.
Support the creation of tools and systems for automated data collection and reporting.
Ensure data quality and integrity, performing regular audits and updates of datasets.
Assist in the preparation of technical documentation, including data models, methodologies, and assumptions.
Stay up-to-date with developments in the energy sector, environmental policies, and emerging trends in data analytics.




Required Qualifications & Skills:

A degree in Data Science, Statistics, Environmental Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience working with large datasets, preferably within the energy, environmental, or sustainability sectors.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, Python, R, or similar.
Experience with data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms.
Knowledge of energy systems, environmental policies, and sustainability practices is a plus.
Ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks, and meet deadlines.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data insights to a non-technical audience.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.




Desirable Skills:

Familiarity with renewable energy data, emissions reporting standards, or environmental impact assessments.
Experience in geospatial data analysis (e.g., GIS tools).
Understanding of energy transition frameworks such as net-zero goals or carbon offset projects.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques or advanced statistical modeling.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Flexible working hours and hybrid/remote working options.
Opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects within the energy and environmental sectors.
Access to ongoing training and development opportunities.
A supportive, collaborative, and inclusive work environment.
A chance to contribute to meaningful projects that have a positive impact on the environment and society.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Credit Risk
Description:
London, UK

Octopus Energy UK 🇬🇧 – Credit /

Full-time /

Hybrid



This could not be a better time to join Octopus Energy. We are already recognised as a global leader in the fight to decarbonise the planet by revolutionising what’s possible in energy - including investments in renewable energy supply, renewable energy generation, smart energy networks, EVs, heat pumps, etc. The government's new green initiatives and the recent investment by Al Gore’s Generation Fund will propel us further and faster.

There has never been a more important moment to join our credit risk team. The energy sector is going through a period of once-in-a-generation volatility. Businesses and households are facing higher energy prices than they ever have before. For these reasons we are looking to add to our credit risk team with this new role. This team sits at the heart of everything we do to support customers that are struggling with their bills. We’re unique because we are genuinely a hybrid of a few different skills and mindsets:

1. Data analytics is our core skillset. Everyone in the team is very strong in this area

2. We have a firm understanding of the needs of our customers and the business

3. We work closely with the tech team, because we’re a tech company, so this how we solve customer problems, efficiently at scale


We work closely with our operations teams who are the people that speak directly to customers



What You'll Do


Take ownership of our management of customers who are struggling with their payments
Deep dive investigations into data in order to surface insight for decision making
Develop our reporting suite through the latest BI tools & technology stack
Develop our empathic approaches towards vulnerable customers
Create strategies to identify and prevent first party and third party fraud
Develop our machine learning models & policies that drive sophisticated decisions
Proactively identify new areas of opportunity
Challenge the status quo in terms of KPIs, objectives & strategy
Communicate complex data concepts effectively and confidently
Build great relationships with Data Science, Technology, Finance, Collections, Ops and other stakeholders



What You'll Need


Excellent SQL skills
A drive to solve problems using data



What would be a bonus:


Python data science stack (pandas, NumPy, Jupyter notebooks, Plotly/matplotlib, etc)
Familiarity with Git
Data visualization tool (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI or equivalent)
DBT
2-5 years experience of consumer credit risk or collections in the financial services, utilities or telecommunications industries



£0 - £0 a year

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to help power your career and be part of an evolving energy industry?​

An exciting opportunity has arisen for an enthusiastic Analyst to join our team.




The energy industry is advancing with investment in smart technology innovation and Northern Powergrid, as the company responsible for powering everyday life for 8 million customers across 3.9 million homes and businesses in the North East, Yorkshire and northern Lincolnshire, is at the forefront of delivering a power network that meets the region’s needs now and in the future.




Our vision is to be the best energy company in serving our customers, whilst delivering a sustainable energy solution. We are looking for someone who is passionate about communications and can help share our story as we deliver our plans to invest in our network, support net zero and create a greener energy future. As a dedicated Analyst, you will be responsible for interpretation of data to support the development and improvement of key business processes, not only within the Business Support function, but also within the wider organisation.




Along with a competitive salary between £25,774 - £28,401 , we also offer great benefits such as;

•Enrolment into our pension scheme

•25 days holiday

Vouchers
Tourists Attraction tickets
Progression




We’re excited to hear from candidates with a passion for our company and the energy industry and a desire to succeed. Apply now and we’ll be in touch.




Key Responsibilities




The successful candidate will be accountable for:

•Work within a closely managed reporting cycle making sure that we meet both internal and external reporting requirements

•Interpret data and identify key trends and important findings to define actionable insights to improve performance and processes

•Presentation of data and findings to internal and/or external audiences adapting styles accordingly

•Ensure accurate records are maintained to facilitate timely payment approval’s, whilst working towards continual improvement

•Develop and maintain reporting dashboards providing accurate and timely data to aid the business in strategic decisions

•Build and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders

•Work within the wider support teams to develop skills and understanding of Northern Powergrid, Business Support and processes

Key Competencies

•Strong analytical skills: skilled user of Excel

•Excellent attention to detail

•Strong communication and decision-making skills

•Innovative problem solver with an eye for process improvements

•Strong numeracy skills and ability to interpret complex data




Qualifications and Attributes

Essential Qualifications and Experience

•Minimum qualification of 2 A Levels C or above OR NVQ Level 3 OR ONC in Business Management

•Advanced Excel knowledge

•Desirable Qualifications and Experience

•Full UK driving licence

•Experience in data analysis roles

•Power BI reporting

•Experience using SQL or VBA




Click here to apply today or email your application to recruitment@northernpowergrid.com referencing R6890

Visit northernpowergrid.com/careers to find out more about this and other career opportunities.​




Applicants are considered on the basis of their suitability for the post irrespective of sex, marital status, sexual orientation, gender re-assignment, race, age or disability, in accordance with the Equality Act 2010.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Treasury Risk Solutions (TRS) team provides treasury management services and solutions to companies, including foreign exchange, commodities and rates hedging, and cash flow management solutions. As an embedded Analyst within TRS, you will deliver technical and analytical expertise to support a data-driven culture within TRS and the Specialist Bank. Your key responsibility will be to build processes that extract, manipulate, and visualise data, enabling the business to make informed, data-driven decisions.




Key Responsibilities:




Deliver data analysis to business stakeholders, enabling data-driven decision-making and keeping them informed about business insights and performance.
Create interactive data visualisations using Power BI, collaborating with business teams to formulate KPIs and appropriate measures.
Migrate existing analytics processes to Power BI and the Microsoft Azure platform, where possible.
Develop a deep understanding of each business area to assist with day-to-day procedures, provide revenue generation insights, conduct cost reduction analysis, and enhance efficiency.
Engage with revenue-generating and business-enabling teams to understand their reporting and analytics requirements, converting these into actionable outputs.
Manage stakeholder expectations through clear and frequent communication, ensuring outputs are fit for purpose.
Document all processes and outputs created, actively monitor data and reporting processes, and investigate appropriate fixes in the event of process failures.
Collaborate with the Platform and Data Engineering Team to source all data from the “One Data Platform” (ODP), identifying any sources not currently included and working with engineering to integrate them.




Core Skills and Knowledge:




Career Background: Do you have entrenched experience within the data and analytics function or industry? Do you have a proven track record of delivering data-driven business analysis? Can you share examples of how you have delivered impactful data-driven business analysis?
Technical Skills: Are you proficient in SQL and other languages needed to extract data? How skilled are you in data visualisation tools, especially Power BI? What experience do you have with Microsoft Azure Cloud-based tools such as Data Bricks, Data Factory, Synapse Analytics, and Analysis Services? Have you utilised Python in your previous roles?
Educational Background: Do you hold a Bachelor's degree (or higher) in a numerical, computer science, or financial discipline?
Analytical Skills: How do you interpret complex information to spot trends and "tell a story" back to the business? Can you provide examples of how you distil stakeholder requirements into succinct questions and deliver timely, actionable insights?
Communication Skills: How do you adapt your communication style to engage effectively with different audiences? Can you describe a situation where your influencing skills made a significant impact?
Project Management: Are you able to self-manage research, design, prioritise, implement, and deliver projects efficiently? How do you ensure that your projects are completed on time?
Personal Attributes: Are you willing to learn new tools and skills quickly? What motivates your commitment to follow projects through to completion, and how do you maintain attention to detail in your work?




We are looking for someone who is honest, punctual, takes initiative, and possesses a questioning mindset. If you have the innate drive to improve processes and foster collaboration across the Bank, we would love to hear from you.

Show more
HTML:
The Treasury Risk Solutions (TRS) team provides treasury management services and solutions to companies, including foreign exchange, commodities and rates hedging, and cash flow management solutions. As an embedded Analyst within TRS, you will deliver technical and analytical expertise to support a data-driven culture within TRS and the Specialist Bank. Your key responsibility will be to build processes that extract, manipulate, and visualise data, enabling the business to make informed, data-driven decisions.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Deliver data analysis to business stakeholders, enabling data-driven decision-making and keeping them informed about business insights and performance.
  • Create interactive data visualisations using Power BI, collaborating with business teams to formulate KPIs and appropriate measures.
  • Migrate existing analytics processes to Power BI and the Microsoft Azure platform, where possible.
  • Develop a deep understanding of each business area to assist with day-to-day procedures, provide revenue generation insights, conduct cost reduction analysis, and enhance efficiency.
  • Engage with revenue-generating and business-enabling teams to understand their reporting and analytics requirements, converting these into actionable outputs.
  • Manage stakeholder expectations through clear and frequent communication, ensuring outputs are fit for purpose.
  • Document all processes and outputs created, actively monitor data and reporting processes, and investigate appropriate fixes in the event of process failures.
  • Collaborate with the Platform and Data Engineering Team to source all data from the “One Data Platform” (ODP), identifying any sources not currently included and working with engineering to integrate them.


Core Skills and Knowledge:


  • Career Background: Do you have entrenched experience within the data and analytics function or industry? Do you have a proven track record of delivering data-driven business analysis? Can you share examples of how you have delivered impactful data-driven business analysis?
  • Technical Skills: Are you proficient in SQL and other languages needed to extract data? How skilled are you in data visualisation tools, especially Power BI? What experience do you have with Microsoft Azure Cloud-based tools such as Data Bricks, Data Factory, Synapse Analytics, and Analysis Services? Have you utilised Python in your previous roles?
  • Educational Background: Do you hold a Bachelor's degree (or higher) in a numerical, computer science, or financial discipline?
  • Analytical Skills: How do you interpret complex information to spot trends and "tell a story" back to the business? Can you provide examples of how you distil stakeholder requirements into succinct questions and deliver timely, actionable insights?
  • Communication Skills: How do you adapt your communication style to engage effectively with different audiences? Can you describe a situation where your influencing skills made a significant impact?
  • Project Management: Are you able to self-manage research, design, prioritise, implement, and deliver projects efficiently? How do you ensure that your projects are completed on time?
  • Personal Attributes: Are you willing to learn new tools and skills quickly? What motivates your commitment to follow projects through to completion, and how do you maintain attention to detail in your work?


We are looking for someone who is honest, punctual, takes initiative, and possesses a questioning mindset. If you have the innate drive to improve processes and foster collaboration across the Bank, we would love to hear from you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Key Responsibilities

Sales and Marketing Reporting:


Partner with GTM management to create department-level monthly, quarterly, and annual sales and marketing reports
Analyze and report on key sales and marketing metrics to provide insights and recommendations for continuous improvement
Prepare and distribute quarterly QBR (Quarterly Business Review) decks, ensuring accuracy and relevance of the data presented


Process Improvement And Automation


Identify opportunities to improve reporting processes and drive efficiencies through automation
Collaborate with IT and other stakeholders to manage and optimize reporting tools such as Salesforce (SFDC) and Tableau


Salesforce (SFDC) Responsibilities


Oversee non-standard quote approvals, requiring detailed analysis to ensure compliance with company policies
Maintain Salesforce hygiene by ensuring data integrity and consistency across the platform
Serve as a key point of contact for Salesforce-related inquiries and issues, working closely with IT to resolve them


Data Management And Analysis


Manage Tableau dashboards and reports, working closely with IT to ensure they meet the needs of the business
Provide ad-hoc sales and marketing analysis as required, delivering actionable insights that support strategic decision-making
Distil large amounts of data into key findings that are easily understood by stakeholders at all levels of the organization


Collaboration And Communication


Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, finance, and IT, to ensure alignment on data needs and reporting requirements
Communicate complex data findings clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical audiences
Foster strong relationships with GTM leaders to understand their needs and provide tailored analytical support


Skills/Requirements


Education: BA/BS in Business Administration, Data Science, Finance, Economics, or a related field
Experience: 5-10 years of data-related experience with a record of strong achievement
Technical Skills: Expertise in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word. Prior experience with Salesforce (SFDC), Tableau, Adaptive Planning, and Oracle is preferred
Analytical Skills: Ability to distill large amounts of data and summarize key findings. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Communication Skills: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights to a diverse set of stakeholders
Other Requirements: Self-motivated with a positive attitude and the ability to complete projects in tight time frames with minimal supervision. A team player who enjoys collaborating with people from different functions and backgrounds

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Cardiff

£40,000 – £50,000




Imagine being part of something that’s truly making a difference. Our client, a pioneering comparison platform for everything related to house buying and moving, is on a mission to revolutionise the way people experience one of the most significant moments of their lives. Data is at the heart of this transformation—powering insights, improving decision-making, and driving strategic growth.




As a Data Analyst, you won’t just be crunching numbers—you’ll be uncovering trends, identifying opportunities, and shaping the future of the industry. Your insights will directly impact business decisions, helping millions of people navigate one of life’s most stressful processes with confidence. Our client is currently on the lookout for someone who doesn’t just work with data but thrives on turning raw numbers into meaningful insights. Someone who is passionate about analytics, excited by the potential of data-driven strategies, and eager to be part of a purpose-driven team. If you have the analytical mindset, technical expertise, and a desire to make a real impact, this could be the next step in your career.




About the role

Work closely with senior leadership and heads of departments to deliver data insights that drive growth, efficiency, and business performance
Develop custom dashboards and reports to monitor KPIs
Support forecasting, business planning, and strategic decision-making
Analyse customer behaviour to inform business strategies
Analyse internal processes and operational workflows to identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and opportunities for automation
Identify operational inefficiencies and recommend automation opportunities
Ensure data integrity and compliance with GDPR and internal policies
Collaborate with the Dev Team to improve data infrastructure
Partner with the Dev Team to improve data infrastructure, ensuring seamless data collection and integration
Stay up to date with emerging tools and best practices in data analytics




About you

Strong ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable business insights
Proficient in presenting data clearly to both technical and non-technical teams
Detail-oriented with excellent problem-solving skills
Experience working cross-functionally with senior leadership and department heads
Skilled at identifying patterns and trends in data




Bonus Points

Experience with data analysis, visualisation tools and business intelligence platforms
Experience working in a fast-paced commercial environment
Familiarity with customer segmentation and predictive analytics




What’s in it for you

A competitive salary: £40,000 – £50,000
Flexible working
Annual salary upgrades to keep things exciting
Take your birthday off to celebrate YOU!
Additional 2 weeks off at Christmas!!!
Free parking
Exciting growth opportunities for your professional development




Ready to make a real impact on the home-buying journey? Apply now or contact Chengi at Page 1 Recruitment on 0114 700 3533.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking to start a career in data analysis but don’t have prior experience? Join our team as a Trainee Data Analyst, and we will provide all the training you need to succeed in this exciting field.

This role is perfect for someone analytical, curious, and eager to learn, with a passion for working with data.

As a Trainee Data Analyst, you will work alongside experienced professionals and gain hands-on experience in data processing, analysis, and visualisation.

We’re committed to your development and will support you every step of the way as you grow into a skilled data analyst.

Responsibilities


Data Collection & Processing: Assist in gathering, cleaning, and organising large datasets from multiple sources.
Data Analysis: Learn how to perform basic data analysis, generate insights, and identify trends using various tools and techniques.
Reporting & Visualisation: Help create reports and data visualisations to communicate findings to stakeholders, learning how to present data in an easy-to-understand format.
Collaboration: Work closely with senior analysts and other departments to understand business needs and contribute to ongoing projects.
Learning & Development: Participate in training sessions and apply new skills to real-world projects, with the opportunity to specialise in areas such as data science, business intelligence, or machine learning.
Documentation & Process Improvement: Assist with documenting analysis processes and identifying areas where data workflows can be optimised.


Requirements

We are looking for someone who has:


A passion for data and problem-solving.
Strong attention to detail and a methodical approach.
An eagerness to learn new tools and techniques.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a team.


This role is Ideal for someone with no prior data experience but a keen interest in starting a career in data analysis.

Benefits


Comprehensive Training: Receive full training in data analysis, including tools like Excel, SQL, Power BI, Python, and more.
Career Development: Access to mentorship, career guidance, and opportunities for advancement as you grow in your role.
Hybrid Working: Enjoy a flexible work arrangement with a combination of remote work and office-based collaboration.
Supportive Team: Join a friendly, inclusive team that encourages growth and learning.
Competitive Salary: Receive a competitive starting salary with performance-based increases.
Health & Wellbeing: Access to health benefits and wellbeing initiatives.
Paid Time Off: Generous annual leave and public holiday allowances to support a healthy work-life balance.
Professional Growth: Opportunities to take on more responsibilities and specialise in areas of data analysis that interest you.

Title: Data Analysis and Visualisation Intern
Description:
About Us

One team. Global challenges. Infinite opportunities. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. For more than 35 years, Viasat has helped shape how consumers, businesses, governments and militaries around the globe communicate. We’re looking for people who think big, act fearlessly, and create an inclusive environment that drives positive impact to join our team.

What You'll Do

In the Service Performance Analysis team, we focus on understanding the real-time and historical performance of Viasat services to identify and address issues promptly. We monitor connectivity status, network congestion, and service interruptions, and we analyse data trends to support proactive issue resolution and data-driven decisions. Accuracy of service metrics for reporting and maintaining high service quality is key to the company!

The day-to-day


Use existing dashboards to detect trends and report potential issues
Collaborate with the team to build data visualisations and dashboards
Conduct ad hoc analyses as needed to support business decisions
Improve our data analysis and visualization processes by researching and testing new tools and techniques



Internship Programme Details:


You will work onsite at the Viasat London office for the duration of your 12-13 week internship. Viasat embraces a flexible work environment and onsite/hybrid work is determined by individual roles and teams.
To ensure equity across our intern population, intern compensation is pre-determined based on a variety of factors including: role, location, and final graduation date. Intern compensation is non-negotiable.



What You'll Need

Education Requirements:


Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree or higher in Data Science or related field (e.g., computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics)
To be eligible for this position you must complete your degree between December 2025 and Summer 2026



Internship Dates:


You must be available for the full duration of the 12-13 week internship programme. Note limited exceptions may be granted.
Cohort 1: 17th June 2025 - 12th September 2025



Additional Requirements:


Familiarity with statistics and machine learning concepts
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau
Proficiency in SQL and understanding of database structures
Knowledge of Python programming, Pandas and matplotlib libraries



What Will Help You On The Job


Currently pursuing a Master's degree is preferred
Experience with data cleaning, transformation, and normalization
Experience with Google BigQuery
Git and version control



EEO Statement

Viasat is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, genetics, age, or veteran status or any other applicable legally protected status or characteristic. If you would like to request an accommodation on the basis of disability for completing this on-line application, please click here.
